content: 1 And there was a certain man､ of Ramathaimzuphi､ of the hill country of Ephraim,—whose name was Elkanah､ son of Jeroham､ son of Elihu､ son of Tohu､ son of Zuph､ an Ephraimite;
content_old: 1 And there was a certain man､ of Ramathaimzuphi､ of the hill country of Ephraim,—whose name was Elkanah､ son of Jeroham､ son of Elihu､ son of Tohu､ son of Zuph､ an Ephraimite;

content: 2 and he had two wives, the name of the one Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah,—and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
content_old: 2 and he had two wives, the name of the one Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah,—and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

content: 3 So then that man went up､ out of his city､ from time to time, to worship and to sacrifice unto Yahweh of hosts､ in Shiloh,—and there were the two sons of Eli､ Hophni and Phinehas, priests unto Yahweh.
content_old: 3 So then that man went up､ out of his city､ from time to time, to worship and to sacrifice unto Yahweh of hosts､ in Shiloh,—and there were the two sons of Eli､ Hophni and Phinehas, priests unto Yahweh.

content: 4 And when the day came for Elkanah to sacrifice he used to give to Peninnah his wife､ and to all her sons and her daughters portions;
content_old: 4 And when the day came for Elkanah to sacrifice he used to give to Peninnah his wife､ and to all her sons and her daughters portions;

content: 5 and unto Hannah used he to give one portion,—howbeit Hannah he loved, although Yahweh had restrained her from having children.
content_old: 5 and unto Hannah used he to give one portion,—howbeit Hannah he loved, although Yahweh had restrained her from having children.

content: 6 And her rival used even to cause her great vexation, for the sake of provoking her,—because Yahweh had restrained her from having children.
content_old: 6 And her rival used even to cause her great vexation, for the sake of provoking her,—because Yahweh had restrained her from having children.

content: 7 And thus used she to do､ year by year､ whenever she went up to the house of Yahweh, thus used she to vex her,—and she wept､ and would not eat.
content_old: 7 And thus used she to do､ year by year､ whenever she went up to the house of Yahweh, thus used she to vex her,—and she wept､ and would not eat.

content: 8 So Elkanah her husband said to her— Hannah! wherefore shouldst thou weep? and wherefore wilt thou not eat? and wherefore should thy heart be sad? Am I not better to thee than ten sons?
content_old: 8 So Elkanah her husband said to her— Hannah! wherefore shouldst thou weep? and wherefore wilt thou not eat? and wherefore should thy heart be sad? Am I not better to thee than ten sons?

content: 9 And Hannah rose up, after she had eaten in Shiloh､ and after she had drunk,—and Eli the priest was sitting upon his chair, by the door-post of the temple of Yahweh;
content_old: 9 And Hannah rose up, after she had eaten in Shiloh､ and after she had drunk,—and Eli the priest was sitting upon his chair, by the door-post of the temple of Yahweh;

content: 10 and she being in bitterness of soul prayed unto Yahweh､ and wept sore.
content_old: 10 and she being in bitterness of soul prayed unto Yahweh､ and wept sore.

content: 11 And she vowed a vow､ and said— Yahweh of hosts! If thou wilt look upon the humiliation of thy handmaid､ And remember me､ And not forget thy handmaid, But wilt give unto thy handmaid a man-child Then will I give him unto Yahweh､ all the days of his life, And no razor shall come upon his head.
content_old: 11 And she vowed a vow､ and said— Yahweh of hosts! If thou wilt look upon the humiliation of thy handmaid､ And remember me､ And not forget thy handmaid, But wilt give unto thy handmaid a man-child Then will I give him unto Yahweh､ all the days of his life, And no razor shall come upon his head.

content: 12 And so it was as she continued praying before Yahweh that Eli was watching her mouth.
content_old: 12 And so it was as she continued praying before Yahweh that Eli was watching her mouth.

content: 13 But as for Hannah she was speaking in her heart, only her lips were moving, but her voice could not be heard,—so Eli thought she had been drunken.
content_old: 13 But as for Hannah she was speaking in her heart, only her lips were moving, but her voice could not be heard,—so Eli thought she had been drunken.

content: 14 And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? Put away thy wine from thee.
content_old: 14 And Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? Put away thy wine from thee.

content: 15 And Hannah responded and said— Nay! my lord; A woman depressed in spirit am I: Neither wine nor strong drink have I drunk,—but I poured out my soul､ before Yahweh.
content_old: 15 And Hannah responded and said— Nay! my lord; A woman depressed in spirit am I: Neither wine nor strong drink have I drunk,—but I poured out my soul､ before Yahweh.

content: 16 Do not count thy handmaid for an abandoned woman,—for out of the abundance of my grief and my vexation have I spoken hitherto.
content_old: 16 Do not count thy handmaid for an abandoned woman,—for out of the abundance of my grief and my vexation have I spoken hitherto.

content: 17 Then responded Eli､ and said— Go and prosper! And the God of Israel grant thy petition which thou hast asked of him!
content_old: 17 Then responded Eli､ and said— Go and prosper! And the God of Israel grant thy petition which thou hast asked of him!

content: 18 And she said: Let thy serving-woman find favour､ in thine eyes. So the woman went her way､ and did eat, and her countenance was sad no longer.
content_old: 18 And she said: Let thy serving-woman find favour､ in thine eyes. So the woman went her way､ and did eat, and her countenance was sad no longer.

content: 19 And they rose up early in the morning､ and worshipped before Yahweh, and returned, and entered their own house､ in Ramah,—and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife, and Yahweh remembered her.
content_old: 19 And they rose up early in the morning､ and worshipped before Yahweh, and returned, and entered their own house､ in Ramah,—and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife, and Yahweh remembered her.

content: 20 And so it was when the days had come round during which Hannah was with child that she bare a son,—and called his name Samuel , Because, of Yahweh I asked him.
content_old: 20 And so it was when the days had come round during which Hannah was with child that she bare a son,—and called his name Samuel , Because, of Yahweh I asked him.

content: 21 And the man Elkanah､ and all his house､ went up, to offer unto Yahweh the yearly sacrifice､ and each his own vow.
content_old: 21 And the man Elkanah､ and all his house､ went up, to offer unto Yahweh the yearly sacrifice､ and each his own vow.

content: 22 But Hannah went not up,—for she said to her husband— Not till the boy is weaned､ Then will I take him, And he shall appear before Yahweh, And abide there evermore.
content_old: 22 But Hannah went not up,—for she said to her husband— Not till the boy is weaned､ Then will I take him, And he shall appear before Yahweh, And abide there evermore.

content: 23 And Elkanah her husband said to her— Do what is good in thine own eyes､ tarry until thou have weaned him, Only may Yahweh establish his word! So the woman tarried､ and nursed her son, until she weaned him.
content_old: 23 And Elkanah her husband said to her— Do what is good in thine own eyes､ tarry until thou have weaned him, Only may Yahweh establish his word! So the woman tarried､ and nursed her son, until she weaned him.

content: 24 Then took she him up with her､ when she had weaned him, with a bullock of three years old､ and one ephah of meal､ and a skin of wine, and took him to the house of Yahweh､ at Shiloh,—the boy yet being young.
content_old: 24 Then took she him up with her､ when she had weaned him, with a bullock of three years old､ and one ephah of meal､ and a skin of wine, and took him to the house of Yahweh､ at Shiloh,—the boy yet being young.

content: 25 So they slew the bullock,—and took the boy in､ unto Eli.
content_old: 25 So they slew the bullock,—and took the boy in､ unto Eli.

content: 26 And she said— Pardon､ my lord! By the life of thy soul my lord,—I am the woman who was standing near thee here, praying unto Yahweh:
content_old: 26 And she said— Pardon､ my lord! By the life of thy soul my lord,—I am the woman who was standing near thee here, praying unto Yahweh:

content: 27 For this boy I prayed,— And Yahweh hath given me my petition which I asked of him.
content_old: 27 For this boy I prayed,— And Yahweh hath given me my petition which I asked of him.

content: 1 Then prayed Hannah､ and said, My heart hath leaped for joy in Yahweh, My horn is exalted in Yahweh, My mouth is opened wide､ over my foes, Because I rejoice in thy salvation.
content_old: 1 Then prayed Hannah､ and said, My heart hath leaped for joy in Yahweh, My horn is exalted in Yahweh, My mouth is opened wide､ over my foes, Because I rejoice in thy salvation.

content: 2 There is none holy like Yahweh､ Nay! there is none except Thee, Nor is there a rock､ like our God.
content_old: 2 There is none holy like Yahweh､ Nay! there is none except Thee, Nor is there a rock､ like our God.

content: 3 Do not multiply words､ so loftily—loftily, Nor let arrogance proceed from your mouth,—For a GOD of knowledge is Yahweh, And for himself are great doings made firm.
content_old: 3 Do not multiply words､ so loftily—loftily, Nor let arrogance proceed from your mouth,—For a GOD of knowledge is Yahweh, And for himself are great doings made firm.

content: 4 The bow of the mighty is dismayed,— While the fainting are girded with strength;
content_old: 4 The bow of the mighty is dismayed,— While the fainting are girded with strength;

content: 5 The sated have､ for bread､ taken hire, But the famished have left off their toil,— So that the barren hath given birth unto seven, While she that hath many sons languisheth:
content_old: 5 The sated have､ for bread､ taken hire, But the famished have left off their toil,— So that the barren hath given birth unto seven, While she that hath many sons languisheth:

content: 6 Yahweh doth kill､ and make alive,— Taketh down to hades､ and bringeth up:
content_old: 6 Yahweh doth kill､ and make alive,— Taketh down to hades､ and bringeth up:

content: 7 Yahweh maketh poor､ and enricheth,—Layeth low､ yea exalteth;
content_old: 7 Yahweh maketh poor､ and enricheth,—Layeth low､ yea exalteth;

content: 8 Raiseth､ from the dust､ the poor, From the dunghill uplifteth the needy, To give them a dwelling with nobles, And a throne of glory to make them inherit. For to Yahweh belong the pillars of the earth, And he setteth thereon the habitable world.
content_old: 8 Raiseth､ from the dust､ the poor, From the dunghill uplifteth the needy, To give them a dwelling with nobles, And a throne of glory to make them inherit. For to Yahweh belong the pillars of the earth, And he setteth thereon the habitable world.

content: 9 The feet of his loving ones he doth guard, But the lawless in darkness shall be silent,— For by strength shall no man prevail.
content_old: 9 The feet of his loving ones he doth guard, But the lawless in darkness shall be silent,— For by strength shall no man prevail.

content: 10 As for Yahweh—they shall be shattered who contend with him､ Over him in the heavens will he thunder, Yahweh will judge the ends of the earth,—That he may give strength to his King, And exalt the horn of his Anointed One.
content_old: 10 As for Yahweh—they shall be shattered who contend with him､ Over him in the heavens will he thunder, Yahweh will judge the ends of the earth,—That he may give strength to his King, And exalt the horn of his Anointed One.

content: 11 Then went Elkanah to Ramah､ unto his own house,—but the boy remained ministering unto Yahweh, before Eli the priest.
content_old: 11 Then went Elkanah to Ramah､ unto his own house,—but the boy remained ministering unto Yahweh, before Eli the priest.

content: 12 Now the sons of Eli were abandoned men,—they knew not Yahweh.
content_old: 12 Now the sons of Eli were abandoned men,—they knew not Yahweh.

content: 13 And the custom of the priests with the people was—when any man offered a sacrifice then would come the priest’s young man､ as the flesh was boiling, with a three-pronged fork in his hand;
content_old: 13 And the custom of the priests with the people was—when any man offered a sacrifice then would come the priest’s young man､ as the flesh was boiling, with a three-pronged fork in his hand;

content: 14 and would strike it into the boiler､ or into the trough､ or into the kettle､ or into the pot, all that the fork would bring up the priest took for himself. Thus and thus used they to do unto all Israel, who came thither､ in Shiloh.
content_old: 14 and would strike it into the boiler､ or into the trough､ or into the kettle､ or into the pot, all that the fork would bring up the priest took for himself. Thus and thus used they to do unto all Israel, who came thither､ in Shiloh.

content: 15 Also before any could make perfume with the fat the priest’s young man would come in and say to the person who was sacrificing, Come! give flesh for the priest’s roastings,—for he will not take of thee boiled flesh—only raw.
content_old: 15 Also before any could make perfume with the fat the priest’s young man would come in and say to the person who was sacrificing, Come! give flesh for the priest’s roastings,—for he will not take of thee boiled flesh—only raw.

content: 16 And if the man said to him, Let them at least make incense at once､ with the fat, then take thou as much as thy soul craveth Then said he to him, But at once shalt thou give it; or else I will take it by force.
content_old: 16 And if the man said to him, Let them at least make incense at once､ with the fat, then take thou as much as thy soul craveth Then said he to him, But at once shalt thou give it; or else I will take it by force.

content: 17 And so it was､ that the sin of the young men was exceeding great､ before Yahweh,—for men scorned the offerings of Yahweh.
content_old: 17 And so it was､ that the sin of the young men was exceeding great､ before Yahweh,—for men scorned the offerings of Yahweh.

content: 18 But as for Samuel he was ministering before Yahweh,—a boy girded with an ephod of linen.
content_old: 18 But as for Samuel he was ministering before Yahweh,—a boy girded with an ephod of linen.

content: 19 Also a little robe used his mother to make for him, and bring it up to him､ from year to year,—when she came up with her husband, to offer the sacrifice of the year.
content_old: 19 Also a little robe used his mother to make for him, and bring it up to him､ from year to year,—when she came up with her husband, to offer the sacrifice of the year.

content: 20 And Eli used to bless Elkanah and his wife､ and to say— Yahweh give thee seed of this woman, instead of the loan that hath been lent unto Yahweh. So they went their way to his own place.
content_old: 20 And Eli used to bless Elkanah and his wife､ and to say— Yahweh give thee seed of this woman, instead of the loan that hath been lent unto Yahweh. So they went their way to his own place.

content: 21 And Yahweh visited Hannah, and she conceived､ and bare three sons､ and two daughters. Thus did the boy Samuel grow up with Yahweh.
content_old: 21 And Yahweh visited Hannah, and she conceived､ and bare three sons､ and two daughters. Thus did the boy Samuel grow up with Yahweh.

content: 22 Now Eli was very old,—but he used to hear all that his sons did unto all Israel, and how they even lay with the women who did service､ at the opening of the tent of meeting.
content_old: 22 Now Eli was very old,—but he used to hear all that his sons did unto all Israel, and how they even lay with the women who did service､ at the opening of the tent of meeting.

content: 23 So he said to them, Wherefore should ye do such things as these? for I keep hearing of your wicked doings, from all these people.
content_old: 23 So he said to them, Wherefore should ye do such things as these? for I keep hearing of your wicked doings, from all these people.

content: 24 Nay､ my sons! for it is no good report that I do hear: leading into transgression the people of Yahweh.
content_old: 24 Nay､ my sons! for it is no good report that I do hear: leading into transgression the people of Yahweh.

content: 25 If one man sin against another God will interpose, but if against Yahweh a man sin who will intercede for him? But they hearkened not unto the voice of their father, for Yahweh was pleased to put them to death.
content_old: 25 If one man sin against another God will interpose, but if against Yahweh a man sin who will intercede for him? But they hearkened not unto the voice of their father, for Yahweh was pleased to put them to death.

content: 26 But the boy Samuel went on growing in stature､ and in favour,—both with Yahweh, and also with men.
content_old: 26 But the boy Samuel went on growing in stature､ and in favour,—both with Yahweh, and also with men.

content: 27 And there came a man of God､ unto Eli,—and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh, I did indeed reveal myself unto the house､ of thy father, when they were in Egypt､ as servants unto the house of Pharaoh;
content_old: 27 And there came a man of God､ unto Eli,—and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh, I did indeed reveal myself unto the house､ of thy father, when they were in Egypt､ as servants unto the house of Pharaoh;

content: 28 choosing him out of all the tribes of Israel unto myself､ To minister as priest, To offer upon mine altar､ To perfume with incense､ To bear an ephod before me,— Therefore gave I unto the house of thy father all the altar-flames of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 28 choosing him out of all the tribes of Israel unto myself､ To minister as priest, To offer upon mine altar､ To perfume with incense､ To bear an ephod before me,— Therefore gave I unto the house of thy father all the altar-flames of the sons of Israel.

content: 29 Wherefore have ye been kicking at my sacrifices､ and my presents, which I commanded､ to serve for a home,—and shouldest have honoured thy sons more than me: fattening yourselves､ with the first of every present of Israel､ before me?
content_old: 29 Wherefore have ye been kicking at my sacrifices､ and my presents, which I commanded､ to serve for a home,—and shouldest have honoured thy sons more than me: fattening yourselves､ with the first of every present of Israel､ before me?

content: 30 Hence the oracle of Yahweh God of Israel, I said that thy house､ and the house of thy father should go to and fro in my presence､ unto times age-abiding: But now (is the oracle of Yahweh)— Be it far from me! For them who honour me will I honour､ But they who despise me shall be lightly esteemed.
content_old: 30 Hence the oracle of Yahweh God of Israel, I said that thy house､ and the house of thy father should go to and fro in my presence､ unto times age-abiding: But now (is the oracle of Yahweh)— Be it far from me! For them who honour me will I honour､ But they who despise me shall be lightly esteemed.

content: 31 Lo! days are coming, when I will hew off thine arm, and the arm of the house of thy father,—that there shall be no elder in thy house;
content_old: 31 Lo! days are coming, when I will hew off thine arm, and the arm of the house of thy father,—that there shall be no elder in thy house;

content: 32 But thou shalt descry distress at home, in all that shall gladden Israel,—and there shall not be an elder in thine own house､ all the days.
content_old: 32 But thou shalt descry distress at home, in all that shall gladden Israel,—and there shall not be an elder in thine own house､ all the days.

content: 33 But any man of thine whom I may not cut off from mine altar it shall be— To consume his eyes, And grieve his soul; Howbeit all the multitude of thy house shall die by the sword of men.
content_old: 33 But any man of thine whom I may not cut off from mine altar it shall be— To consume his eyes, And grieve his soul; Howbeit all the multitude of thy house shall die by the sword of men.

content: 34 And this for thee is the sign, which shall come upon thy two sons, upon Hophni､ and Phinehas,— In one day shall they both of them die;
content_old: 34 And this for thee is the sign, which shall come upon thy two sons, upon Hophni､ and Phinehas,— In one day shall they both of them die;

content: 35 And I will raise me up a faithful priest, According to that which is in my heart and in my soul will he do; Therefore will I build for him an assured house, And he shall go to and fro in presence of mine Anointed､ all the days.
content_old: 35 And I will raise me up a faithful priest, According to that which is in my heart and in my soul will he do; Therefore will I build for him an assured house, And he shall go to and fro in presence of mine Anointed､ all the days.

content: 1 Now the boy Samuel was ministering unto Yahweh､ before Eli,—and the word of Yahweh had become rare in those days, there was no well-known vision.
content_old: 1 Now the boy Samuel was ministering unto Yahweh､ before Eli,—and the word of Yahweh had become rare in those days, there was no well-known vision.

content: 2 But it came to pass, at that time when Eli was lying down in his place, his eyes having begun to be dim, he could not see,
content_old: 2 But it came to pass, at that time when Eli was lying down in his place, his eyes having begun to be dim, he could not see,

content: 3 though the lamp of God was not yet to be put out, and Samuel was lying down in the temple of Yahweh, where was the ark of God
content_old: 3 though the lamp of God was not yet to be put out, and Samuel was lying down in the temple of Yahweh, where was the ark of God

content: 4 that Yahweh called unto Samuel､ and he said— Behold me!
content_old: 4 that Yahweh called unto Samuel､ and he said— Behold me!

content: 5 So he ran unto Eli and said— Behold me! for thou calledst me. And he said— I called not､ return—lie down. So he went､ and lay down.
content_old: 5 So he ran unto Eli and said— Behold me! for thou calledst me. And he said— I called not､ return—lie down. So he went､ and lay down.

content: 6 And again Yahweh called once more— Samuel! Then rose Samuel､ and went unto Eli, and said—Behold me! for thou calledst me. And he said— I called not､ my son, return—lie down.
content_old: 6 And again Yahweh called once more— Samuel! Then rose Samuel､ and went unto Eli, and said—Behold me! for thou calledst me. And he said— I called not､ my son, return—lie down.

content: 7 Now Samuel as yet knew not Yahweh,—nor as yet had been revealed unto him the word of Yahweh.
content_old: 7 Now Samuel as yet knew not Yahweh,—nor as yet had been revealed unto him the word of Yahweh.

content: 8 And again Yahweh called— Samuel! a third time. Then he arose､ and went unto Eli, and said— Behold me! for thou calledst me. Then did Eli perceive, that Yahweh was calling the boy.
content_old: 8 And again Yahweh called— Samuel! a third time. Then he arose､ and went unto Eli, and said— Behold me! for thou calledst me. Then did Eli perceive, that Yahweh was calling the boy.

content: 9 So Eli said to Samuel— Go､ lie down, and it shall be if he call unto thee that thou shalt say— Speak､ Yahweh, for thy servant is listening. And Samuel went, and lay down in his place.
content_old: 9 So Eli said to Samuel— Go､ lie down, and it shall be if he call unto thee that thou shalt say— Speak､ Yahweh, for thy servant is listening. And Samuel went, and lay down in his place.

content: 10 Then came Yahweh､ and stood, and called as time after time— Samuel! Samuel! And Samuel said— Speak, for thy servant is listening.
content_old: 10 Then came Yahweh､ and stood, and called as time after time— Samuel! Samuel! And Samuel said— Speak, for thy servant is listening.

content: 11 And Yahweh said unto Samuel, Lo! I am doing a thing､ in Israel,—at which both ears of everyone that heareth it shall tingle.
content_old: 11 And Yahweh said unto Samuel, Lo! I am doing a thing､ in Israel,—at which both ears of everyone that heareth it shall tingle.

content: 12 In that day will I confirm against Eli, all that I have spoken against his house,—beginning and finishing.
content_old: 12 In that day will I confirm against Eli, all that I have spoken against his house,—beginning and finishing.

content: 13 Therefore do I tell him, that I am about to judge his house unto times age-abiding,—for the iniquity which he knoweth､ in that his sons are cursing God, and he hath not rebuked them.
content_old: 13 Therefore do I tell him, that I am about to judge his house unto times age-abiding,—for the iniquity which he knoweth､ in that his sons are cursing God, and he hath not rebuked them.

content: 14 And therefore have I sworn､ respecting the house of Eli,—that the iniquity of the house of Eli shall receive no propitiatory-covering､ by sacrifice or by present､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 14 And therefore have I sworn､ respecting the house of Eli,—that the iniquity of the house of Eli shall receive no propitiatory-covering､ by sacrifice or by present､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 15 And Samuel lay until the morning, and rose early in the morning､ and opened the doors of the house of Yahweh,—but Samuel feared to tell the appearing､ unto Eli.
content_old: 15 And Samuel lay until the morning, and rose early in the morning､ and opened the doors of the house of Yahweh,—but Samuel feared to tell the appearing､ unto Eli.

content: 16 So Eli called Samuel. and said— Samuel! my son. And he said— Behold me!
content_old: 16 So Eli called Samuel. and said— Samuel! my son. And he said— Behold me!

content: 17 And he said— What is the word､ which he spake unto thee? I pray thee､ do not hide it from me. So let God do to thee､ and so let him add､ if thou hide from me a word, out of anything which he hath spoken unto thee.
content_old: 17 And he said— What is the word､ which he spake unto thee? I pray thee､ do not hide it from me. So let God do to thee､ and so let him add､ if thou hide from me a word, out of anything which he hath spoken unto thee.

content: 18 So Samuel told him all the words, and hid nothing from him. And he said, Yahweh he is; what is good in his own eyes let him do.
content_old: 18 So Samuel told him all the words, and hid nothing from him. And he said, Yahweh he is; what is good in his own eyes let him do.

content: 19 And Samuel grew,—and Yahweh proved to be with him, and let none of all his words fall to the ground.
content_old: 19 And Samuel grew,—and Yahweh proved to be with him, and let none of all his words fall to the ground.

content: 20 So all Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, came to know,—that Samuel had become confirmed as a prophet unto Yahweh.
content_old: 20 So all Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, came to know,—that Samuel had become confirmed as a prophet unto Yahweh.

content: 1 And so it was when the word of Samuel had reached all Israel that Israel went forth to meet the Philistines in battle､ and they encamped near Eben-ezer, while the Philistines encamped in Aphek.
content_old: 1 And so it was when the word of Samuel had reached all Israel that Israel went forth to meet the Philistines in battle､ and they encamped near Eben-ezer, while the Philistines encamped in Aphek.

content: 2 And the Philistines set themselves in array to meet Israel, and when the battle spread then was Israel smitten before the Philistines,—and there were slain of the army in the field about four thousand men.
content_old: 2 And the Philistines set themselves in array to meet Israel, and when the battle spread then was Israel smitten before the Philistines,—and there were slain of the army in the field about four thousand men.

content: 3 And when the people came into the camp the elders of Israel said, Wherefore hath Yahweh smitten us to-day､ before the Philistines? Let us fetch unto us､ out of Shiloh､ the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, that when it cometh into our midst it may save us out of the hand of our enemies.
content_old: 3 And when the people came into the camp the elders of Israel said, Wherefore hath Yahweh smitten us to-day､ before the Philistines? Let us fetch unto us､ out of Shiloh､ the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, that when it cometh into our midst it may save us out of the hand of our enemies.

content: 4 So the people sent to Shiloh, and bare from thence the ark of the covenant of Yahweh of hosts､ who inhabiteth the cherubim,—and there were the two sons of Eli､ with the ark of the covenant of God, namely, Hophni and Phinehas.
content_old: 4 So the people sent to Shiloh, and bare from thence the ark of the covenant of Yahweh of hosts､ who inhabiteth the cherubim,—and there were the two sons of Eli､ with the ark of the covenant of God, namely, Hophni and Phinehas.

content: 5 And so it was when the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came into the camp that all Israel brake out into a loud shout of joy,—so that the earth rang again.
content_old: 5 And so it was when the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came into the camp that all Israel brake out into a loud shout of joy,—so that the earth rang again.

content: 6 And when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout they said— What meaneth the noise of this loud shout of joy in the camp of the Hebrews? And they learned that the ark of Yahweh had come into the camp.
content_old: 6 And when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout they said— What meaneth the noise of this loud shout of joy in the camp of the Hebrews? And they learned that the ark of Yahweh had come into the camp.

content: 7 And the Philistines were afraid, for they said— God hath come into the camp. And they said— Woe to us! for there hath not happened the like of this､ heretofore.
content_old: 7 And the Philistines were afraid, for they said— God hath come into the camp. And they said— Woe to us! for there hath not happened the like of this､ heretofore.

content: 8 Woe to us! Who shall rescue us out of the hand of these majestic gods? These are the gods､ who smote the Egyptians with all manner of smiting in the desert!
content_old: 8 Woe to us! Who shall rescue us out of the hand of these majestic gods? These are the gods､ who smote the Egyptians with all manner of smiting in the desert!

content: 9 Take courage､ and quit yourselves like men､ ye Philistines, lest ye come into bondage to the Hebrews, as they have been in bondage unto you,—therefore must ye quit yourselves like men､ and fight.
content_old: 9 Take courage､ and quit yourselves like men､ ye Philistines, lest ye come into bondage to the Hebrews, as they have been in bondage unto you,—therefore must ye quit yourselves like men､ and fight.

content: 10 So the Philistines fought､ and Israel was smitten､ and they fled every man to his home; and the slaughter became exceeding great,—and there fell of Israel—thirty thousand footmen.
content_old: 10 So the Philistines fought､ and Israel was smitten､ and they fled every man to his home; and the slaughter became exceeding great,—and there fell of Israel—thirty thousand footmen.

content: 11 And the ark of God was taken,—and the two sons of Eli were slain, Hophni and Phinehas.
content_old: 11 And the ark of God was taken,—and the two sons of Eli were slain, Hophni and Phinehas.

content: 12 And there ran a man of Benjamin out of the army, and entered Shiloh on the same day､—with his clothes rent､ and with earth upon his head.
content_old: 12 And there ran a man of Benjamin out of the army, and entered Shiloh on the same day､—with his clothes rent､ and with earth upon his head.

content: 13 And when he entered lo! Eli was sitting upon his chair､ by the wayside､ watching, for his heart was trembling for the ark of God,—and the man entered to tell the news in the city, and all the city made outcry.
content_old: 13 And when he entered lo! Eli was sitting upon his chair､ by the wayside､ watching, for his heart was trembling for the ark of God,—and the man entered to tell the news in the city, and all the city made outcry.

content: 14 And when Eli heard the noise of the outcry he said— What meaneth the noise of this tumult? And the man hasted, and came､ and told Eli.
content_old: 14 And when Eli heard the noise of the outcry he said— What meaneth the noise of this tumult? And the man hasted, and came､ and told Eli.

content: 15 Now Eli was ninety-eight years old; and his eyes were fixed, that he could not see.
content_old: 15 Now Eli was ninety-eight years old; and his eyes were fixed, that he could not see.

content: 16 So the man said unto Eli— I am he that came in from the army, yea I from the army fled､ to-day. And he said— What is the thing that hath happened､ my son?
content_old: 16 So the man said unto Eli— I am he that came in from the army, yea I from the army fled､ to-day. And he said— What is the thing that hath happened､ my son?

content: 17 And the bearer of tidings answered､ and said��� Israel hath fled before the Philistines, Moreover also a great smiting hath taken place among the people,— Moreover also thy two sons are slain､ Hophni and Phinehas, And the ark of God is taken.
content_old: 17 And the bearer of tidings answered､ and said��� Israel hath fled before the Philistines, Moreover also a great smiting hath taken place among the people,— Moreover also thy two sons are slain､ Hophni and Phinehas, And the ark of God is taken.

content: 18 And it came to pass when he mentioned the ark of God that he fell from off his seat backwards､ at the side of the gate､ and his neck brake､ and he died, for old was the man､ and heavy,—and he had judged Israel forty years.
content_old: 18 And it came to pass when he mentioned the ark of God that he fell from off his seat backwards､ at the side of the gate､ and his neck brake､ and he died, for old was the man､ and heavy,—and he had judged Israel forty years.

content: 19 Now his daughter-in-law､ wife of Phinehas was with child､ ready to give birth, and when she heard the tidings, as to the taking of the ark of God, and the death of her father-in-law､ and her husband she bowed herself and gave birth, for her pains had seized her.
content_old: 19 Now his daughter-in-law､ wife of Phinehas was with child､ ready to give birth, and when she heard the tidings, as to the taking of the ark of God, and the death of her father-in-law､ and her husband she bowed herself and gave birth, for her pains had seized her.

content: 20 And about the time of her death the women that stood by her said: Do not fear､ for to a son hast thou given birth. But she neither answered nor regarded.
content_old: 20 And about the time of her death the women that stood by her said: Do not fear､ for to a son hast thou given birth. But she neither answered nor regarded.

content: 21 And she called the boy I-chabod! saying, Exiled is the glory from Israel,— In regard to the taking of the ark of God, and to her father-in-law､ and to her husband.
content_old: 21 And she called the boy I-chabod! saying, Exiled is the glory from Israel,— In regard to the taking of the ark of God, and to her father-in-law､ and to her husband.

content: 1 Now the Philistines having taken the ark of God,—brought it in from Eben-ezer､ unto Ashdod.
content_old: 1 Now the Philistines having taken the ark of God,—brought it in from Eben-ezer､ unto Ashdod.

content: 2 And when the Philistines took the ark of God they brought it into the house of Dagon,—and placed it by the side of Dagon.
content_old: 2 And when the Philistines took the ark of God they brought it into the house of Dagon,—and placed it by the side of Dagon.

content: 3 And when they of Ashdod rose early on the morrow and entered into the house of Dagon they looked and lo! Dagon was lying prostrate on his face to the earth, before the ark of Yahweh,—so they took Dagon and restored him to his place.
content_old: 3 And when they of Ashdod rose early on the morrow and entered into the house of Dagon they looked and lo! Dagon was lying prostrate on his face to the earth, before the ark of Yahweh,—so they took Dagon and restored him to his place.

content: 4 And when they rose up early in the morning of the morrow lo! Dagon was lying prostrate on his face to the earth, before the ark of Yahweh—and the head of Dagon､ and both the palms of his hands had been cut off against the threshold, only Dagon himself was left to him.
content_old: 4 And when they rose up early in the morning of the morrow lo! Dagon was lying prostrate on his face to the earth, before the ark of Yahweh—and the head of Dagon､ and both the palms of his hands had been cut off against the threshold, only Dagon himself was left to him.

content: 5 For this cause do not the priests of Dagon､ nor any that enter into the house of Dagon､ tread upon the threshold of Dagon､ in Ashdod,—until this day.
content_old: 5 For this cause do not the priests of Dagon､ nor any that enter into the house of Dagon､ tread upon the threshold of Dagon､ in Ashdod,—until this day.

content: 6 Then was the hand of Yahweh heavy against them of Ashdod､ and he astounded them,—and smote with tumours Ashdod and her bounds.
content_old: 6 Then was the hand of Yahweh heavy against them of Ashdod､ and he astounded them,—and smote with tumours Ashdod and her bounds.

content: 7 And when the men of Ashdod saw that so it was then kept they saying､ Let not the ark of the God of Israel abide with us, for hard is his hand upon us, and upon Dagon our god.
content_old: 7 And when the men of Ashdod saw that so it was then kept they saying､ Let not the ark of the God of Israel abide with us, for hard is his hand upon us, and upon Dagon our god.

content: 8 So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines unto them､ and said— What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel? And they said: To Gath let the ark of the God of Israel go round. So they took round the ark of the God of Israel.
content_old: 8 So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines unto them､ and said— What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel? And they said: To Gath let the ark of the God of Israel go round. So they took round the ark of the God of Israel.

content: 9 And so it was after they had taken it round then was the hand of Yahweh against the city､ with an exceeding great consternation, and he smote the men of the city､ from the least､ even unto the greatest,—and they brake out with tumours.
content_old: 9 And so it was after they had taken it round then was the hand of Yahweh against the city､ with an exceeding great consternation, and he smote the men of the city､ from the least､ even unto the greatest,—and they brake out with tumours.

content: 10 Then sent they the ark of God to Ekron,—and so it was when the ark of God entered Ekron that the Ekronites made outcry､ saying— They have brought round unto me the ark of the God of Israel, to slay me､ and my people!
content_old: 10 Then sent they the ark of God to Ekron,—and so it was when the ark of God entered Ekron that the Ekronites made outcry､ saying— They have brought round unto me the ark of the God of Israel, to slay me､ and my people!

content: 11 So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and said— Send away the ark of the God of Israel､ and restore it to its own place, that it slay not me､ and my people. For there had come a deadly consternation､ throughout all the city, heavy exceedingly was the hand of God there.
content_old: 11 So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and said— Send away the ark of the God of Israel､ and restore it to its own place, that it slay not me､ and my people. For there had come a deadly consternation､ throughout all the city, heavy exceedingly was the hand of God there.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ that the ark of Yahweh was in the country of the Philistines､ seven months.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ that the ark of Yahweh was in the country of the Philistines､ seven months.

content: 2 Then called the Philistines for the priests and for the diviners, saying, What shall we do with the ark of Yahweh? Let us know､ wherewith we shall send it to its own place.
content_old: 2 Then called the Philistines for the priests and for the diviners, saying, What shall we do with the ark of Yahweh? Let us know､ wherewith we shall send it to its own place.

content: 3 And they said— If ye are going to send away the ark of the God of Israel do not send it away empty, but ye must surely return to him a guilt-offering,—then shall ye be healed､ and it shall be known to you, wherefore his hand would not turn away from you.
content_old: 3 And they said— If ye are going to send away the ark of the God of Israel do not send it away empty, but ye must surely return to him a guilt-offering,—then shall ye be healed､ and it shall be known to you, wherefore his hand would not turn away from you.

content: 4 And they said— What shall be the guilt-offering､ that we shall return to him? And they said— By the number of the lords of the Philistines five tumours of gold, and five mice of gold,—for one plague was on you all､ and on your lords.
content_old: 4 And they said— What shall be the guilt-offering､ that we shall return to him? And they said— By the number of the lords of the Philistines five tumours of gold, and five mice of gold,—for one plague was on you all､ and on your lords.

content: 5 Wherefore ye shall make likenesses of your tumours､ and likenesses of your mice that are laying waste the land, and shall give unto the God of Israel glory,— Peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your god and from off your land.
content_old: 5 Wherefore ye shall make likenesses of your tumours､ and likenesses of your mice that are laying waste the land, and shall give unto the God of Israel glory,— Peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your god and from off your land.

content: 6 Wherefore､ then､ should ye make your heart dull, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh made their heart dull! When he had done his great doings upon them did they not let them go､ and they departed?
content_old: 6 Wherefore､ then､ should ye make your heart dull, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh made their heart dull! When he had done his great doings upon them did they not let them go､ and they departed?

content: 7 Now､ therefore､ take and get ready､ one new waggon, and two milch kine､ whereon hath never come yoke,—then shall ye fasten the kine in the waggon, and withdraw their calves from them､ into the shed;
content_old: 7 Now､ therefore､ take and get ready､ one new waggon, and two milch kine､ whereon hath never come yoke,—then shall ye fasten the kine in the waggon, and withdraw their calves from them､ into the shed;

content: 8 and ye shall take the ark of Yahweh､ and place it in the waggon, also the jewels of gold which ye send back to him as a guilt-offering shall ye put into a coffer､ at the side thereof,—so shall ye let it go､ and it shall depart.
content_old: 8 and ye shall take the ark of Yahweh､ and place it in the waggon, also the jewels of gold which ye send back to him as a guilt-offering shall ye put into a coffer､ at the side thereof,—so shall ye let it go､ and it shall depart.

content: 9 Then shall ye look—if by the way of its own boundary it goeth up to Beth-shemesh he it was who caused us this great affliction,—but if not then shall we know that it was not his hand that smote us, a chance it was､ that befell us.
content_old: 9 Then shall ye look—if by the way of its own boundary it goeth up to Beth-shemesh he it was who caused us this great affliction,—but if not then shall we know that it was not his hand that smote us, a chance it was､ that befell us.

content: 10 The men､ therefore､ did so, and took two milch kine, and fastened them in the waggon,—but their calves shut they up in the shed.
content_old: 10 The men､ therefore､ did so, and took two milch kine, and fastened them in the waggon,—but their calves shut they up in the shed.

content: 11 And they put the ark of Yahweh､ into the waggon,—also the coffer, with the mice of gold, and the likenesses of their tumours.
content_old: 11 And they put the ark of Yahweh､ into the waggon,—also the coffer, with the mice of gold, and the likenesses of their tumours.

content: 12 And the kine went straight along the road､ on the way to Beth-shemesh, yea along the main highway they went､ lowing as they went, turning not aside､ to the right hand or to the left. And the lords of the Philistines went along after them, as far as the bounds of Beth-shemesh.
content_old: 12 And the kine went straight along the road､ on the way to Beth-shemesh, yea along the main highway they went､ lowing as they went, turning not aside､ to the right hand or to the left. And the lords of the Philistines went along after them, as far as the bounds of Beth-shemesh.

content: 13 Now they of Beth-shemesh were reaping their wheat-harvest in the vale,—so they lifted up their eyes､ and saw the ark, and rejoiced to meet it.
content_old: 13 Now they of Beth-shemesh were reaping their wheat-harvest in the vale,—so they lifted up their eyes､ and saw the ark, and rejoiced to meet it.

content: 14 And the waggon entered into the field of Joshua､ a man of Beth-shemesh､ and stood still there, where also was a great stone,—so they clave into pieces the planks of the waggon, and the kine offered they up as an ascending-sacrifice､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 14 And the waggon entered into the field of Joshua､ a man of Beth-shemesh､ and stood still there, where also was a great stone,—so they clave into pieces the planks of the waggon, and the kine offered they up as an ascending-sacrifice､ unto Yahweh.

content: 15 And the Levites took down the ark of Yahweh､ and the coffer that was with it､ wherein were the jewels of gold, and put them upon the great stone,—and the men of Beth-shemesh caused to go up ascending-offerings and offered sacrifices､ that day､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 15 And the Levites took down the ark of Yahweh､ and the coffer that was with it､ wherein were the jewels of gold, and put them upon the great stone,—and the men of Beth-shemesh caused to go up ascending-offerings and offered sacrifices､ that day､ unto Yahweh.

content: 16 And the five lords of the Philistines saw it,—and returned unto Ekron､ the same day.
content_old: 16 And the five lords of the Philistines saw it,—and returned unto Ekron､ the same day.

content: 17 Now these are the golden boils which the Philistines returned as a guilt-offering unto Yahweh.— For Ashdod one､ For Gaza one､ For Ashkelon one､ For Gath one､ For Ekron one;
content_old: 17 Now these are the golden boils which the Philistines returned as a guilt-offering unto Yahweh.— For Ashdod one､ For Gaza one､ For Ashkelon one､ For Gath one､ For Ekron one;

content: 18 And the golden mice､ by the number of all the cities of the Philistines､ pertaining to the five lords, both fortified cities､ and country villages,—yea even the great meadow whereon they rested the ark of Yahweh until this day is in the field-land of Joshua､ the man of Beth-shemesh.
content_old: 18 And the golden mice､ by the number of all the cities of the Philistines､ pertaining to the five lords, both fortified cities､ and country villages,—yea even the great meadow whereon they rested the ark of Yahweh until this day is in the field-land of Joshua､ the man of Beth-shemesh.

content: 19 And when he smote the men of Beth-shemesh､ because they looked into the ark of Yahweh, yea smote of the people seventy men and fifty thousand men the people mourned, for that Yahweh had smitten the people with a great smiting.
content_old: 19 And when he smote the men of Beth-shemesh､ because they looked into the ark of Yahweh, yea smote of the people seventy men and fifty thousand men the people mourned, for that Yahweh had smitten the people with a great smiting.

content: 20 Then said the men of Beth-shemesh, Who is able to stand before Yahweh､ this holy God? and unto whom shall he go up from us?
content_old: 20 Then said the men of Beth-shemesh, Who is able to stand before Yahweh､ this holy God? and unto whom shall he go up from us?

content: 1 Then came the men of Kiriath-jearim and fetched up the ark of Yahweh, and brought it into the house of Abinadab､ in the hill,—and Eleazar his son hallowed they, to guard the ark of Yahweh.
content_old: 1 Then came the men of Kiriath-jearim and fetched up the ark of Yahweh, and brought it into the house of Abinadab､ in the hill,—and Eleazar his son hallowed they, to guard the ark of Yahweh.

content: 2 And so it was､ that from the day the ark came to dwell in Kiriath-jearim the days multiplied, and became twenty years,—and all the house of Israel went mourning after Yahweh.
content_old: 2 And so it was､ that from the day the ark came to dwell in Kiriath-jearim the days multiplied, and became twenty years,—and all the house of Israel went mourning after Yahweh.

content: 3 And Samuel spake unto all the house of Israel､ saying, If with all your heart ye are returning unto Yahweh then put away the gods of the foreigner out of your midst､ and the Ashtoreths,—and firmly set your heart towards Yahweh､ and serve him alone, that he may deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 3 And Samuel spake unto all the house of Israel､ saying, If with all your heart ye are returning unto Yahweh then put away the gods of the foreigner out of your midst､ and the Ashtoreths,—and firmly set your heart towards Yahweh､ and serve him alone, that he may deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.

content: 4 So the sons of Israel put away the Baals､ and the Ashtoreths,—and served Yahweh､ alone.
content_old: 4 So the sons of Israel put away the Baals､ and the Ashtoreths,—and served Yahweh､ alone.

content: 5 And Samuel said, Gather all Israel unto Mizpah,—that I may pray for you､ unto Yahweh.
content_old: 5 And Samuel said, Gather all Israel unto Mizpah,—that I may pray for you､ unto Yahweh.

content: 6 So they gathered themselves unto Mizpah､ and drew water､ and poured it out before Yahweh､ and fasted on that day､ and said there, We have sinned against Yahweh. And Samuel judged the sons of Israel in Mizpah.
content_old: 6 So they gathered themselves unto Mizpah､ and drew water､ and poured it out before Yahweh､ and fasted on that day､ and said there, We have sinned against Yahweh. And Samuel judged the sons of Israel in Mizpah.

content: 7 And when the Philistines heard that the sons of Israel had gathered themselves together unto Mizpah the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel,—and when the sons of Israel heard it they shrank with fear､ from the face of the Philistines.
content_old: 7 And when the Philistines heard that the sons of Israel had gathered themselves together unto Mizpah the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel,—and when the sons of Israel heard it they shrank with fear､ from the face of the Philistines.

content: 8 And the sons of Israel said unto Samuel, Do not turn in silence from us, from making outcry unto Yahweh our God,—that he would save us out of the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 8 And the sons of Israel said unto Samuel, Do not turn in silence from us, from making outcry unto Yahweh our God,—that he would save us out of the hand of the Philistines.

content: 9 So Samuel took one sucking lamb, and offered it up､ as an entire ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh,—and Samuel made outcry unto Yahweh､ for Israel, and Yahweh answered him.
content_old: 9 So Samuel took one sucking lamb, and offered it up､ as an entire ascending-sacrifice unto Yahweh,—and Samuel made outcry unto Yahweh､ for Israel, and Yahweh answered him.

content: 10 And when Samuel was offering up the ascending-sacrifice the Philistines drew near to fight against Israel,—but Yahweh thundered with a great noise throughout that day､ over the Philistines､ and confused them, and they were smitten before Israel.
content_old: 10 And when Samuel was offering up the ascending-sacrifice the Philistines drew near to fight against Israel,—but Yahweh thundered with a great noise throughout that day､ over the Philistines､ and confused them, and they were smitten before Israel.

content: 11 And the men of Israel went forth out of Mizpah, and pursued the Philistines,—and smote them as far as under Beth-car.
content_old: 11 And the men of Israel went forth out of Mizpah, and pursued the Philistines,—and smote them as far as under Beth-car.

content: 12 And Samuel took a certain stone､ and set it between Mizpah and Yeshanah, and called the name thereof Eben-ezer,—and said, Hitherto hath Yahweh helped us.
content_old: 12 And Samuel took a certain stone､ and set it between Mizpah and Yeshanah, and called the name thereof Eben-ezer,—and said, Hitherto hath Yahweh helped us.

content: 13 So the Philistines were subdued, and no more came within the boundary of Israel,—and the hand of Yahweh was against the Philistines, all the days of Samuel.
content_old: 13 So the Philistines were subdued, and no more came within the boundary of Israel,—and the hand of Yahweh was against the Philistines, all the days of Samuel.

content: 14 And the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel､ from Ekron even as far as Gath; even the boundaries thereof did Israel rescue out of the hand of the Philistines,—thus came there to be peace between Israel and the Amorites.
content_old: 14 And the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel､ from Ekron even as far as Gath; even the boundaries thereof did Israel rescue out of the hand of the Philistines,—thus came there to be peace between Israel and the Amorites.

content: 15 And Samuel judged Israel, all the days of his life.
content_old: 15 And Samuel judged Israel, all the days of his life.

content: 16 And he used to take his journey､ from year to year, and go round to Bethel, and Gilgal､ and Mizpah,—and used to judge Israel, at all these places.
content_old: 16 And he used to take his journey､ from year to year, and go round to Bethel, and Gilgal､ and Mizpah,—and used to judge Israel, at all these places.

content: 1 And it came to pass when Samuel was old that he appointed his sons judges to Israel;
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when Samuel was old that he appointed his sons judges to Israel;

content: 2 and the name of his firstborn son was Joel, and the name of his second Abijah,—they were judges in Beer-sheba.
content_old: 2 and the name of his firstborn son was Joel, and the name of his second Abijah,—they were judges in Beer-sheba.

content: 3 Howbeit his sons walked not in his ways, but stooped to extortion,—and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
content_old: 3 Howbeit his sons walked not in his ways, but stooped to extortion,—and took bribes, and perverted judgment.

content: 4 So then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together,—and came unto Samuel､ to Ramah;
content_old: 4 So then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together,—and came unto Samuel､ to Ramah;

content: 5 and said unto him— Lo! thou art old, and thy sonsll walk not in thy ways: Now appoint for us a king to judge us､ like all the nations.
content_old: 5 and said unto him— Lo! thou art old, and thy sonsll walk not in thy ways: Now appoint for us a king to judge us､ like all the nations.

content: 6 But the thing was displeasing in the eyes of Samuel, when they said, Give unto us a king to judge us. So Samuel prayed unto Yahweh.
content_old: 6 But the thing was displeasing in the eyes of Samuel, when they said, Give unto us a king to judge us. So Samuel prayed unto Yahweh.

content: 7 And Yahweh said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people, in all that they shall say unto thee,—for not thee have they rejected､ but me have they rejected､ from being king over them.
content_old: 7 And Yahweh said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people, in all that they shall say unto thee,—for not thee have they rejected､ but me have they rejected､ from being king over them.

content: 8 According to all the doings which they have done､ from the day I brought them up out of Egypt､ even until this day, in that they have forsaken me, and served other gods so are they doing even unto thee.
content_old: 8 According to all the doings which they have done､ from the day I brought them up out of Egypt､ even until this day, in that they have forsaken me, and served other gods so are they doing even unto thee.

content: 9 Now therefore､ hearken to their voice,—save that thou enter protest against them, and tell them the manner of the king who will reign over them.
content_old: 9 Now therefore､ hearken to their voice,—save that thou enter protest against them, and tell them the manner of the king who will reign over them.

content: 10 So then Samuel spake all the words of Yahweh unto the people, who were asking of him､ a king.
content_old: 10 So then Samuel spake all the words of Yahweh unto the people, who were asking of him､ a king.

content: 11 And he said, This will be the manner of the king who will reign over you,— Your sons will he take and appoint for himself､ as his charioteers and as his horsemen, and they shall run before his chariots;
content_old: 11 And he said, This will be the manner of the king who will reign over you,— Your sons will he take and appoint for himself､ as his charioteers and as his horsemen, and they shall run before his chariots;

content: 12 and he will appoint for himself, princes of thousands､ and princes of fifties,—and to plough his fields､ and to reap his harvest, and to make his weapons of war, and the instruments of his chariots;
content_old: 12 and he will appoint for himself, princes of thousands､ and princes of fifties,—and to plough his fields､ and to reap his harvest, and to make his weapons of war, and the instruments of his chariots;

content: 13 And your daughters will he take,—as perfumers and as cooks､ and as bakers;
content_old: 13 And your daughters will he take,—as perfumers and as cooks､ and as bakers;

content: 14 And your fields､ and your vineyards､ and your oliveyards､ the best of them will he take, and give to his servants;
content_old: 14 And your fields､ and your vineyards､ and your oliveyards､ the best of them will he take, and give to his servants;

content: 15 And your seed, and your vineyards will he tithe, and give to his courtiers and to his servants;
content_old: 15 And your seed, and your vineyards will he tithe, and give to his courtiers and to his servants;

content: 16 And your men-servants､ and your maid-servants､ and your oxen､ even the goodliest､ and your asses will he take,—and put them to his work;
content_old: 16 And your men-servants､ and your maid-servants､ and your oxen､ even the goodliest､ and your asses will he take,—and put them to his work;

content: 17 Your flocks will he tithe,— And ye yourselves shall become his servants.
content_old: 17 Your flocks will he tithe,— And ye yourselves shall become his servants.

content: 18 Then will ye make outcry､ in that day, because of your king whom ye have chosen for yourselves,—and Yahweh will not answer you､ in that day.
content_old: 18 Then will ye make outcry､ in that day, because of your king whom ye have chosen for yourselves,—and Yahweh will not answer you､ in that day.

content: 19 But the people refused to hearken unto the voice of Samuel,—and they said— Nay! but a king shall be over us:
content_old: 19 But the people refused to hearken unto the voice of Samuel,—and they said— Nay! but a king shall be over us:

content: 20 so shall even we become like all the nations,—and our king shall judge us､ and go forth before us, and fight our battles.
content_old: 20 so shall even we become like all the nations,—and our king shall judge us､ and go forth before us, and fight our battles.

content: 21 And Samuel heard all the words of the people,—and spake them in the ears of Yahweh.
content_old: 21 And Samuel heard all the words of the people,—and spake them in the ears of Yahweh.

content: 1 Now there was a man of Benjamin､ whose name was Kish—son of Abiel､ son of Zeror､ son of Becorath､ son of Aphiah､ son of a Benjamite,—a mighty man of valour;
content_old: 1 Now there was a man of Benjamin､ whose name was Kish—son of Abiel､ son of Zeror､ son of Becorath､ son of Aphiah､ son of a Benjamite,—a mighty man of valour;

content: 2 and he had a son､ whose name was Saul､ a choice young man and of noble appearance, and there was not a man of the sons of Israel､ more noble than he,—from his shoulders and upwards was he taller than any of the people.
content_old: 2 and he had a son､ whose name was Saul､ a choice young man and of noble appearance, and there was not a man of the sons of Israel､ more noble than he,—from his shoulders and upwards was he taller than any of the people.

content: 3 Now there had gone astray asses belonging to Kish､ Saul’s father,—so Kish said unto Saul his son— I pray thee､ take with thee one of the young men, and arise—go, seek the asses.
content_old: 3 Now there had gone astray asses belonging to Kish､ Saul’s father,—so Kish said unto Saul his son— I pray thee､ take with thee one of the young men, and arise—go, seek the asses.

content: 4 And he passed through the hill country of Ephraim､ and passed through the land of Shalishah､ but they found them not,—then passed they through the land of Shaalim､ and they were not there, then passed he through the land of the Benjamites､ but they found them not.
content_old: 4 And he passed through the hill country of Ephraim､ and passed through the land of Shalishah､ but they found them not,—then passed they through the land of Shaalim､ and they were not there, then passed he through the land of the Benjamites､ but they found them not.

content: 5 They had come into the land of Zuph when Saul said to his young man who was with him､ Come! and let us return; lest my father leave off caring for the asses､ and be concerned for us.
content_old: 5 They had come into the land of Zuph when Saul said to his young man who was with him､ Come! and let us return; lest my father leave off caring for the asses､ and be concerned for us.

content: 6 And he said to him: Lo! I pray thee､ a man of God liveth in this city, and the man is held in honour, all that he saith surely cometh to pass. Now let us go thither; peradventure he may tell us our way､ whereon we should have gone.
content_old: 6 And he said to him: Lo! I pray thee､ a man of God liveth in this city, and the man is held in honour, all that he saith surely cometh to pass. Now let us go thither; peradventure he may tell us our way､ whereon we should have gone.

content: 7 Then said Saul to his young man: Behold if we go what shall we bring the man, for the bread hath failed from our sacks, and present there is none to bring to the man of God,—what is there with us?
content_old: 7 Then said Saul to his young man: Behold if we go what shall we bring the man, for the bread hath failed from our sacks, and present there is none to bring to the man of God,—what is there with us?

content: 8 And the young man again answered Saul, and said— Lo! there is found in my hand, the fourth part of a shekel of silver,—which thou canst give to the man of God, and he will tell us our way.
content_old: 8 And the young man again answered Saul, and said— Lo! there is found in my hand, the fourth part of a shekel of silver,—which thou canst give to the man of God, and he will tell us our way.

content: 9 Beforetime in Israel thus said a man when he went to enquire of God, Come and let us go as far as the seer,—For the prophet of to-day used to be called beforetime the seer.
content_old: 9 Beforetime in Israel thus said a man when he went to enquire of God, Come and let us go as far as the seer,—For the prophet of to-day used to be called beforetime the seer.

content: 10 And Saul said unto his young man, Good is thy word､ come! let us go! So they went unto the city, where the man of God was.
content_old: 10 And Saul said unto his young man, Good is thy word､ come! let us go! So they went unto the city, where the man of God was.

content: 11 They were going up the ascent of the city when they found young women, coming out to draw water,—so they said unto these, Is the seer in this place?
content_old: 11 They were going up the ascent of the city when they found young women, coming out to draw water,—so they said unto these, Is the seer in this place?

content: 12 And the young women answered them and said: He is､ lo! before you now､ even as to-day hath he entered the city, for the people have a sacrifice､ to-day､ in the high place.
content_old: 12 And the young women answered them and said: He is､ lo! before you now､ even as to-day hath he entered the city, for the people have a sacrifice､ to-day､ in the high place.

content: 13 As ye enter the city so shall ye surely find him､ ere yet he shall go up to the high place to eat､ for the people will not eat until he hath come, for he doth bless the sacrifice, after that will they eat who have been bidden. Now therefore､ go up, for about this very time shall ye surely find him.
content_old: 13 As ye enter the city so shall ye surely find him､ ere yet he shall go up to the high place to eat､ for the people will not eat until he hath come, for he doth bless the sacrifice, after that will they eat who have been bidden. Now therefore､ go up, for about this very time shall ye surely find him.

content: 14 So they went up into the city. As they were entering into the midst of the city lo! Samuel coming out over against them, to ascend the high place.
content_old: 14 So they went up into the city. As they were entering into the midst of the city lo! Samuel coming out over against them, to ascend the high place.

content: 15 Now Yahweh had unveiled the ear of Samuel,—one day before Saul came､ saying:
content_old: 15 Now Yahweh had unveiled the ear of Samuel,—one day before Saul came､ saying:

content: 16 About this time to-morrow will I send unto thee､ a man out of the land of Benjamin､ whom thou shalt anoint､ to be leader over my people Israel, and he shall save my people､ out of the hand of the Philistines,—for I have looked upon the oppression, because their outery hath come in unto me.
content_old: 16 About this time to-morrow will I send unto thee､ a man out of the land of Benjamin､ whom thou shalt anoint､ to be leader over my people Israel, and he shall save my people､ out of the hand of the Philistines,—for I have looked upon the oppression, because their outery hath come in unto me.

content: 17 And when Samuel beheldSaul Yahweh answered him, Lo! the man of whom I said unto thee, Here is one shall control my people.
content_old: 17 And when Samuel beheldSaul Yahweh answered him, Lo! the man of whom I said unto thee, Here is one shall control my people.

content: 18 And Saul drew near unto Samuel､ in the midst of the gate,—and said— I pray thee､ do tell me､ where is the house of the seer?
content_old: 18 And Saul drew near unto Samuel､ in the midst of the gate,—and said— I pray thee､ do tell me､ where is the house of the seer?

content: 19 And Samuel answered Saul､ and said— I am the seer! Go up before me､ to the high place, so shall ye eat with me､ to-day,—and I will let thee go in the morning, and all that is in thy heart will I tell thee.
content_old: 19 And Samuel answered Saul､ and said— I am the seer! Go up before me､ to the high place, so shall ye eat with me､ to-day,—and I will let thee go in the morning, and all that is in thy heart will I tell thee.

content: 20 And as for the asses that went astray from thee three days ago do not regard them､ for they are found,—but to whom belongeth all that is desirable in Israel? is it not to thee, and to all the house of thy father?
content_old: 20 And as for the asses that went astray from thee three days ago do not regard them､ for they are found,—but to whom belongeth all that is desirable in Israel? is it not to thee, and to all the house of thy father?

content: 21 Then answered Saul､ and said— Am not I a man of Benjamin､ of the smallest of the tribes of Israel, and is not my family the poorest of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou spoken unto me of such a thing as this?
content_old: 21 Then answered Saul､ and said— Am not I a man of Benjamin､ of the smallest of the tribes of Israel, and is not my family the poorest of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou spoken unto me of such a thing as this?

content: 22 And Samuel took Saul and his young man, and brought them into the guest-chamber,—and gave them a place at the head of them who were bidden, they being about thirty persons.
content_old: 22 And Samuel took Saul and his young man, and brought them into the guest-chamber,—and gave them a place at the head of them who were bidden, they being about thirty persons.

content: 23 And Samuel said to the cook, Set on the portion that I gave thee,—of which I said unto thee, Put it by thee.
content_old: 23 And Samuel said to the cook, Set on the portion that I gave thee,—of which I said unto thee, Put it by thee.

content: 24 And the cook took up the shoulder､ and that which was upon it､ and placed it before Saul､ and said— Lo! the part reserved! Set it before thee and eat, for unto the time appointed hath it been kept for thee､ since the time that I said, The people have I bidden. So Saul did eat with Samuel､ on that day.
content_old: 24 And the cook took up the shoulder､ and that which was upon it､ and placed it before Saul､ and said— Lo! the part reserved! Set it before thee and eat, for unto the time appointed hath it been kept for thee､ since the time that I said, The people have I bidden. So Saul did eat with Samuel､ on that day.

content: 25 And when they had come down from the high place into the city he spread a couch for Saul upon the house-top, and he lay down.
content_old: 25 And when they had come down from the high place into the city he spread a couch for Saul upon the house-top, and he lay down.

content: 26 And it came to pass at the uprisings of the dawn that Samuel called unto Saul on the house-top､ saying, Arise! that I may send thee away. So Saul arose､ and they two､ he and Samuel､ went forth abroad.
content_old: 26 And it came to pass at the uprisings of the dawn that Samuel called unto Saul on the house-top､ saying, Arise! that I may send thee away. So Saul arose､ and they two､ he and Samuel､ went forth abroad.

content: 1 Then took Samuel a flask of oil､ and poured out upon his head､ and kissed him,—and said— Is it not､ that Yahweh hath anointed thee over his inheritance､ as leader?
content_old: 1 Then took Samuel a flask of oil､ and poured out upon his head､ and kissed him,—and said— Is it not､ that Yahweh hath anointed thee over his inheritance､ as leader?

content: 2 When thou departest､ to-day､ from me then shalt thou find two men by the grave of Rachel､ within the boundary of Benjamin､ in Zelzah,—and they will say unto thee, The asses are found､ which thou wentest to seek, and lo! thy father hath abandoned caring for the asses, and is concerned for you saying, What shall I do for my son?
content_old: 2 When thou departest､ to-day､ from me then shalt thou find two men by the grave of Rachel､ within the boundary of Benjamin､ in Zelzah,—and they will say unto thee, The asses are found､ which thou wentest to seek, and lo! thy father hath abandoned caring for the asses, and is concerned for you saying, What shall I do for my son?

content: 3 Then shalt thou pass on quickly from thence onwards, and come as far as the oak of Tabor, and there shall find thee there､ three men going up unto God､ at Bethel,—one carrying three kids､ and another carrying three cakes of bread, and another carrying a skin of wine;
content_old: 3 Then shalt thou pass on quickly from thence onwards, and come as far as the oak of Tabor, and there shall find thee there､ three men going up unto God､ at Bethel,—one carrying three kids､ and another carrying three cakes of bread, and another carrying a skin of wine;

content: 4 then will they ask thee､ of thy welfare,—and give thee two cakes of bread, which thou shalt receive at their hand.
content_old: 4 then will they ask thee､ of thy welfare,—and give thee two cakes of bread, which thou shalt receive at their hand.

content: 5 After that shalt thou come unto the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines,—and it shall be as thou comest in thither into the city thou shalt light upon a band of prophets､ coming down from the high place, and before them a harp､ and a timbrel､ and a flute､ and a lyre, they having been moved to prophesy.
content_old: 5 After that shalt thou come unto the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines,—and it shall be as thou comest in thither into the city thou shalt light upon a band of prophets､ coming down from the high place, and before them a harp､ and a timbrel､ and a flute､ and a lyre, they having been moved to prophesy.

content: 6 Then will come suddenly upon thee､ the Spirit of Yahweh, and thou shalt be moved to prophesy with them,—and shalt be changed into another man.
content_old: 6 Then will come suddenly upon thee､ the Spirit of Yahweh, and thou shalt be moved to prophesy with them,—and shalt be changed into another man.

content: 7 And it shall be when these signs shall come unto thee then act thou for thyself､ as thou shalt find occasion, for God is with thee.
content_old: 7 And it shall be when these signs shall come unto thee then act thou for thyself､ as thou shalt find occasion, for God is with thee.

content: 8 And thou shalt go down before me to Gilgal, for lo! I am coming down unto thee, to offer up ascending-offerings, to sacrifice peace-offerings,—seven days shalt thou tarry､ until I come unto thee, then will I let thee know what thou shalt do.
content_old: 8 And thou shalt go down before me to Gilgal, for lo! I am coming down unto thee, to offer up ascending-offerings, to sacrifice peace-offerings,—seven days shalt thou tarry､ until I come unto thee, then will I let thee know what thou shalt do.

content: 9 And so it was､ that when he turned away to depart from Samuel God gave him another heart,—and all these signs came to pass that day.
content_old: 9 And so it was､ that when he turned away to depart from Samuel God gave him another heart,—and all these signs came to pass that day.

content: 10 And when they came thither to the hill lo! a band of prophets coming to meet him,—then came suddenly upon him､ the Spirit of God, and he was moved to prophesy in their midst.
content_old: 10 And when they came thither to the hill lo! a band of prophets coming to meet him,—then came suddenly upon him､ the Spirit of God, and he was moved to prophesy in their midst.

content: 11 And it came to pass､ that all who knew him aforetime looked and lo! with the prophets he did prophesy. So the people said､ one to another— What､ now､ hath befallen the son of Kish? Is even Saul among the prophets?
content_old: 11 And it came to pass､ that all who knew him aforetime looked and lo! with the prophets he did prophesy. So the people said､ one to another— What､ now､ hath befallen the son of Kish? Is even Saul among the prophets?

content: 12 Then responded one of that place､ and said, But who is their father? For this cause it became a proverb, Is even Saul among the prophets?
content_old: 12 Then responded one of that place､ and said, But who is their father? For this cause it became a proverb, Is even Saul among the prophets?

content: 13 And when he had made an end of prophesying he came to the high place.
content_old: 13 And when he had made an end of prophesying he came to the high place.

content: 14 Then said Saul’s uncle unto him､ and unto his young man— Whither have ye been? And he said, To seek the asses, and when they were nowhere to be seen we came unto Samuel.
content_old: 14 Then said Saul’s uncle unto him､ and unto his young man— Whither have ye been? And he said, To seek the asses, and when they were nowhere to be seen we came unto Samuel.

content: 15 And Saul’s uncle said,— Do tell me､ I pray thee､ what Samuel said to you.
content_old: 15 And Saul’s uncle said,— Do tell me､ I pray thee､ what Samuel said to you.

content: 16 And Saul said unto his uncle, He told us that the asses were found,—but as to the matter of the kingdom he told him not what Samuel had said.
content_old: 16 And Saul said unto his uncle, He told us that the asses were found,—but as to the matter of the kingdom he told him not what Samuel had said.

content: 17 Then Samuel called out the people, unto Yahweh､ at Mizpah,
content_old: 17 Then Samuel called out the people, unto Yahweh､ at Mizpah,

content: 18 and said unto the sons of Israel— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel: I myself brought up Israel､ out of Egypt,—and rescued you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that distressed you.
content_old: 18 and said unto the sons of Israel— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel: I myself brought up Israel､ out of Egypt,—and rescued you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that distressed you.

content: 19 Yet ye to-day､ have rejected your God､ who himself hath been giving you salvation from all your calamities and your distresses, and ye have said to him: A king shalt thou set over us,— Now therefore､ present yourselves before Yahweh, by your tribes､ and by your thousands.
content_old: 19 Yet ye to-day､ have rejected your God､ who himself hath been giving you salvation from all your calamities and your distresses, and ye have said to him: A king shalt thou set over us,— Now therefore､ present yourselves before Yahweh, by your tribes､ and by your thousands.

content: 20 And when Samuel had brought near all the tribes of Israel then was taken the tribe of Benjamin.
content_old: 20 And when Samuel had brought near all the tribes of Israel then was taken the tribe of Benjamin.

content: 21 And when he had brought near the tribe of Benjamin､ by their families then was taken the family of Matri,—and when he had brought near the family of Matri､ man by man then was taken Saul the son of Kish; so they sought him､ but he was not to be found.
content_old: 21 And when he had brought near the tribe of Benjamin､ by their families then was taken the family of Matri,—and when he had brought near the family of Matri､ man by man then was taken Saul the son of Kish; so they sought him､ but he was not to be found.

content: 22 Then asked they again of Yahweh, Hath there yet to come in hither a man? And Yahweh said, Lo! he hath hid himself among the stores.
content_old: 22 Then asked they again of Yahweh, Hath there yet to come in hither a man? And Yahweh said, Lo! he hath hid himself among the stores.

content: 23 So they ran､ and fetched him thence, and when he presented himself in the midst of the people then was he seen to be taller than any of the people, from his shoulders and upwards.
content_old: 23 So they ran､ and fetched him thence, and when he presented himself in the midst of the people then was he seen to be taller than any of the people, from his shoulders and upwards.

content: 24 And Samuel said unto all the people— Have ye seen him whom Yahweh hath chosen, that there is none like him､ among all the people? And all the people shouted､ and said— Let the king live!
content_old: 24 And Samuel said unto all the people— Have ye seen him whom Yahweh hath chosen, that there is none like him､ among all the people? And all the people shouted､ and said— Let the king live!
