content: 25 Then Samuel declared unto the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a scroll, and laid it up before Yahweh. And Samuel sent away all the people､ every man to his own house.
content_old: 25 Then Samuel declared unto the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a scroll, and laid it up before Yahweh. And Samuel sent away all the people､ every man to his own house.

content: 26 Yea even Saul went to his own house､ at Gibeah,—and the valiant men whose heart God had moved went with him.
content_old: 26 Yea even Saul went to his own house､ at Gibeah,—and the valiant men whose heart God had moved went with him.

content: 1 Then came up Nahash the Ammonite, and encamped against Jabesh-gilead,—and all the men of Jabesh said unto Nahash, Solemnise with us a covenant､ that we may serve thee.
content_old: 1 Then came up Nahash the Ammonite, and encamped against Jabesh-gilead,—and all the men of Jabesh said unto Nahash, Solemnise with us a covenant､ that we may serve thee.

content: 2 And Nahash the Ammonite said unto them, Hereby will I solemnise a covenant with you by digging out for you, every one’s right eye,—and laying it for a reproach､ upon all Israel.
content_old: 2 And Nahash the Ammonite said unto them, Hereby will I solemnise a covenant with you by digging out for you, every one’s right eye,—and laying it for a reproach､ upon all Israel.

content: 3 And the elders of Jabesh said unto him— Give us a respite of seven days, that we may send messengers throughout all the bounds of Israel,—and then､ if there is none to save us we will come out unto thee.
content_old: 3 And the elders of Jabesh said unto him— Give us a respite of seven days, that we may send messengers throughout all the bounds of Israel,—and then､ if there is none to save us we will come out unto thee.

content: 4 And when the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul, and spake the words in the ears of the people all the people lifted up their voice､ and wept.
content_old: 4 And when the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul, and spake the words in the ears of the people all the people lifted up their voice､ and wept.

content: 5 But lo! Saul came in､ following the oxen､ out of the field, and Saul said, What aileth the people､ that they should weep? Then were recounted to him the words of the men of Jabesh.
content_old: 5 But lo! Saul came in､ following the oxen､ out of the field, and Saul said, What aileth the people､ that they should weep? Then were recounted to him the words of the men of Jabesh.

content: 6 And the Spirit of God came suddenly upon Saul, when he heard these words,—and his anger raged furiously.
content_old: 6 And the Spirit of God came suddenly upon Saul, when he heard these words,—and his anger raged furiously.

content: 7 So he took a yoke of oxen､ and cut them in pieces､ and sent throughout all the bounds of Israel by the hand of messengers—saying, Whosoever cometh not forth after Saul､ and after Samuel so shall it be done unto his oxen. Then fell the dread of Yahweh､ upon the people, and they came forth､ as one man.
content_old: 7 So he took a yoke of oxen､ and cut them in pieces､ and sent throughout all the bounds of Israel by the hand of messengers—saying, Whosoever cometh not forth after Saul､ and after Samuel so shall it be done unto his oxen. Then fell the dread of Yahweh､ upon the people, and they came forth､ as one man.

content: 8 And when he numbered them in Bezek the sons of Israel were found to be—three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
content_old: 8 And when he numbered them in Bezek the sons of Israel were found to be—three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.

content: 9 So they said unto the messengers who had come— Thus shall ye surely say to the men of Jabesh-gilead, To-morrow shall ye have deliverance､ about the time the sun is hot. And when the messengers came and told the men of Jabesh they rejoiced.
content_old: 9 So they said unto the messengers who had come— Thus shall ye surely say to the men of Jabesh-gilead, To-morrow shall ye have deliverance､ about the time the sun is hot. And when the messengers came and told the men of Jabesh they rejoiced.

content: 10 So the men of Jabesh said, To-morrow will we come out unto you,— Then shall ye do with us, according to all that is good in your eyes.
content_old: 10 So the men of Jabesh said, To-morrow will we come out unto you,— Then shall ye do with us, according to all that is good in your eyes.

content: 11 And it came to pass on the morrow､ that Saul set the people in three companies, and they entered into the midst of the host､ during the morning watch, and smote Ammon until the day was hot. And it came to pass that they who were left were scattered, so that there were not left among them､ two together.
content_old: 11 And it came to pass on the morrow､ that Saul set the people in three companies, and they entered into the midst of the host､ during the morning watch, and smote Ammon until the day was hot. And it came to pass that they who were left were scattered, so that there were not left among them､ two together.

content: 12 Then said the people unto Samuel, Who is he that was saying, Shall Saul reign over us? Give up the men､ that we may put them to death.
content_old: 12 Then said the people unto Samuel, Who is he that was saying, Shall Saul reign over us? Give up the men､ that we may put them to death.

content: 13 But Saul said, There shall not be put to death a man､ this day,—for to-day hath Yahweh wrought deliverance in Israel.
content_old: 13 But Saul said, There shall not be put to death a man､ this day,—for to-day hath Yahweh wrought deliverance in Israel.

content: 14 Then said Samuel unto the people, Come and let us go to Gilgal,—and let us there renew the kingdom.
content_old: 14 Then said Samuel unto the people, Come and let us go to Gilgal,—and let us there renew the kingdom.

content: 1 And Samuel said unto all Israel, Lo! I have hearkened unto your voice, in all that ye said to me,—and have set over you a king.
content_old: 1 And Samuel said unto all Israel, Lo! I have hearkened unto your voice, in all that ye said to me,—and have set over you a king.

content: 2 Now､ therefore､ lo! the king going to and fro before you､ But I am old and grey-headed, And my sons lo! they are with you,— But I have gone to and fro before you from my youth until this day.
content_old: 2 Now､ therefore､ lo! the king going to and fro before you､ But I am old and grey-headed, And my sons lo! they are with you,— But I have gone to and fro before you from my youth until this day.

content: 3 Behold me! testify against me､ before Yahweh､ and before his Anointed— Whose ox have I taken? Or whose ass have I taken? Or whom have I oppressed? Whom have I crushed? Or at whose hands have I taken a bribe, to cover up mine eyes therewith? And I will restore it unto you.
content_old: 3 Behold me! testify against me､ before Yahweh､ and before his Anointed— Whose ox have I taken? Or whose ass have I taken? Or whom have I oppressed? Whom have I crushed? Or at whose hands have I taken a bribe, to cover up mine eyes therewith? And I will restore it unto you.

content: 4 And they said, Thou hast not oppressed us､ Neither hast thou crushed us,— Neither hast thou taken at the hand of any man､ any thing.
content_old: 4 And they said, Thou hast not oppressed us､ Neither hast thou crushed us,— Neither hast thou taken at the hand of any man､ any thing.

content: 5 And he said unto them— Witness is Yahweh against you､ And witness is his Anointed､ this day, That ye have not found in my hand any thing! And they said: Witness!
content_old: 5 And he said unto them— Witness is Yahweh against you､ And witness is his Anointed､ this day, That ye have not found in my hand any thing! And they said: Witness!

content: 6 And Samuel said unto the people: Witness is Yahweh､ who wrought with Moses and with Aaron, And who brought up your fathers out of the land of Egypt.
content_old: 6 And Samuel said unto the people: Witness is Yahweh､ who wrought with Moses and with Aaron, And who brought up your fathers out of the land of Egypt.

content: 7 Now､ therefore､ take your stand and let me plead with you､ before Yahweh,—and tell you all the righteous acts of Yahweh, which he wrought with you､ and with your fathers:
content_old: 7 Now､ therefore､ take your stand and let me plead with you､ before Yahweh,—and tell you all the righteous acts of Yahweh, which he wrought with you､ and with your fathers:

content: 8 How that when Jacob had come into Egypt,—and your fathers had made outery unto Yahweh then Yahweh sent Moses and Aaron､ and they brought forth your fathers out of Egypt, and he caused them to dwell in this place;
content_old: 8 How that when Jacob had come into Egypt,—and your fathers had made outery unto Yahweh then Yahweh sent Moses and Aaron､ and they brought forth your fathers out of Egypt, and he caused them to dwell in this place;

content: 9 And when they forgat Yahweh their God he sold them into the hand of Sisera､ prince of the host of Jabin､ king of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines､ and into the hand of the king of Moab, and they fought against them;
content_old: 9 And when they forgat Yahweh their God he sold them into the hand of Sisera､ prince of the host of Jabin､ king of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines､ and into the hand of the king of Moab, and they fought against them;

content: 10 But when they made outcry unto Yahweh and said— We have sinned, in that we have forsaken Yahweh, and have served the Baals and the Ashtoreths,—now､ therefore､ deliver us out of the hand of our enemies､ that we may serve thee
content_old: 10 But when they made outcry unto Yahweh and said— We have sinned, in that we have forsaken Yahweh, and have served the Baals and the Ashtoreths,—now､ therefore､ deliver us out of the hand of our enemies､ that we may serve thee

content: 11 then Yahweh sent Jerubbaal and Bedan, and Jephthah､ and Samuel,—and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies､ on everyside, and ye dwelt in safety.
content_old: 11 then Yahweh sent Jerubbaal and Bedan, and Jephthah､ and Samuel,—and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies､ on everyside, and ye dwelt in safety.

content: 12 But when ye saw that Nahash king of the sons of Ammon came upon you then said ye unto me, Nay! but a king shall reign over us, when Yahweh your God was your king!
content_old: 12 But when ye saw that Nahash king of the sons of Ammon came upon you then said ye unto me, Nay! but a king shall reign over us, when Yahweh your God was your king!

content: 13 Now､ therefore､ lo! the king whom ye have chosen､ for whom ye have asked,—lo! therefore､ Yahweh hath set over you a king.
content_old: 13 Now､ therefore､ lo! the king whom ye have chosen､ for whom ye have asked,—lo! therefore､ Yahweh hath set over you a king.

content: 14 If ye will revere Yahweh､ and serve him､ and hearken unto his voice, and not rebel against the bidding of Yahweh Then shall both ye and your king that reigneth over you continue to follow after Yahweh your God.
content_old: 14 If ye will revere Yahweh､ and serve him､ and hearken unto his voice, and not rebel against the bidding of Yahweh Then shall both ye and your king that reigneth over you continue to follow after Yahweh your God.

content: 15 But if ye hearken not unto the voice of Yahweh, but rebel against the bidding of Yahweh then will the hand of Yahweh continue to be against you､ and against your fathers.
content_old: 15 But if ye hearken not unto the voice of Yahweh, but rebel against the bidding of Yahweh then will the hand of Yahweh continue to be against you､ and against your fathers.

content: 16 Even now stand still and see this great thing,—which Yahweh is about to do before your eyes:
content_old: 16 Even now stand still and see this great thing,—which Yahweh is about to do before your eyes:

content: 17 Is it not wheat harvest､ to-day? I will cry unto Yahweh, that he may give forth thunderings and rain,—know ye then and see､ that your wrong is great which ye have done in the sight of Yahweh, in asking for yourselves､ a king.
content_old: 17 Is it not wheat harvest､ to-day? I will cry unto Yahweh, that he may give forth thunderings and rain,—know ye then and see､ that your wrong is great which ye have done in the sight of Yahweh, in asking for yourselves､ a king.

content: 18 So Samuel cried unto Yahweh, and Yahweh gave forth thunderings and rain､ on that day,—and all the people greatly feared Yahweh､ and Samuel.
content_old: 18 So Samuel cried unto Yahweh, and Yahweh gave forth thunderings and rain､ on that day,—and all the people greatly feared Yahweh､ and Samuel.

content: 19 And all the people said unto Samuel— Pray for thy servants､ unto Yahweh thy God､ and let it not be that we die,— For we have added to all our sins a wrong, in asking for ourselves a king.
content_old: 19 And all the people said unto Samuel— Pray for thy servants､ unto Yahweh thy God､ and let it not be that we die,— For we have added to all our sins a wrong, in asking for ourselves a king.

content: 20 Then said Samuel unto the people— Do not fear, ye have done all this wrong,—nevertheless､ do not turn aside from following Yahweh､ but serve Yahweh､ with all your heart;
content_old: 20 Then said Samuel unto the people— Do not fear, ye have done all this wrong,—nevertheless､ do not turn aside from following Yahweh､ but serve Yahweh､ with all your heart;

content: 21 and turn not aside after vanities､ that can neither profit nor deliver､ because vanities they are.
content_old: 21 and turn not aside after vanities､ that can neither profit nor deliver､ because vanities they are.

content: 22 For Yahweh will not give up his people, because of his great name,—for Yahweh was minded to make you his people.
content_old: 22 For Yahweh will not give up his people, because of his great name,—for Yahweh was minded to make you his people.

content: 23 As for me also far be it from me､ that I should sin against Yahweh, by ceasing to pray for you,—but I will direct you, in the good and right way.
content_old: 23 As for me also far be it from me､ that I should sin against Yahweh, by ceasing to pray for you,—but I will direct you, in the good and right way.

content: 24 Only revere Yahweh､ and serve him in truth､ with all your heart,—for see, what great things he hath done with you.
content_old: 24 Only revere Yahweh､ and serve him in truth､ with all your heart,—for see, what great things he hath done with you.

content: 1 Saul was thirty years old when he began to reign; and when he had reigned two years over Israel
content_old: 1 Saul was thirty years old when he began to reign; and when he had reigned two years over Israel

content: 2 Saul chose him three thousand men out of Israel, of whom there were with Saul､ two thousand in Michmash and in the hill-country of Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan, in Gilbeah of Benjamin,—but the rest of the people he let go､ every man to his own home.
content_old: 2 Saul chose him three thousand men out of Israel, of whom there were with Saul､ two thousand in Michmash and in the hill-country of Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan, in Gilbeah of Benjamin,—but the rest of the people he let go､ every man to his own home.

content: 3 Then did Jonathan smite the garrison of Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it,—and Saul blew with a horn throughout all the land､ saying, Let the Hebrews hear!
content_old: 3 Then did Jonathan smite the garrison of Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it,—and Saul blew with a horn throughout all the land､ saying, Let the Hebrews hear!

content: 4 And all Israel heard say— Saul hath smitten the garrison of the Philistines, Moreover､ also､ Israel have made themselves odious among the Philistines,— so the people were called together to follow Saul､ to Gilgal.
content_old: 4 And all Israel heard say— Saul hath smitten the garrison of the Philistines, Moreover､ also､ Israel have made themselves odious among the Philistines,— so the people were called together to follow Saul､ to Gilgal.

content: 5 And the Philistines gathered themselves together to fight with Israel､ thirty thousand chariots､ and six thousand horsemen, a people also like the sand that is on the sea-shore for multitude,—and they came up､ and encamped in Michmash, east of Beth-aven.
content_old: 5 And the Philistines gathered themselves together to fight with Israel､ thirty thousand chariots､ and six thousand horsemen, a people also like the sand that is on the sea-shore for multitude,—and they came up､ and encamped in Michmash, east of Beth-aven.

content: 6 So the men of Israel saw they were in a strait, for the people had been harassed,—and the people had hidden themselves in caves､ and in thickets､ and among cliffs､ and in holes､ and in pits.
content_old: 6 So the men of Israel saw they were in a strait, for the people had been harassed,—and the people had hidden themselves in caves､ and in thickets､ and among cliffs､ and in holes､ and in pits.

content: 7 And Hebrews had passed over the Jordan, to the land of Gad､ and Gilead,—but Saul was yet in Gilgal, and all the people trembled after him.
content_old: 7 And Hebrews had passed over the Jordan, to the land of Gad､ and Gilead,—but Saul was yet in Gilgal, and all the people trembled after him.

content: 8 And he waited seven days､ by the set time that Samuel had named, but Samuel came not to Gilgal,—and the people were scattered from him.
content_old: 8 And he waited seven days､ by the set time that Samuel had named, but Samuel came not to Gilgal,—and the people were scattered from him.

content: 9 Then said Saul, Bring near unto me, the ascending-sacrifice and the peace-offerings. And he offered up the ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 9 Then said Saul, Bring near unto me, the ascending-sacrifice and the peace-offerings. And he offered up the ascending-sacrifice.

content: 10 And it came to pass as he had made an end of offering up the ascending-sacrifice lo! Samuel had come,—and Saul went out to meet him､ that he might bless him.
content_old: 10 And it came to pass as he had made an end of offering up the ascending-sacrifice lo! Samuel had come,—and Saul went out to meet him､ that he might bless him.

content: 11 Then said Samuel— What hast thou done? And Saul said— Because I saw that the people had been scattered from me､ and thou hadst not come within the appointed days, and the Philistines had gathered themselves together to Michmash
content_old: 11 Then said Samuel— What hast thou done? And Saul said— Because I saw that the people had been scattered from me､ and thou hadst not come within the appointed days, and the Philistines had gathered themselves together to Michmash

content: 12 therefore I said— Now will the Philistines come down against me､ at Gilgal, but the face of Yahweh have I not appeased: So I forced myself, and offered up the ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 12 therefore I said— Now will the Philistines come down against me､ at Gilgal, but the face of Yahweh have I not appeased: So I forced myself, and offered up the ascending-sacrifice.

content: 13 And Samuel said unto Saul— Thou hast shewn thyself foolish,—thou hast not kept the commandment of Yahweh thy God､ which he commanded thee, for now would Yahweh have established thy kingdom unto Israel until times age-abiding;
content_old: 13 And Samuel said unto Saul— Thou hast shewn thyself foolish,—thou hast not kept the commandment of Yahweh thy God､ which he commanded thee, for now would Yahweh have established thy kingdom unto Israel until times age-abiding;

content: 14 Whereas now shall thy kingdom not be established,—Yahweh hath sought out for him a man after his own heart､ and Yahweh hath commanded him to be leader over his people, because thou hast not kept that which Yahweh commanded thee.
content_old: 14 Whereas now shall thy kingdom not be established,—Yahweh hath sought out for him a man after his own heart､ and Yahweh hath commanded him to be leader over his people, because thou hast not kept that which Yahweh commanded thee.

content: 15 And Samuel arose､ and ascended from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people who were found with him, about six hundred men.
content_old: 15 And Samuel arose､ and ascended from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people who were found with him, about six hundred men.

content: 16 Now Saul､ and Jonathan his son､ and the people that were found with him were abiding in Geba of Benjamin,—but the Philistines had encamped in Michmash.
content_old: 16 Now Saul､ and Jonathan his son､ and the people that were found with him were abiding in Geba of Benjamin,—but the Philistines had encamped in Michmash.

content: 17 And the spoilers came forth out of the camp of the Philistines､ in three companies,—the first company turned unto the way of Ophrah､ unto the land of Shual;
content_old: 17 And the spoilers came forth out of the camp of the Philistines､ in three companies,—the first company turned unto the way of Ophrah､ unto the land of Shual;

content: 18 “and the second company turned unto the way of Beth-horon,—and the third company turned unto the way of the boundary that overlooketh the valley of Zeboim､ towards the wilderness.
content_old: 18 “and the second company turned unto the way of Beth-horon,—and the third company turned unto the way of the boundary that overlooketh the valley of Zeboim､ towards the wilderness.

content: 19 Now a smith could not be found, throughout all the land of Israel,—for the Philistines had said, Lest the Hebrews make sword or spear.
content_old: 19 Now a smith could not be found, throughout all the land of Israel,—for the Philistines had said, Lest the Hebrews make sword or spear.

content: 20 So all Israel went down to the Philistines,—to sharpen every man his share､ and his mattock､ and his axe､ and his sickle.
content_old: 20 So all Israel went down to the Philistines,—to sharpen every man his share､ and his mattock､ and his axe､ and his sickle.

content: 21 Howbeit they had a file for the sickles､ and the mattocks, and the three-pronged forks､ and the axes,—and for setting the goads.
content_old: 21 Howbeit they had a file for the sickles､ and the mattocks, and the three-pronged forks､ and the axes,—and for setting the goads.

content: 22 Thus would it come to pass､ in the day of battle that there was found—neither sword nor spear､ in the hand of any of the people, that were with Saul and Jonathan,—but such were found belonging to Saul and to Jonathan his son.
content_old: 22 Thus would it come to pass､ in the day of battle that there was found—neither sword nor spear､ in the hand of any of the people, that were with Saul and Jonathan,—but such were found belonging to Saul and to Jonathan his son.

content: 1 And it came about､ on a certain day､ that Jonathan son of Saul said unto the young man bearing his armour: Come! and let us pass over unto the garrison of the Philistines, that is on the other side､ yonder! but to his father he told it not.
content_old: 1 And it came about､ on a certain day､ that Jonathan son of Saul said unto the young man bearing his armour: Come! and let us pass over unto the garrison of the Philistines, that is on the other side､ yonder! but to his father he told it not.

content: 2 Now Saul was tarrying in the uttermost part of Gibeah, under the pomegranate tree that is in Migron,—and the people that were with him were ahout six hundred men;
content_old: 2 Now Saul was tarrying in the uttermost part of Gibeah, under the pomegranate tree that is in Migron,—and the people that were with him were ahout six hundred men;

content: 3 and Ahijah､ son of Ahitub､ brother of Ichabod､ son of Phinehas､ son of Eli､ was priest of Yahweh in Shiloh､ wearing an ephod,—and the people knew not that Jonathan had departed.
content_old: 3 and Ahijah､ son of Ahitub､ brother of Ichabod､ son of Phinehas､ son of Eli､ was priest of Yahweh in Shiloh､ wearing an ephod,—and the people knew not that Jonathan had departed.

content: 4 And between the passes by which Jonathan sought to cross over up to the garrison of the Philistines there was a crag of rock on the one side､ and a crag of rock on the other side; and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
content_old: 4 And between the passes by which Jonathan sought to cross over up to the garrison of the Philistines there was a crag of rock on the one side､ and a crag of rock on the other side; and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.

content: 5 The one crag was a pillar on the north､ over against Michmash,—and the other on the south､ over against Geha.
content_old: 5 The one crag was a pillar on the north､ over against Michmash,—and the other on the south､ over against Geha.

content: 6 So Jonathan said unto the young man bearing his armour— Come! and let us cross over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised, peradventure Yahweh may work by us,—for there is no restraint with Yahweh, to save by many､ or by few.
content_old: 6 So Jonathan said unto the young man bearing his armour— Come! and let us cross over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised, peradventure Yahweh may work by us,—for there is no restraint with Yahweh, to save by many､ or by few.

content: 7 And his armour-bearer said to him, Do all that is in thy heart,—decide for thyself (lo! I am with thee!)､ according to thine own heart.
content_old: 7 And his armour-bearer said to him, Do all that is in thy heart,—decide for thyself (lo! I am with thee!)､ according to thine own heart.

content: 8 Then said Jonathan, Lo! we are crossing over unto the men,—and will discover ourselves unto them.
content_old: 8 Then said Jonathan, Lo! we are crossing over unto the men,—and will discover ourselves unto them.

content: 9 If thus they say unto us, Keep quiet until we get to you then will we stand still where we are, and will not go up unto them;
content_old: 9 If thus they say unto us, Keep quiet until we get to you then will we stand still where we are, and will not go up unto them;

content: 10 but if thus they say, Come up unto us then will we go up; for Yahweh hath delivered them into our hand,— This then､ is our sign.
content_old: 10 but if thus they say, Come up unto us then will we go up; for Yahweh hath delivered them into our hand,— This then､ is our sign.

content: 11 So they two discovered themselves unto the garrison of the Philistines,—and the Philistines said— Lo! Hebrews coming forth out of the holes､ wherein they had hidden themselves.
content_old: 11 So they two discovered themselves unto the garrison of the Philistines,—and the Philistines said— Lo! Hebrews coming forth out of the holes､ wherein they had hidden themselves.

content: 12 And the men of the garrison responded to Jonathan and his armour-bearer､ and said— Come up unto us, and we will let you know a thing. Then said Jonathan unto his armour-bearer— Come up after me, for Yahweh hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.
content_old: 12 And the men of the garrison responded to Jonathan and his armour-bearer､ and said— Come up unto us, and we will let you know a thing. Then said Jonathan unto his armour-bearer— Come up after me, for Yahweh hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.

content: 13 So Jonathan went up on his hands and on his feet, and his armour-bearer followed him,—and they fell before Jonathan, and his armour-bearer was slaying after him.
content_old: 13 So Jonathan went up on his hands and on his feet, and his armour-bearer followed him,—and they fell before Jonathan, and his armour-bearer was slaying after him.

content: 14 And the first smiting wherewith Jonathan and his armour-bearer smote､ was about twenty men,—within､ as it were､ half a furrow’s length of a yoke of land.
content_old: 14 And the first smiting wherewith Jonathan and his armour-bearer smote､ was about twenty men,—within､ as it were､ half a furrow’s length of a yoke of land.

content: 15 And there came to be a trembling in the camp, in the field､ and among all the people, the outposts and the spoilers they too trembled,—and the earth quaked, so it became a preternatural trembling.
content_old: 15 And there came to be a trembling in the camp, in the field､ and among all the people, the outposts and the spoilers they too trembled,—and the earth quaked, so it became a preternatural trembling.

content: 16 And the scouts of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked､ and lo! the camp melted away､ hither and thither.
content_old: 16 And the scouts of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked､ and lo! the camp melted away､ hither and thither.

content: 17 Then said Saul unto the people who were with him: Number､ I pray you､ and see who hath departed from us. So they numbered; and lo! Jonathan and his armour-bearer were missing.
content_old: 17 Then said Saul unto the people who were with him: Number､ I pray you､ and see who hath departed from us. So they numbered; and lo! Jonathan and his armour-bearer were missing.

content: 18 Then said Saul unto Ahijah, Bring near the ark of God; for the ark of God was､ on that day､ in the midst of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 18 Then said Saul unto Ahijah, Bring near the ark of God; for the ark of God was､ on that day､ in the midst of the sons of Israel.

content: 19 And it came to pass, as soon as Saul had spoken unto the priest that the tumultuous noise that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and on increasing. Then said Saul unto the priest— Withdraw thy hand.
content_old: 19 And it came to pass, as soon as Saul had spoken unto the priest that the tumultuous noise that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and on increasing. Then said Saul unto the priest— Withdraw thy hand.

content: 20 And Saul and all the people that were with him gathered themselves together, and came as far as the host,—and lo! the sword of every man was against his fellow, an exceeding great confusion.
content_old: 20 And Saul and all the people that were with him gathered themselves together, and came as far as the host,—and lo! the sword of every man was against his fellow, an exceeding great confusion.

content: 21 And the Hebrews who had aforetime belonged to the Philistines, who had come up with them in the host even they turned round so as to be with Israel who were with Saul and Jonathan.
content_old: 21 And the Hebrews who had aforetime belonged to the Philistines, who had come up with them in the host even they turned round so as to be with Israel who were with Saul and Jonathan.

content: 22 And all the men of Israel who had hidden themselves throughout the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines had fled,—and they also followed hard after them in the battle.
content_old: 22 And all the men of Israel who had hidden themselves throughout the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines had fled,—and they also followed hard after them in the battle.

content: 23 Thus did Yahweh､ on that day､ save Israel,—and the battle passed over by Beth-aven.
content_old: 23 Thus did Yahweh､ on that day､ save Israel,—and the battle passed over by Beth-aven.

content: 24 Now the men of Israel were tired out on that day,—yet had Saul bound the people by an oath､ saying— Cursed be the man that eateth food until the evening､ and I be avenged upon mine enemies. So none of the people had tasted food.
content_old: 24 Now the men of Israel were tired out on that day,—yet had Saul bound the people by an oath､ saying— Cursed be the man that eateth food until the evening､ and I be avenged upon mine enemies. So none of the people had tasted food.

content: 25 And all the land had entered into the forest,—and there was honey upon the face of the ground.
content_old: 25 And all the land had entered into the forest,—and there was honey upon the face of the ground.

content: 26 So the people came into the forest､ and lo! there were streams of honey,—but no man reached his hand to his mouth, because the people revered the oath.
content_old: 26 So the people came into the forest､ and lo! there were streams of honey,—but no man reached his hand to his mouth, because the people revered the oath.

content: 27 But Jonathan heard not his father putting the people on oath, so he reached forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and dipped it in the honey-copse,—and brought back his hand to his mouth, and his eyes were brightened.
content_old: 27 But Jonathan heard not his father putting the people on oath, so he reached forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and dipped it in the honey-copse,—and brought back his hand to his mouth, and his eyes were brightened.

content: 28 Then responded one from among the people､ and said— With an oath did thy father charge the people､ saying— Cursed be the man that eateth food to-day! And so the people were faint.
content_old: 28 Then responded one from among the people､ and said— With an oath did thy father charge the people､ saying— Cursed be the man that eateth food to-day! And so the people were faint.

content: 29 Then said Jonathan: My father hath afflicted the land,— See､ I pray you､ how my own eyes have been brightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.
content_old: 29 Then said Jonathan: My father hath afflicted the land,— See､ I pray you､ how my own eyes have been brightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.

content: 30 How much more if haply the people had eaten freely to-day of the spoil of their enemies､ which they found? for now would not the smiting of the Philistines have been mighty ?
content_old: 30 How much more if haply the people had eaten freely to-day of the spoil of their enemies､ which they found? for now would not the smiting of the Philistines have been mighty ?

content: 31 Howbeit they smote the Philistines on that day from Michmash to Aijalon,—but the people became exceeding faint.
content_old: 31 Howbeit they smote the Philistines on that day from Michmash to Aijalon,—but the people became exceeding faint.

content: 32 And the people darted greedily upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen､ and calves､ and felled them to the ground,—and the people did eat with the blood.
content_old: 32 And the people darted greedily upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen､ and calves､ and felled them to the ground,—and the people did eat with the blood.

content: 33 And they told Saul､ saying, Lo! the people are sinning against Yahweh､ by eating with the blood. And he said— Ye have dealt treacherously, roll unto me､ here､ a great stone.
content_old: 33 And they told Saul､ saying, Lo! the people are sinning against Yahweh､ by eating with the blood. And he said— Ye have dealt treacherously, roll unto me､ here､ a great stone.

content: 34 And Saul said— Disperse yourselves among the people､ and say unto them— Bring near unto me every man his ox､ and every man his lamb､ and slay them here､ and then eat, so shall ye not sin against Yahweh､ by eating with the blood. And all the people brought near—every man that which was in his hand､ that night､ and they slew them there.
content_old: 34 And Saul said— Disperse yourselves among the people､ and say unto them— Bring near unto me every man his ox､ and every man his lamb､ and slay them here､ and then eat, so shall ye not sin against Yahweh､ by eating with the blood. And all the people brought near—every man that which was in his hand､ that night､ and they slew them there.

content: 35 And Saul built an altar unto Yahweh,—the same was the first altar that he built unto Yahweh.
content_old: 35 And Saul built an altar unto Yahweh,—the same was the first altar that he built unto Yahweh.

content: 36 Then said Saul— Let us go down after the Philistines by night､ and make of them a prey until the morning light, and let us not leave of them a man. And they said, All that is good in thine eyes do! Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither unto God.
content_old: 36 Then said Saul— Let us go down after the Philistines by night､ and make of them a prey until the morning light, and let us not leave of them a man. And they said, All that is good in thine eyes do! Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither unto God.

content: 37 So Saul asked of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into tho hand of Israel? But he answered him not､ that day.
content_old: 37 So Saul asked of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into tho hand of Israel? But he answered him not､ that day.

content: 38 Then said Saul, Come near hither, all ye chiefs of the people,—and get to know and see, wherein hath been this sin､ to-day.
content_old: 38 Then said Saul, Come near hither, all ye chiefs of the people,—and get to know and see, wherein hath been this sin､ to-day.

content: 39 For by the life of Yahweh､ who saveth Israel though it be in Jonathan my son yet shall he die. But there was none ready to answer him､ of all the people.
content_old: 39 For by the life of Yahweh､ who saveth Israel though it be in Jonathan my son yet shall he die. But there was none ready to answer him､ of all the people.

content: 40 Then said he unto all Israel��� Ye shall be on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said unto Saul, What is good in thine eyes do!
content_old: 40 Then said he unto all Israel��� Ye shall be on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said unto Saul, What is good in thine eyes do!

content: 41 And Saul said unto Yahweh— O God of Israel! now set forth the truth. Then were Jonathan and Saul taken､ and the people escaped.
content_old: 41 And Saul said unto Yahweh— O God of Israel! now set forth the truth. Then were Jonathan and Saul taken､ and the people escaped.

content: 42 And Saul said, Cast lots between me､ and Jonathan my son. Then was Jonathan taken.
content_old: 42 And Saul said, Cast lots between me､ and Jonathan my son. Then was Jonathan taken.

content: 43 And Saul said unto Jonathan, Come tell me､ what thou hast done. So Jonathan told him､ and said, I just tasted with the end of the staff that was in my hand a little honey ､ here I am—I must die!
content_old: 43 And Saul said unto Jonathan, Come tell me､ what thou hast done. So Jonathan told him､ and said, I just tasted with the end of the staff that was in my hand a little honey ､ here I am—I must die!

content: 44 Then said Saul: So may God do､ and so may he add surely thou must die､ Jonathan!
content_old: 44 Then said Saul: So may God do､ and so may he add surely thou must die､ Jonathan!

content: 45 But the people said unto Saul— Shall Jonathan die､ who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? Far be it! By the life of Yahweh there shall not fall a hair of his head to the ground, for with God hath he wrought this day. So the people delivered Jonathan､ that he died not.
content_old: 45 But the people said unto Saul— Shall Jonathan die､ who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? Far be it! By the life of Yahweh there shall not fall a hair of his head to the ground, for with God hath he wrought this day. So the people delivered Jonathan､ that he died not.

content: 46 Then Saul went up from following the Philistines,—and the Philistines departed unto their own place.
content_old: 46 Then Saul went up from following the Philistines,—and the Philistines departed unto their own place.

content: 47 And Saul took possession of the kingdom over Israel,—and made war round about against all his enemies—against Moab､ and against the sons of Ammon､ and against Edom､ and against the kings of Zobah､ and against the Philistines, and whomsoever he turned against he was victorious.
content_old: 47 And Saul took possession of the kingdom over Israel,—and made war round about against all his enemies—against Moab､ and against the sons of Ammon､ and against Edom､ and against the kings of Zobah､ and against the Philistines, and whomsoever he turned against he was victorious.

content: 48 Then made he ready a force, and smote the Amalekites,—and delivered Israel out of the hand of such as plundered them.
content_old: 48 Then made he ready a force, and smote the Amalekites,—and delivered Israel out of the hand of such as plundered them.

content: 49 And the sons of Saul were Jonathan､ and Ishvi､ and Malchishua,—and the names of his two daughters were, the name of the first-born Merab, and the name of the younger Michal,—
content_old: 49 And the sons of Saul were Jonathan､ and Ishvi､ and Malchishua,—and the names of his two daughters were, the name of the first-born Merab, and the name of the younger Michal,—

content: 50 and the name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam､ daughter of Ahimaaz,—and the name of the prince of his host､ Abner, son of Ner､ Saul’s uncle.
content_old: 50 and the name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam､ daughter of Ahimaaz,—and the name of the prince of his host､ Abner, son of Ner､ Saul’s uncle.

content: 51 And Kish was Saul’s father､ and Ner､ Abner’s father was son of Abiel.
content_old: 51 And Kish was Saul’s father､ and Ner､ Abner’s father was son of Abiel.

content: 1 And Samuel said unto Saul, It was me Yahweh sent to anoint thee to be king over his people､ over Israel,—now therefore､ hearken thou to the voice of Yahweh’s words.
content_old: 1 And Samuel said unto Saul, It was me Yahweh sent to anoint thee to be king over his people､ over Israel,—now therefore､ hearken thou to the voice of Yahweh’s words.

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, I have well considered what Amalek did unto Israel,—how he lay in wait for him in the way, when he came up out of Egypt.
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, I have well considered what Amalek did unto Israel,—how he lay in wait for him in the way, when he came up out of Egypt.

content: 3 Now go and smite Amalek､ and devote ye to destruction all that he hath, and spare him not,—but thou shalt slay both man and woman､ both child and suckling, both ox and sheep, both camel and ass.
content_old: 3 Now go and smite Amalek､ and devote ye to destruction all that he hath, and spare him not,—but thou shalt slay both man and woman､ both child and suckling, both ox and sheep, both camel and ass.

content: 4 So then Saul called together the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen,—and ten thousand men of Judah.
content_old: 4 So then Saul called together the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen,—and ten thousand men of Judah.

content: 5 And Saul came as far as the city of Amalek,—and stirred up strife in the ravine.
content_old: 5 And Saul came as far as the city of Amalek,—and stirred up strife in the ravine.

content: 6 Then said Saul unto the Kenites— Go､ depart､ get you down out of the midst of the Amalekites､ lest I destroy you with them, yet ye dealt in lovingkindness､ with all the sons of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt. So the Kenites departed out of the midst of the Amalekites.
content_old: 6 Then said Saul unto the Kenites— Go､ depart､ get you down out of the midst of the Amalekites､ lest I destroy you with them, yet ye dealt in lovingkindness､ with all the sons of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt. So the Kenites departed out of the midst of the Amalekites.

content: 7 And Saul smote Amalek,—from Havilah､ till thou enterest Shur, which is over against Egypt.
content_old: 7 And Saul smote Amalek,—from Havilah､ till thou enterest Shur, which is over against Egypt.

content: 8 And he took Agag､ king of Amalek, alive,—but all the people devoted he to destruction at the edge of the sword.
content_old: 8 And he took Agag､ king of Amalek, alive,—but all the people devoted he to destruction at the edge of the sword.

content: 9 But Saul and the people spared Agag､ and the best of the sheep and the oxen and the lambs､ also the fatlings､ and all that was good, and would not devote them to destruction,—but all the cattle that was contemptible and diseased that devoted they to destruction.
content_old: 9 But Saul and the people spared Agag､ and the best of the sheep and the oxen and the lambs､ also the fatlings､ and all that was good, and would not devote them to destruction,—but all the cattle that was contemptible and diseased that devoted they to destruction.

content: 10 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Samuel､ saying—
content_old: 10 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Samuel､ saying—

content: 11 I am grieved that I made Saul to be king, for he hath turned back from following me, and my words hath he not established. And it was vexing to Samuel, so that he made outcry unto Yahweh､ all the night.
content_old: 11 I am grieved that I made Saul to be king, for he hath turned back from following me, and my words hath he not established. And it was vexing to Samuel, so that he made outcry unto Yahweh､ all the night.

content: 12 And Samuel rose early to meet Saul､ in the morning, and it was told Samuel､ saying— Saul having come to Carmel､ and lo! having set him up a sign hath gone round､ and passed over, and descended to Gilgal.
content_old: 12 And Samuel rose early to meet Saul､ in the morning, and it was told Samuel､ saying— Saul having come to Carmel､ and lo! having set him up a sign hath gone round､ and passed over, and descended to Gilgal.

content: 13 And Samuel came unto Saul,—and Saul said unto him— Blessed be thou by Yahweh: I have established the word of Yahweh.
content_old: 13 And Samuel came unto Saul,—and Saul said unto him— Blessed be thou by Yahweh: I have established the word of Yahweh.

content: 14 And Samuel said, What then is this bleating of sheep､ in mine ears,—and the lowing of oxen, which I can hear?
content_old: 14 And Samuel said, What then is this bleating of sheep､ in mine ears,—and the lowing of oxen, which I can hear?

content: 15 Then said Saul— From the Amalekites have they brought them in; in that the people spared the best of the sheep､ and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto Yahweh thy God,—but the rest have we devoted to destruction.
content_old: 15 Then said Saul— From the Amalekites have they brought them in; in that the people spared the best of the sheep､ and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto Yahweh thy God,—but the rest have we devoted to destruction.

content: 16 Then said Samuel unto Saul, Stay､ and let me tell thee, that which Yahweh hath spoken unto me､ this night. And he said to him— Speak.
content_old: 16 Then said Samuel unto Saul, Stay､ and let me tell thee, that which Yahweh hath spoken unto me､ this night. And he said to him— Speak.

content: 17 And Samuel said, Was it not when little thou wast in thine own eyes that thou wast made head of the tribes of Israel,—and that Yahweh anointed thee to be king over Israel?
content_old: 17 And Samuel said, Was it not when little thou wast in thine own eyes that thou wast made head of the tribes of Israel,—and that Yahweh anointed thee to be king over Israel?

content: 18 So then Yahweh sent thee on a journey,—and said— Go､ and devastate to destruction､ the sinners—the Amalekites, and make war against them, until they have consumed them.
content_old: 18 So then Yahweh sent thee on a journey,—and said— Go､ and devastate to destruction､ the sinners—the Amalekites, and make war against them, until they have consumed them.

content: 19 Wherefore､ then､ didst thou not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh,—but didst rush upon the spoil, and do that which was wrong in the sight of Yahweh?
content_old: 19 Wherefore､ then､ didst thou not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh,—but didst rush upon the spoil, and do that which was wrong in the sight of Yahweh?

content: 20 And Saul said unto Samuel— As indeed I have hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh, and have been on the journey on which Yahweh sent me,—and have brought in Agag､ king of Amalek, and the Amalekites have I devoted to destruction.
content_old: 20 And Saul said unto Samuel— As indeed I have hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh, and have been on the journey on which Yahweh sent me,—and have brought in Agag､ king of Amalek, and the Amalekites have I devoted to destruction.

content: 21 And the people took､ of the spoil､ sheep and oxen､ The chief of the things so devoted,— To sacrifice unto Yahweh thy God､ in Gilgal.
content_old: 21 And the people took､ of the spoil､ sheep and oxen､ The chief of the things so devoted,— To sacrifice unto Yahweh thy God､ in Gilgal.

content: 22 Then said Samuel— Doth that which is pleasing unto Yahweh consist in ascending-offerings and sacrifices, So much as in hearkening unto the voice of Yahweh? Lo! to hearken is better than sacrifice, And to give heed than the fat of rams;
content_old: 22 Then said Samuel— Doth that which is pleasing unto Yahweh consist in ascending-offerings and sacrifices, So much as in hearkening unto the voice of Yahweh? Lo! to hearken is better than sacrifice, And to give heed than the fat of rams;

content: 23 For as the sin of divination is rebelliousness,— And as transgression with household gods is stubbornness,— Because thou hast rejected the word of Yahweh Therefore hath he rejected thee from being king.
content_old: 23 For as the sin of divination is rebelliousness,— And as transgression with household gods is stubbornness,— Because thou hast rejected the word of Yahweh Therefore hath he rejected thee from being king.

content: 24 Then said Saul unto Samuel— I have sinned; for I have transgressed the bidding of Yahweh､ and thy words,—for I feared the people, and hearkened unto their voice.
content_old: 24 Then said Saul unto Samuel— I have sinned; for I have transgressed the bidding of Yahweh､ and thy words,—for I feared the people, and hearkened unto their voice.

content: 25 Now therefore､ I pray thee pardon my sin,—and turn again with me, that I may bow down unto Yahweh.
content_old: 25 Now therefore､ I pray thee pardon my sin,—and turn again with me, that I may bow down unto Yahweh.

content: 26 And Samuel said unto Saul, I will not turn again with thee,— Because thou hast rejected the word of Yahweh Therefore hath Yahweh rejected thee from being king over Israel.
content_old: 26 And Samuel said unto Saul, I will not turn again with thee,— Because thou hast rejected the word of Yahweh Therefore hath Yahweh rejected thee from being king over Israel.

content: 27 And when Samuel turned about to go away then laid he hold of the skirt of his robe､ and it was rent.
content_old: 27 And when Samuel turned about to go away then laid he hold of the skirt of his robe､ and it was rent.

content: 28 And Samuel said unto him, Yahweh hath rent the kingdom of Israel from off thee､ to-day,—and will give it unto a neighbour of thine､ who is better than thou.
content_old: 28 And Samuel said unto him, Yahweh hath rent the kingdom of Israel from off thee､ to-day,—and will give it unto a neighbour of thine､ who is better than thou.

content: 29 Moreover also the Eminence of Israel will not lie､ neither will he repent,— For no son of earth is he to repent!
content_old: 29 Moreover also the Eminence of Israel will not lie､ neither will he repent,— For no son of earth is he to repent!

content: 30 Then he said: I have sinned, Now honour me､ I pray thee､ before the elders of my people､ and before Israel,—and turn again with me, then will I bow down unto Yahweh thy God.
content_old: 30 Then he said: I have sinned, Now honour me､ I pray thee､ before the elders of my people､ and before Israel,—and turn again with me, then will I bow down unto Yahweh thy God.

content: 31 So then Samuel turned again､ after Saul,—and Saul bowed down unto Yahweh.
content_old: 31 So then Samuel turned again､ after Saul,—and Saul bowed down unto Yahweh.

content: 32 Then said Samuel— Bring ye near unto me—Agag､ king of Amalek, And Agag came unto him､ in fetters. Then said Agag, Surely terrible is the bitterness of death!
content_old: 32 Then said Samuel— Bring ye near unto me—Agag､ king of Amalek, And Agag came unto him､ in fetters. Then said Agag, Surely terrible is the bitterness of death!

content: 33 And Samuel said, As women have been made childless by thy sword So childless among women shall be thine own mother. And Samuel cut Agag asunder before Yahweh､ in Gilgal.
content_old: 33 And Samuel said, As women have been made childless by thy sword So childless among women shall be thine own mother. And Samuel cut Agag asunder before Yahweh､ in Gilgal.

content: 34 Then Samuel departed unto Ramah,—but Saul went up unto his own house､ at Gibeah of Saul.
content_old: 34 Then Samuel departed unto Ramah,—but Saul went up unto his own house､ at Gibeah of Saul.

content: 1 And Yahweh said unto Samuel— How long art thou going to pine for Saul, seeing that I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill thy horn with oil､ and come! let me send thee unto Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have provided me among his sons a king.
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said unto Samuel— How long art thou going to pine for Saul, seeing that I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill thy horn with oil､ and come! let me send thee unto Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have provided me among his sons a king.

content: 2 And Samuel said, How can I go? As soon as Saul heareth he will slay me. Then said Yahweh, A heifer take thou with thee, and say, To sacrifice unto Yahweh am I come.
content_old: 2 And Samuel said, How can I go? As soon as Saul heareth he will slay me. Then said Yahweh, A heifer take thou with thee, and say, To sacrifice unto Yahweh am I come.

content: 3 Then shalt thou bid Jesse to the sacrifice,—when I will let thee know what thou must do, so shalt thou anoint for me him whom I shall name unto thee.
content_old: 3 Then shalt thou bid Jesse to the sacrifice,—when I will let thee know what thou must do, so shalt thou anoint for me him whom I shall name unto thee.

content: 4 And Samuel did that which Yahweh had spoken, and went to Bethlehem. And the elders of the city came trembling to meet him, and one said— Peaceably comest thou?
content_old: 4 And Samuel did that which Yahweh had spoken, and went to Bethlehem. And the elders of the city came trembling to meet him, and one said— Peaceably comest thou?

content: 5 And he said— Peaceably: to sacrifice unto Yahweh am I come. Hallow yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he hallowed Jesse and his sons, and bade them to the sacrifice.
content_old: 5 And he said— Peaceably: to sacrifice unto Yahweh am I come. Hallow yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he hallowed Jesse and his sons, and bade them to the sacrifice.

content: 6 And it came to pass when they entered that he looked upon Eliab,—and said to himself, Surely before Yahweh is his Anointed.
content_old: 6 And it came to pass when they entered that he looked upon Eliab,—and said to himself, Surely before Yahweh is his Anointed.

content: 7 But Yahweh said unto Samuel— Do not regard his countenance､ or the height of his stature､ for I have rejected him,—for it is not what man looketh to but what God looketh to. For man looketh to the outward appearance, but Yahweh looketh to the heart.
content_old: 7 But Yahweh said unto Samuel— Do not regard his countenance､ or the height of his stature､ for I have rejected him,—for it is not what man looketh to but what God looketh to. For man looketh to the outward appearance, but Yahweh looketh to the heart.

content: 8 Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel,—and he said, Neither of this one hath Yahweh made choice.
content_old: 8 Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel,—and he said, Neither of this one hath Yahweh made choice.

content: 9 Then Jesse made Shammah pass by,—and he said— Nor of this one hath Yahweh made choice.
content_old: 9 Then Jesse made Shammah pass by,—and he said— Nor of this one hath Yahweh made choice.

content: 10 So Jesse made seven of his sons pass before Samuel,—and Samuel said unto Jesse, Yahweh hath not made choice of these.
content_old: 10 So Jesse made seven of his sons pass before Samuel,—and Samuel said unto Jesse, Yahweh hath not made choice of these.

content: 11 Then said Samuel unto Jesse— Are these all the young men? And he said— There yet remaineth the youngest, but lo! he is tending the sheep. Then said Samuel unto Jesse— Do send and summon him, for we cannot sit round､ until he cometh in hither.
content_old: 11 Then said Samuel unto Jesse— Are these all the young men? And he said— There yet remaineth the youngest, but lo! he is tending the sheep. Then said Samuel unto Jesse— Do send and summon him, for we cannot sit round､ until he cometh in hither.

content: 12 So he sent､ and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, a stripling with handsome eyes､ and noble mien. Then said Yahweh— Rise—anoint him､for this is he.
content_old: 12 So he sent､ and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, a stripling with handsome eyes､ and noble mien. Then said Yahweh— Rise—anoint him､for this is he.

content: 13 And Samuel took the horn of oil､ and anointed him in the midst of his brethren. And the Spirit of Yahweh came mightily upon David, from that day forward. Then arose Samuel, and went his way unto Ramah.
content_old: 13 And Samuel took the horn of oil､ and anointed him in the midst of his brethren. And the Spirit of Yahweh came mightily upon David, from that day forward. Then arose Samuel, and went his way unto Ramah.

content: 14 But the spirit of Yahweh departed from Saul,—and there terrified him a sad spirit､ from Yahweh.
content_old: 14 But the spirit of Yahweh departed from Saul,—and there terrified him a sad spirit､ from Yahweh.

content: 15 Then said the servants of Saul unto him,— Lo! we pray thee､ a sad superhuman spirit doth terrify thee:
content_old: 15 Then said the servants of Saul unto him,— Lo! we pray thee､ a sad superhuman spirit doth terrify thee:

content: 16 Pray let our lord bid thy servants before thee, seek out a man､ skilled in playing on the lyre,—so shall it be､ when a sad superhuman spirit cometh on thee then shall he play with his hand､ and thou shalt be joyful.
content_old: 16 Pray let our lord bid thy servants before thee, seek out a man､ skilled in playing on the lyre,—so shall it be､ when a sad superhuman spirit cometh on thee then shall he play with his hand､ and thou shalt be joyful.

content: 17 And Saul said unto his servants,— I pray you､ look out for me a man that excelleth in playing, and bring him in unto me.
content_old: 17 And Saul said unto his servants,— I pray you､ look out for me a man that excelleth in playing, and bring him in unto me.

content: 18 Then responded one of the young men and said— Lo! I have seen—a son of Jesse､ the Bethlehemite, skilled in playing､ and a mighty man of valour､ and a man of war､ and of intelligent speech､ and a handsome man, and Yahweh is with him.
content_old: 18 Then responded one of the young men and said— Lo! I have seen—a son of Jesse､ the Bethlehemite, skilled in playing､ and a mighty man of valour､ and a man of war､ and of intelligent speech､ and a handsome man, and Yahweh is with him.

content: 19 So Saul sent messengers unto Jesse,—and said, Send unto me—David thy son､ who is with the sheep.
content_old: 19 So Saul sent messengers unto Jesse,—and said, Send unto me—David thy son､ who is with the sheep.

content: 20 Then took Jesse an ass laden with bread､ and a skin of wine, and one kid,—and sent by the hand of David his son､ unto Saul.
content_old: 20 Then took Jesse an ass laden with bread､ and a skin of wine, and one kid,—and sent by the hand of David his son､ unto Saul.

content: 21 And David came in unto Saul,—and stood before him,—and he loved him greatly, and he became his armour-bearer.
content_old: 21 And David came in unto Saul,—and stood before him,—and he loved him greatly, and he became his armour-bearer.

content: 22 And Saul sent unto Jesse､ saying,— I pray thee､ let David stand before me, for he hath found favour in mine eyes.
content_old: 22 And Saul sent unto Jesse､ saying,— I pray thee､ let David stand before me, for he hath found favour in mine eyes.

content: 1 And the Philistines gathered together their hosts､ unto battle, and they were gathered together unto Socoh､ which belongeth unto Judah,—and they encamped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes-dammim;
content_old: 1 And the Philistines gathered together their hosts､ unto battle, and they were gathered together unto Socoh､ which belongeth unto Judah,—and they encamped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes-dammim;

content: 2 and Saul and the men of Israel gathered themselves together, and encamped in the vale of Elah, and set the army in array against the Philistines.
content_old: 2 and Saul and the men of Israel gathered themselves together, and encamped in the vale of Elah, and set the army in array against the Philistines.

content: 3 And the Philistines were standing near the hill on one side, and the Israelites were standing near the hill on the other side,—while the valley was between them.
content_old: 3 And the Philistines were standing near the hill on one side, and the Israelites were standing near the hill on the other side,—while the valley was between them.

content: 4 And there came forth a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, Goliath his name､ from Gath,—his height six cubits and a span;
content_old: 4 And there came forth a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, Goliath his name､ from Gath,—his height six cubits and a span;

content: 5 with a helmet of bronze on his head, and with a scaly coat of mail was he clad,—the weight of the coat being five thousand shekels of bronze;
content_old: 5 with a helmet of bronze on his head, and with a scaly coat of mail was he clad,—the weight of the coat being five thousand shekels of bronze;

content: 6 and greaves of bronze on his feet,—and a javelin of bronze between his shoulders;
content_old: 6 and greaves of bronze on his feet,—and a javelin of bronze between his shoulders;

content: 7 and the shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam, and the flashing head of his spear was six hundred shekels of iron,—and his shield-bearer was coming on before him.
content_old: 7 and the shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam, and the flashing head of his spear was six hundred shekels of iron,—and his shield-bearer was coming on before him.

content: 8 And he took his stand､ and cried unto the ranks of Israel, and said unto them, Wherefore should ye come out､ to set in array for battle? Am not I a Philistine､ while ye are servants unto Saul? Choose you a man､ and let him come down unto me:
content_old: 8 And he took his stand､ and cried unto the ranks of Israel, and said unto them, Wherefore should ye come out､ to set in array for battle? Am not I a Philistine､ while ye are servants unto Saul? Choose you a man､ and let him come down unto me:

content: 9 If he prevail in fighting with me､ and smite me then will we become your servants,—but if I prevail over him､ and smite him then shall ye become our servants, and serve us.
content_old: 9 If he prevail in fighting with me､ and smite me then will we become your servants,—but if I prevail over him､ and smite him then shall ye become our servants, and serve us.

content: 10 And the Philistine said— I reproach the ranks of Israel､ this day,—give me a man, that we may fight together.
content_old: 10 And the Philistine said— I reproach the ranks of Israel､ this day,—give me a man, that we may fight together.

content: 11 When Saul and all Israel heard these words of the Philistine they were dismayed､ and feared exceedingly.
content_old: 11 When Saul and all Israel heard these words of the Philistine they were dismayed､ and feared exceedingly.

content: 12 Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem-judah､ whose name was Jesse, and who had eight sons,—and the man in the days of Saul was old､ advanced in years.
content_old: 12 Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem-judah､ whose name was Jesse, and who had eight sons,—and the man in the days of Saul was old､ advanced in years.

content: 13 And the three eldest sons of Jesse had followed Saul to the battle,—and the names of his three sons who went into the battle were Eliab the firstborn､ and the next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
content_old: 13 And the three eldest sons of Jesse had followed Saul to the battle,—and the names of his three sons who went into the battle were Eliab the firstborn､ and the next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

content: 14 But as for David he was the youngest,—and the three eldest followed Saul;
content_old: 14 But as for David he was the youngest,—and the three eldest followed Saul;

content: 15 whereas David kept going and returning from Saul,—to tend his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.
content_old: 15 whereas David kept going and returning from Saul,—to tend his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.

content: 16 And the Philistine drew near morning and evening,—and presented himself forty days.
content_old: 16 And the Philistine drew near morning and evening,—and presented himself forty days.

content: 17 And Jesse said unto David his son, Take､ I pray thee､ unto thy brethren—this ephah of parched corn, and these ten loaves,—and run to the camp unto thy brethren;
content_old: 17 And Jesse said unto David his son, Take､ I pray thee､ unto thy brethren—this ephah of parched corn, and these ten loaves,—and run to the camp unto thy brethren;

content: 18 also these ten slices of soft cheese shalt thou take to the captain of their thousand,—and as for thy brethren give good heed to their welfare, their pledge also shalt thou receive.
content_old: 18 also these ten slices of soft cheese shalt thou take to the captain of their thousand,—and as for thy brethren give good heed to their welfare, their pledge also shalt thou receive.

content: 19 Now Saul､ and they､ and all the men of Israel were in the vale of Elah､ ready to fight with the Philistines.
content_old: 19 Now Saul､ and they､ and all the men of Israel were in the vale of Elah､ ready to fight with the Philistines.

content: 20 So then David rose up early in the morning､ and entrusted the sheep to a keeper, and took up the provisions and went his way, as Jesse had commanded him,—and came into the circular rampart, as the force was going forth into the ranks､ and shouted for the fight.
content_old: 20 So then David rose up early in the morning､ and entrusted the sheep to a keeper, and took up the provisions and went his way, as Jesse had commanded him,—and came into the circular rampart, as the force was going forth into the ranks､ and shouted for the fight.

content: 21 So Israel and the Philistines set in array for battle, army against army.
content_old: 21 So Israel and the Philistines set in array for battle, army against army.

content: 22 Then David entrusted the provisions that were upon him to the care of the keeper of the stores, and ran unto the ranks,—and came and asked for the welfare of his brethren.
content_old: 22 Then David entrusted the provisions that were upon him to the care of the keeper of the stores, and ran unto the ranks,—and came and asked for the welfare of his brethren.

content: 23 Now as he was speaking with them lo! the champion coming up､ Goliath the Philistine by name､ of Gath, coming up out of the ranks of the Philistines､ and he spake according to these words,—and David heard them.
content_old: 23 Now as he was speaking with them lo! the champion coming up､ Goliath the Philistine by name､ of Gath, coming up out of the ranks of the Philistines､ and he spake according to these words,—and David heard them.

content: 24 Now all the men of Israel when they saw the man fled from before him, and feared exceedingly.
content_old: 24 Now all the men of Israel when they saw the man fled from before him, and feared exceedingly.

content: 25 And the men of Israel said— Have ye seen this man that is coming up? For to reproach Israel is he coming. So then it shall be, that the man that shall smite him the same will the king enrich with great riches､ and his own daughter will give him, and his father’s house will he make free in Israel.
content_old: 25 And the men of Israel said— Have ye seen this man that is coming up? For to reproach Israel is he coming. So then it shall be, that the man that shall smite him the same will the king enrich with great riches､ and his own daughter will give him, and his father’s house will he make free in Israel.

content: 26 Then spake David unto the men that were standing by him､ saying, What shall be done to the man that shall smite yonder Philistine, and so shall take away reproach from off Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he hath reproached the ranks of a Living God?
content_old: 26 Then spake David unto the men that were standing by him､ saying, What shall be done to the man that shall smite yonder Philistine, and so shall take away reproach from off Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he hath reproached the ranks of a Living God?

content: 27 And the people answered him, according to this word､ saying,— So shall it be done to the man that shall smite him.
content_old: 27 And the people answered him, according to this word､ saying,— So shall it be done to the man that shall smite him.

content: 28 Now Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men,—then was kindled the anger of Eliab against David､ and he said— Wherefore is it that thou hast come down? and to whom hast thou entrusted those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride､ and the foolishness of thy heart, for to see the battle hast thou come down.
content_old: 28 Now Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men,—then was kindled the anger of Eliab against David､ and he said— Wherefore is it that thou hast come down? and to whom hast thou entrusted those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride､ and the foolishness of thy heart, for to see the battle hast thou come down.

content: 29 And David said, What have I done now? Was there not a cause?
content_old: 29 And David said, What have I done now? Was there not a cause?

content: 30 Then turned he from him unto another, and said—according to this word,—and the people returned him an answer, like the first.
content_old: 30 Then turned he from him unto another, and said—according to this word,—and the people returned him an answer, like the first.

content: 31 And the words which David spake were overheard,—and when they told them before Saul he summoned him.
content_old: 31 And the words which David spake were overheard,—and when they told them before Saul he summoned him.

content: 32 And David said unto Saul, Let not the heart of my lord fail､ because of him,—thy servant will go, and fight with this Philistine.
content_old: 32 And David said unto Saul, Let not the heart of my lord fail､ because of him,—thy servant will go, and fight with this Philistine.

content: 33 And Saul said unto David— Thou art not able to go against this Philistine, to fight with him,—for a youth art thou, but he a man of war from his youth.
content_old: 33 And Saul said unto David— Thou art not able to go against this Philistine, to fight with him,—for a youth art thou, but he a man of war from his youth.

content: 34 Then said David unto Saul, Thy servant used to tend his father’s sheep,—and there would come a lion､ or a bear, and carry off a lamb out of the flock;
content_old: 34 Then said David unto Saul, Thy servant used to tend his father’s sheep,—and there would come a lion､ or a bear, and carry off a lamb out of the flock;

content: 35 and I would go out after him, and smite him､ and rescue it out of his mouth,—and if he rose against me I would catch him by his beard, and smite him､ and slay him.
content_old: 35 and I would go out after him, and smite him､ and rescue it out of his mouth,—and if he rose against me I would catch him by his beard, and smite him､ and slay him.

content: 36 Thy servant could slay either a lion or a bear,—and this uncircumcised Philistine shall become as one of them for he hath reproached the ranks of a Living God.
content_old: 36 Thy servant could slay either a lion or a bear,—and this uncircumcised Philistine shall become as one of them for he hath reproached the ranks of a Living God.

content: 37 And David said, Yahweh who hath rescued me out of the power of the lion､ and out of the power of the bear he will rescue us out of the hand of this Philistine. Then said Saul unto David､— Go! and Yahweh will be with thee.
content_old: 37 And David said, Yahweh who hath rescued me out of the power of the lion､ and out of the power of the bear he will rescue us out of the hand of this Philistine. Then said Saul unto David､— Go! and Yahweh will be with thee.

content: 38 And Saul clad David with his own military coat, and set a helmet of bronze upon his head,—and clad him with a coat of mail.
content_old: 38 And Saul clad David with his own military coat, and set a helmet of bronze upon his head,—and clad him with a coat of mail.

content: 39 And David girded his sword above his military coat､ but was reluctant to go､ for he had not proved them,—so David said unto Saul— I cannot go in these､ an for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.
content_old: 39 And David girded his sword above his military coat､ but was reluctant to go､ for he had not proved them,—so David said unto Saul— I cannot go in these､ an for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.

content: 40 Then took he his stick in his hand､ and chose him five smooth stones out of the torrent-bed, and put them in the shepherd’s-pouch which he had—even in the wallet､ an and had his sling in his hand,—and so drew near unto the Philistine.
content_old: 40 Then took he his stick in his hand､ and chose him five smooth stones out of the torrent-bed, and put them in the shepherd’s-pouch which he had—even in the wallet､ an and had his sling in his hand,—and so drew near unto the Philistine.

content: 41 And the Philistine came on and on, and drew near unto David,—and the man carrying the shield was before him.
content_old: 41 And the Philistine came on and on, and drew near unto David,—and the man carrying the shield was before him.

content: 42 And when the Philistine looked about､ and saw David he disdained him,—for he was a youth, and ruddy､ a stripling of fair countenance.
content_old: 42 And when the Philistine looked about､ and saw David he disdained him,—for he was a youth, and ruddy､ a stripling of fair countenance.

content: 43 Then said the Philistine unto David, A dog am I､ that thou art coming unto me with sticks? And the Philistine cursed David､ by his god.
content_old: 43 Then said the Philistine unto David, A dog am I､ that thou art coming unto me with sticks? And the Philistine cursed David､ by his god.

content: 44 And the Philistine said unto David,— Come unto me, that I may give thy flesh to the birds of heaven､ and to the beasts of the field.
content_old: 44 And the Philistine said unto David,— Come unto me, that I may give thy flesh to the birds of heaven､ and to the beasts of the field.

content: 45 Then said David unto the Philistine— Thou art coming unto me with sword､ and with spear､ and with javelin,—but I am coming unto thee in the name of Yahweh of hosts, God of the ranks of Israel which thou hast reproached.
content_old: 45 Then said David unto the Philistine— Thou art coming unto me with sword､ and with spear､ and with javelin,—but I am coming unto thee in the name of Yahweh of hosts, God of the ranks of Israel which thou hast reproached.

content: 46 This day will Yahweh deliver thee into my hand､ and I will smite thee､ and take thy head from off thee, and will give thy dead body and the dead bodies of the host of Philistines､ this day､ unto the birds of heaven､ and unto the wild beasts of the earth,—that all the earth may know that Israel hath a God;
content_old: 46 This day will Yahweh deliver thee into my hand､ and I will smite thee､ and take thy head from off thee, and will give thy dead body and the dead bodies of the host of Philistines､ this day､ unto the birds of heaven､ and unto the wild beasts of the earth,—that all the earth may know that Israel hath a God;

content: 47 and that all this gathered host may know that not with sword and with spear doth Yahweh save,—for unto Yahweh belongeth the battle, and he will deliver you into our hand.
content_old: 47 and that all this gathered host may know that not with sword and with spear doth Yahweh save,—for unto Yahweh belongeth the battle, and he will deliver you into our hand.

content: 48 And it came to pass when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David that David hasted, and ran toward the ranks to meet the Philistine.
content_old: 48 And it came to pass when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David that David hasted, and ran toward the ranks to meet the Philistine.

content: 49 And David thrust his hand into his pouch､ and took from thence a stone､ and slang it, and smote the Philistine､ in his forehead,—that the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell upon his face､ to the earth.
content_old: 49 And David thrust his hand into his pouch､ and took from thence a stone､ and slang it, and smote the Philistine､ in his forehead,—that the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell upon his face､ to the earth.

content: 50 Thus David prevailed over the Philistine､ with the sling and with the stone, and smote the Philistine､ and slew him,—but sword was there none in the hand of David.
content_old: 50 Thus David prevailed over the Philistine､ with the sling and with the stone, and smote the Philistine､ and slew him,—but sword was there none in the hand of David.

content: 51 So David ran､ and stood by the Philistine､ and took his sword and drew it out of the sheath thereof､ and slew him, and cut off､ therewith､ his head,—and when the Philistines saw that their hero was slain they fled.
content_old: 51 So David ran､ and stood by the Philistine､ and took his sword and drew it out of the sheath thereof､ and slew him, and cut off､ therewith､ his head,—and when the Philistines saw that their hero was slain they fled.

content: 52 Then arose the men of Israel and Judah､ and shouted､ and pursued the Philistines, as far as thine entrance into Gath, and as far as the gates of Ekron,—and the slain of the Philistines fell in the way to the two gates, even as far as Gath and as far as Ekron.
content_old: 52 Then arose the men of Israel and Judah､ and shouted､ and pursued the Philistines, as far as thine entrance into Gath, and as far as the gates of Ekron,—and the slain of the Philistines fell in the way to the two gates, even as far as Gath and as far as Ekron.

content: 53 And the sons of Israel returned from hotly pursuing the Philistines,—and plundered their camps.
content_old: 53 And the sons of Israel returned from hotly pursuing the Philistines,—and plundered their camps.

content: 54 And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it into Jerusalem,—but his armour put he into his tent.
content_old: 54 And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it into Jerusalem,—but his armour put he into his tent.

content: 55 And when Saul saw David going forth to meet the Philistine he said unto Abner､ prince of the host, Whose son is the young man､ Abner? And Abner said, By the life of thy soul O king! I know not.
content_old: 55 And when Saul saw David going forth to meet the Philistine he said unto Abner､ prince of the host, Whose son is the young man､ Abner? And Abner said, By the life of thy soul O king! I know not.

content: 56 Then said the king,— Ask thou whose son the stripling is?
content_old: 56 Then said the king,— Ask thou whose son the stripling is?
