content: 57 And when David returned from smiting the Philistine Abner took him, and brought him before Saul,—with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
content_old: 57 And when David returned from smiting the Philistine Abner took him, and brought him before Saul,—with the head of the Philistine in his hand.

content: 1 And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, so that Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, so that Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

content: 2 And Saul took him､ that day,—and suffered him not to return unto the house of his father.
content_old: 2 And Saul took him､ that day,—and suffered him not to return unto the house of his father.

content: 3 And Jonathan and David solemnised a covenant,—because he loved him as his own sou.
content_old: 3 And Jonathan and David solemnised a covenant,—because he loved him as his own sou.

content: 4 And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe which was upon him, and gave it to David,—and his equipments, even to his sword､ and to his bow､ and to his girdle.
content_old: 4 And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe which was upon him, and gave it to David,—and his equipments, even to his sword､ and to his bow､ and to his girdle.

content: 5 And David went forth—whithersoever Saul sent him he behaved himself prudently, so Saul set him over the men of war,—and he became a favourite in the eyes of all the people, yea even in the eyes of the servants of Saul.
content_old: 5 And David went forth—whithersoever Saul sent him he behaved himself prudently, so Saul set him over the men of war,—and he became a favourite in the eyes of all the people, yea even in the eyes of the servants of Saul.

content: 6 But so it was when they came in on the return of David from the smiting of the Philistine that the women went forth out of all the cities of Israel､ singing and dancing, to meet Saul the king,—with timbrels, with rejoicing､ and with instruments of three strings.
content_old: 6 But so it was when they came in on the return of David from the smiting of the Philistine that the women went forth out of all the cities of Israel､ singing and dancing, to meet Saul the king,—with timbrels, with rejoicing､ and with instruments of three strings.

content: 7 And the women that made merry responded to each other in song､ and said,— Saul hath smitten his thousands, But David his tens of thousands.
content_old: 7 And the women that made merry responded to each other in song､ and said,— Saul hath smitten his thousands, But David his tens of thousands.

content: 8 Then was Saul exceeding angry､ and this saying was offensive in his eyes, and he said,— They have ascribed to David ten thousands, But to me have they ascribed thousands,— What more then､ can he have but the kingdom?
content_old: 8 Then was Saul exceeding angry､ and this saying was offensive in his eyes, and he said,— They have ascribed to David ten thousands, But to me have they ascribed thousands,— What more then､ can he have but the kingdom?

content: 9 And Saul was eyeing David from that day forward.
content_old: 9 And Saul was eyeing David from that day forward.

content: 10 And when it came to pass､ on the morrow､ that a superhuman spirit of sadness came suddenly upon Saul､ and he was moved to raving in the midst of the house,—and David began playing with his hand､ as he had done day by day that a spear being in Saul’s hand,
content_old: 10 And when it came to pass､ on the morrow､ that a superhuman spirit of sadness came suddenly upon Saul､ and he was moved to raving in the midst of the house,—and David began playing with his hand､ as he had done day by day that a spear being in Saul’s hand,

content: 11 Saul hurled the spear, and said to himself— I will smite David､ even to the wall! But David moved round from before him twice.
content_old: 11 Saul hurled the spear, and said to himself— I will smite David､ even to the wall! But David moved round from before him twice.

content: 12 And Saul feared because of David,—for Yahweh was with him, whereas from Saul he had departed.
content_old: 12 And Saul feared because of David,—for Yahweh was with him, whereas from Saul he had departed.

content: 13 So Saul removed him from him, and appointed him to be for him the captain of a thousand,—and he went out and came in before the people.
content_old: 13 So Saul removed him from him, and appointed him to be for him the captain of a thousand,—and he went out and came in before the people.

content: 14 And it came to pass that David､ in all his ways､ acted prudently,—and Yahweh was with him.
content_old: 14 And it came to pass that David､ in all his ways､ acted prudently,—and Yahweh was with him.

content: 15 And when Saul saw that he was acting very prudently he was afraid of him.
content_old: 15 And when Saul saw that he was acting very prudently he was afraid of him.

content: 16 But all Israel and Judah were in love with David,—for he was going out and coming in before them.
content_old: 16 But all Israel and Judah were in love with David,—for he was going out and coming in before them.

content: 17 So then Saul said unto David— Lo! my elder daughter Merab her will I give thee to wife, only approve thyself unto me as a son of valour and fight the battles of Yahweh. Saul however､ had said to himself— Let not my own hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.
content_old: 17 So then Saul said unto David— Lo! my elder daughter Merab her will I give thee to wife, only approve thyself unto me as a son of valour and fight the battles of Yahweh. Saul however､ had said to himself— Let not my own hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.

content: 18 And David said unto Saul— Who am I､ or who are my kinsfolk, the family of my father､ in Israel,—that I should become son-in-law to the king?
content_old: 18 And David said unto Saul— Who am I､ or who are my kinsfolk, the family of my father､ in Israel,—that I should become son-in-law to the king?

content: 19 But it came to pass､ within the time for giving Merab daughter of Saul to David that she was given to Adriel the Meholathite､ to wife.
content_old: 19 But it came to pass､ within the time for giving Merab daughter of Saul to David that she was given to Adriel the Meholathite､ to wife.

content: 20 Then did Michal､ Saul’s daughter､ love David,—and it was told Saul, and the thing was right in his eyes.
content_old: 20 Then did Michal､ Saul’s daughter､ love David,—and it was told Saul, and the thing was right in his eyes.

content: 21 And Saul said to himself— I will give her unto him､ that she may prove to him a snare, and that the hand of the Philistines may be upon him. So then Saul said unto David, A second time mayest thou become my son-in law to-day.
content_old: 21 And Saul said to himself— I will give her unto him､ that she may prove to him a snare, and that the hand of the Philistines may be upon him. So then Saul said unto David, A second time mayest thou become my son-in law to-day.

content: 22 And Saul commanded his servants— Speak ye unto David quietly saying, Lo! the king delighteth in thee, and all his servants love thee,—now､ therefore､ become thou son-in-law to the king.
content_old: 22 And Saul commanded his servants— Speak ye unto David quietly saying, Lo! the king delighteth in thee, and all his servants love thee,—now､ therefore､ become thou son-in-law to the king.

content: 23 And the servants of Saul spake in the ears of David these words. And David said— Seemeth it a light thing in your eyes to become son-in-law to the king, seeing that I am a poor man and lightly esteemed?
content_old: 23 And the servants of Saul spake in the ears of David these words. And David said— Seemeth it a light thing in your eyes to become son-in-law to the king, seeing that I am a poor man and lightly esteemed?

content: 24 So the servants of Saul told him､ saying,— According to these words spake David､
content_old: 24 So the servants of Saul told him､ saying,— According to these words spake David､

content: 25 Then said Saul— Thus shall ye say unto David— The king hath no delight in purchase-price, but rather in a hundred foreskins of Philistines, by avenging himself on the enemies of the king. But Saul thought to let David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 25 Then said Saul— Thus shall ye say unto David— The king hath no delight in purchase-price, but rather in a hundred foreskins of Philistines, by avenging himself on the enemies of the king. But Saul thought to let David fall by the hand of the Philistines.

content: 26 So when his servants told David these words the thing was right in the eyes of David, to become son-in-law unto the king,—and the days had not expired.
content_old: 26 So when his servants told David these words the thing was right in the eyes of David, to become son-in-law unto the king,—and the days had not expired.

content: 27 Wherefore David arose､ and went—he and his men, and smote among the Philistines two hundred men, and David brought in their foreskins, and gave them in full tale unto the king､ that he might become son-in-law unto the king, and Saul gave him Michal his daughter､ to wife.
content_old: 27 Wherefore David arose､ and went—he and his men, and smote among the Philistines two hundred men, and David brought in their foreskins, and gave them in full tale unto the king､ that he might become son-in-law unto the king, and Saul gave him Michal his daughter､ to wife.

content: 28 And Saul saw and knew that Yahweh was with David,—and that all Israel loved him.
content_old: 28 And Saul saw and knew that Yahweh was with David,—and that all Israel loved him.

content: 29 So then Saul went on to fear because of David､ yet more,—and it came to pass that Saul was hostile to David､ all the days.
content_old: 29 So then Saul went on to fear because of David､ yet more,—and it came to pass that Saul was hostile to David､ all the days.

content: 1 Then spake Saul unto Jonathan his son､ and unto all his servants, that they should put David to death;
content_old: 1 Then spake Saul unto Jonathan his son､ and unto all his servants, that they should put David to death;

content: 2 but Jonathan､ Saul’s son delighted in David､ exceedingly,—so Jonathan told David､ saying, Saul､ my father､ is seeking to put thee to death,—now therefore､ take heed to thyself I pray thee､ in the morning, and abide thou in concealment､ and hide thyself;
content_old: 2 but Jonathan､ Saul’s son delighted in David､ exceedingly,—so Jonathan told David､ saying, Saul､ my father､ is seeking to put thee to death,—now therefore､ take heed to thyself I pray thee､ in the morning, and abide thou in concealment､ and hide thyself;

content: 3 and I will come out and stand beside my father､ in the field where thou art, and I will speak of thee unto my father,—and if I see aught I will tell thee.
content_old: 3 and I will come out and stand beside my father､ in the field where thou art, and I will speak of thee unto my father,—and if I see aught I will tell thee.

content: 4 So then Jonathan spake of David things that were good, unto Saul his father,—and said unto him— May the king not sin against his servant—against David; for he hath not sinned against thee, nay､ indeed his doings have been good to theeward exceedingly.
content_old: 4 So then Jonathan spake of David things that were good, unto Saul his father,—and said unto him— May the king not sin against his servant—against David; for he hath not sinned against thee, nay､ indeed his doings have been good to theeward exceedingly.

content: 5 And when he put his life in his hand､ and smote the Philistine, and Yahweh wrought a great victory for all Israel thou sawest､ and didst rejoice. Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou sin against innocent blood by putting David to death without cause?
content_old: 5 And when he put his life in his hand､ and smote the Philistine, and Yahweh wrought a great victory for all Israel thou sawest､ and didst rejoice. Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou sin against innocent blood by putting David to death without cause?

content: 6 And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan,—and Saul sware, By the life of Yahweh he shall not be put to death!
content_old: 6 And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan,—and Saul sware, By the life of Yahweh he shall not be put to death!

content: 7 And Jonathan called for David, and Jonathan told him all these things,—and Jonathan brought in David unto Saul, and so he was in his presence､ as aforetime.
content_old: 7 And Jonathan called for David, and Jonathan told him all these things,—and Jonathan brought in David unto Saul, and so he was in his presence､ as aforetime.

content: 8 But when the war again brake out,—and David went forth and fought with the Philistines､ and smote them with a great smiting, and they fled before him
content_old: 8 But when the war again brake out,—and David went forth and fought with the Philistines､ and smote them with a great smiting, and they fled before him

content: 9 then came there a sad spirit of Yahweh unto Saul, he being in his house､ seated､ with his spear in his hand,—while David played with his hand
content_old: 9 then came there a sad spirit of Yahweh unto Saul, he being in his house､ seated､ with his spear in his hand,—while David played with his hand

content: 10 Saul sought to smite David with the spear､ even to the wall, but he slipped away from before Saul, who smote the spear into the wall,—whereas David fled and escaped､ that night.
content_old: 10 Saul sought to smite David with the spear､ even to the wall, but he slipped away from before Saul, who smote the spear into the wall,—whereas David fled and escaped､ that night.

content: 11 And Saul sent messengers unto David’s house､ to watch him, and to put him to death､ in the morning! And Michal his wife told David､ saying, If thou do not deliver thyself to-night to-morrow art thou to be put to death.
content_old: 11 And Saul sent messengers unto David’s house､ to watch him, and to put him to death､ in the morning! And Michal his wife told David､ saying, If thou do not deliver thyself to-night to-morrow art thou to be put to death.

content: 12 So Michal let down David､ through the window, and he departed and fled､ and escaped.
content_old: 12 So Michal let down David､ through the window, and he departed and fled､ and escaped.

content: 13 And Michal took the household god､ and put it in the bed, and a fly-net of goat’s-hair put she at its head,—and covered it with the clothes.
content_old: 13 And Michal took the household god､ and put it in the bed, and a fly-net of goat’s-hair put she at its head,—and covered it with the clothes.

content: 14 And when Saul sent messengers to take David she said— He is sick.
content_old: 14 And when Saul sent messengers to take David she said— He is sick.

content: 15 So Saul sent messengers to see David､ saying,— Bring him up in the bed unto me､ that I may put him to death.
content_old: 15 So Saul sent messengers to see David､ saying,— Bring him up in the bed unto me､ that I may put him to death.

content: 16 And when the messengers entered lo! the household god in the bed,—with a fly-net of goat’s-hair at its head.
content_old: 16 And when the messengers entered lo! the household god in the bed,—with a fly-net of goat’s-hair at its head.

content: 17 And Saul said unto Michal— Wherefore in this way hast thou deceived me, and let go mine enemy､ that he hath escaped? Then said Michal unto Saul, He himself said unto me— Let me go､ wherefore should I put thee to death?
content_old: 17 And Saul said unto Michal— Wherefore in this way hast thou deceived me, and let go mine enemy､ that he hath escaped? Then said Michal unto Saul, He himself said unto me— Let me go､ wherefore should I put thee to death?

content: 18 So David fled､ and escaped､ and came in unto Samuel in Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him,—and he and Samuel departed, and dwelt in Naioth.
content_old: 18 So David fled､ and escaped､ and came in unto Samuel in Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him,—and he and Samuel departed, and dwelt in Naioth.

content: 19 And it was told Saul､ saying,— Lo! David is in Naioth､ in Ramah.
content_old: 19 And it was told Saul､ saying,— Lo! David is in Naioth､ in Ramah.

content: 20 So Saul sent messengers to take David, but when they saw the assembly of prophets prophesying､ and Samuel standing as head over them then came the Spirit of God upon the messengers of Saul､ and they also were moved to prophesy.
content_old: 20 So Saul sent messengers to take David, but when they saw the assembly of prophets prophesying､ and Samuel standing as head over them then came the Spirit of God upon the messengers of Saul､ and they also were moved to prophesy.

content: 21 And when they told Saul､ and he sent other messengers then were they also moved to prophesy. And when Saul again sent messengers a third time then were they also moved to prophesy.
content_old: 21 And when they told Saul､ and he sent other messengers then were they also moved to prophesy. And when Saul again sent messengers a third time then were they also moved to prophesy.

content: 22 Then went he also himself to Ramah､ and came in as far as the well of the threshing-floor which is in Sephi, and asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said— Lo! in Naioth､ in Ramah.
content_old: 22 Then went he also himself to Ramah､ and came in as far as the well of the threshing-floor which is in Sephi, and asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said— Lo! in Naioth､ in Ramah.

content: 23 And when he departed from thence towards Naioth in Ramah then came upon him also the Spirit of God､ and he went on and on､ and was moved to prophesy, until he entered Naioth in Ramah.
content_old: 23 And when he departed from thence towards Naioth in Ramah then came upon him also the Spirit of God､ and he went on and on､ and was moved to prophesy, until he entered Naioth in Ramah.

content: 1 And David fled from Naioth､ in Ramah,—and came in､ and said before Jonathan— What have I done? What is my transgression､ and what my sin､ before thy father, that he seeketh my life?
content_old: 1 And David fled from Naioth､ in Ramah,—and came in､ and said before Jonathan— What have I done? What is my transgression､ and what my sin､ before thy father, that he seeketh my life?

content: 2 And he said unto him— Far be it! thou shalt not die. Lo! my father doeth nothing､ great or small, without unveiling mine ear,—wherefore､ then､ should my father hide from me this thing? There is nothing in this.
content_old: 2 And he said unto him— Far be it! thou shalt not die. Lo! my father doeth nothing､ great or small, without unveiling mine ear,—wherefore､ then､ should my father hide from me this thing? There is nothing in this.

content: 3 But David sware yet further､ and said— Thy father doth know that I have found favour in thine eyes, therefore saith he,— Do not let Jonathan know this､ lest he grieve; but､ indeed by the life of Yahweh､ and by the life of thine own soul surely there is but as it were a step betwixt me and death!
content_old: 3 But David sware yet further､ and said— Thy father doth know that I have found favour in thine eyes, therefore saith he,— Do not let Jonathan know this､ lest he grieve; but､ indeed by the life of Yahweh､ and by the life of thine own soul surely there is but as it were a step betwixt me and death!

content: 4 And Jonathan said unto David,— Whatsoever thy soul shall desire I will do for thee.
content_old: 4 And Jonathan said unto David,— Whatsoever thy soul shall desire I will do for thee.

content: 5 And David said unto Jonathan— Lo! the new moon is to-morrow, and I must not sit with the king､ to eat,—let me go then､ and hide myself in the field, until the evening.
content_old: 5 And David said unto Jonathan— Lo! the new moon is to-morrow, and I must not sit with the king､ to eat,—let me go then､ and hide myself in the field, until the evening.

content: 6 If thy father enquire for me then shalt thou say— David did ask leave of me､ to run to Bethlehem､ his own city, for a yearly sacrifice is to be held there for all the family.
content_old: 6 If thy father enquire for me then shalt thou say— David did ask leave of me､ to run to Bethlehem､ his own city, for a yearly sacrifice is to be held there for all the family.

content: 7 If thus he say— It is well,— thy servant shall have peace,—but if it anger him know that harm hath been determined by him.
content_old: 7 If thus he say— It is well,— thy servant shall have peace,—but if it anger him know that harm hath been determined by him.

content: 8 Thus shalt thou do a lovingkindness for thy servant, for into a covenant of Yahweh hast thou brought thy servant､ with thee,— But if there is in me transgression put me to death thyself, for unto thy father wherefore shouldst thou bring me in?
content_old: 8 Thus shalt thou do a lovingkindness for thy servant, for into a covenant of Yahweh hast thou brought thy servant､ with thee,— But if there is in me transgression put me to death thyself, for unto thy father wherefore shouldst thou bring me in?

content: 9 And Jonathan said— Far be it from thee! but if I get to know that harm is determined by my father､ to bring it upon thee is not that the thing that I will tell thee?
content_old: 9 And Jonathan said— Far be it from thee! but if I get to know that harm is determined by my father､ to bring it upon thee is not that the thing that I will tell thee?

content: 10 Then said David unto Jonathan, Who shall tell me,—if thy father answer thee aught that is harsh?
content_old: 10 Then said David unto Jonathan, Who shall tell me,—if thy father answer thee aught that is harsh?

content: 11 And Jonathan said unto David, Come!､ and let us go out into the field. And they two went out into the field.
content_old: 11 And Jonathan said unto David, Come!､ and let us go out into the field. And they two went out into the field.

content: 12 Then said Jonathan unto David— Witness be Yahweh God of Israel that I will sound my father about this time to-morrow or the third day, and lo! if there be good towards David will I not then send unto thee, and unveil thine ear?
content_old: 12 Then said Jonathan unto David— Witness be Yahweh God of Israel that I will sound my father about this time to-morrow or the third day, and lo! if there be good towards David will I not then send unto thee, and unveil thine ear?

content: 13 So let Yahweh do unto Jonathan､ and so let him add—when harm against thee seemeth good unto my father then will I unveil thine ear, and let thee go､ and thou shalt depart in peace,—then Yahweh be with thee, as he hath been with my father.
content_old: 13 So let Yahweh do unto Jonathan､ and so let him add—when harm against thee seemeth good unto my father then will I unveil thine ear, and let thee go､ and thou shalt depart in peace,—then Yahweh be with thee, as he hath been with my father.

content: 14 And not only while I yet live shalt thou deal with me in the lovingkindness of Yahweh､ that I die not:
content_old: 14 And not only while I yet live shalt thou deal with me in the lovingkindness of Yahweh､ that I die not:

content: 15 but thou shalt not cut off thy lovingkindness from my house､ unto times age-abiding,—no! not when Yahweh hath cut off the enemies of David, every one from off the face of the ground.
content_old: 15 but thou shalt not cut off thy lovingkindness from my house､ unto times age-abiding,—no! not when Yahweh hath cut off the enemies of David, every one from off the face of the ground.

content: 16 Thus Jonathan solemnised a covenant with the house of David saying,— So let Yahweh require it､ at the hand of the enemies of David.
content_old: 16 Thus Jonathan solemnised a covenant with the house of David saying,— So let Yahweh require it､ at the hand of the enemies of David.

content: 17 And again Jonathan sware unto David, by his love to him,—for as he loved his own soul so loved he him.
content_old: 17 And again Jonathan sware unto David, by his love to him,—for as he loved his own soul so loved he him.

content: 18 Then said Jonathan unto him— To-morrow is the new moon, and thou wilt be missed, for thy seat will be empty;
content_old: 18 Then said Jonathan unto him— To-morrow is the new moon, and thou wilt be missed, for thy seat will be empty;

content: 19 and when thou hast tarried three days thou shalt come down quickly and enter the place､ where thou didst hide thyself on the day of the deed, and shalt remain by the side of this mound.
content_old: 19 and when thou hast tarried three days thou shalt come down quickly and enter the place､ where thou didst hide thyself on the day of the deed, and shalt remain by the side of this mound.

content: 20 And as for me—three arrows to the side will I shoot,—as though I shot at a mark.
content_old: 20 And as for me—three arrows to the side will I shoot,—as though I shot at a mark.

content: 21 And lo! I will send the boy saying, Go､ find the arrow! If I say to the boy— Lo! the arrows are on this side of thee—take them then come､ for there is peace for thee､ and no cause for fear by the life of Yahweh.
content_old: 21 And lo! I will send the boy saying, Go､ find the arrow! If I say to the boy— Lo! the arrows are on this side of thee—take them then come､ for there is peace for thee､ and no cause for fear by the life of Yahweh.

content: 22 But if thus I say to the youth, Lo! the arrows are beyond thee depart, for Yahweh hath sent thee away.
content_old: 22 But if thus I say to the youth, Lo! the arrows are beyond thee depart, for Yahweh hath sent thee away.

content: 23 But as touching the matter whereof we spake— I and thou lo! Yahweh be betwixt me and thee､ unto times age abiding.
content_old: 23 But as touching the matter whereof we spake— I and thou lo! Yahweh be betwixt me and thee､ unto times age abiding.

content: 24 So David hid himself in the field—and when the new moon had come the king sat down to eat food,
content_old: 24 So David hid himself in the field—and when the new moon had come the king sat down to eat food,

content: 25 yea the king sat down on his seat､ as at other times､ by the seat against the wall, and when Jonathan arose Abner seated himself by the side of Saul,—but David’s place was empty.
content_old: 25 yea the king sat down on his seat､ as at other times､ by the seat against the wall, and when Jonathan arose Abner seated himself by the side of Saul,—but David’s place was empty.

content: 26 Saul､ however､ spake nothing that day,—for he said to himself— It is an accident he is not clean, because he hath not been cleansed.
content_old: 26 Saul､ however､ spake nothing that day,—for he said to himself— It is an accident he is not clean, because he hath not been cleansed.

content: 27 And it came to pass on the morrow､ the second of the month that David’s place was empty,—and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore hath not the son of Jesse come in either yesterday or to-day to meat?
content_old: 27 And it came to pass on the morrow､ the second of the month that David’s place was empty,—and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore hath not the son of Jesse come in either yesterday or to-day to meat?

content: 28 And Jonathan answered Saul,— David asked leave of me､ to go as far as Bethlehem;
content_old: 28 And Jonathan answered Saul,— David asked leave of me､ to go as far as Bethlehem;

content: 29 and said— Let me go､ I pray thee, for a family sacrifice have we in the city､ and my brethren have commanded me, now､ therefore､ if I have found favour in thine eyes let me slip away､ I pray thee､ that I may see my brethren. For this cause hath he not come in unto the table of the king.
content_old: 29 and said— Let me go､ I pray thee, for a family sacrifice have we in the city､ and my brethren have commanded me, now､ therefore､ if I have found favour in thine eyes let me slip away､ I pray thee､ that I may see my brethren. For this cause hath he not come in unto the table of the king.

content: 30 Then was Saul’s anger kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of rebellious perversity! do I not know that thou art confederate with the son of Jesse to thine own confusion, and to the confusion of the shame of thy mother?
content_old: 30 Then was Saul’s anger kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of rebellious perversity! do I not know that thou art confederate with the son of Jesse to thine own confusion, and to the confusion of the shame of thy mother?

content: 31 For as long as the son of Jesse liveth on the ground thou wilt not be established､ thou nor thy kingdom, Now therefore､ send and fetch him unto me, for doomed to death is he!
content_old: 31 For as long as the son of Jesse liveth on the ground thou wilt not be established､ thou nor thy kingdom, Now therefore､ send and fetch him unto me, for doomed to death is he!

content: 32 And Jonathan responded to Saul his father,—and said unto him— Wherefore must he be put to death What hath he done?
content_old: 32 And Jonathan responded to Saul his father,—and said unto him— Wherefore must he be put to death What hath he done?

content: 33 And Saul hurled his spear at him､ to smite him. So Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father､ to put David to death.
content_old: 33 And Saul hurled his spear at him､ to smite him. So Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father､ to put David to death.

content: 34 Jonathan therefore rose up from the table､ in a glow of anger,—and did eat no food on the second day of the month, for he was grieved for David, because his father had reviled him.
content_old: 34 Jonathan therefore rose up from the table､ in a glow of anger,—and did eat no food on the second day of the month, for he was grieved for David, because his father had reviled him.

content: 35 And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went forth into the field､ to the place appointed with David,—a little lad being with him.
content_old: 35 And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went forth into the field､ to the place appointed with David,—a little lad being with him.

content: 36 And he said to his lad— Run､ find､ I pray thee､ the arrows which I am about to shoot. The boy ran, but he shot the arrow beyond him.
content_old: 36 And he said to his lad— Run､ find､ I pray thee､ the arrows which I am about to shoot. The boy ran, but he shot the arrow beyond him.

content: 37 And when the lad came as far as the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot Jonathan cried after the lad､ and said, Is not the arrow beyond thee?
content_old: 37 And when the lad came as far as the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot Jonathan cried after the lad､ and said, Is not the arrow beyond thee?

content: 38 And Jonathan cried after the lad, Haste thee—be quick､ do not stay! So Jonathan’s lad picked up the arrows and brought them unto his master.
content_old: 38 And Jonathan cried after the lad, Haste thee—be quick､ do not stay! So Jonathan’s lad picked up the arrows and brought them unto his master.

content: 39 But the lad knew nothing only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
content_old: 39 But the lad knew nothing only Jonathan and David knew the matter.

content: 40 So Jonathan gave his weapons unto his lad､ and said to him, Go､ carry them into the city.
content_old: 40 So Jonathan gave his weapons unto his lad､ and said to him, Go､ carry them into the city.

content: 41 As soon as the lad was gone David arose from beside the South, and fell on his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down three times,—and they kissed each other､ and wept over each other, until David exceeded.
content_old: 41 As soon as the lad was gone David arose from beside the South, and fell on his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down three times,—and they kissed each other､ and wept over each other, until David exceeded.

content: 1 Then came David to Nôb, unto Ahimelech､ the priest,—and Ahimelech trembled when he met David､ and said unto him— Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?
content_old: 1 Then came David to Nôb, unto Ahimelech､ the priest,—and Ahimelech trembled when he met David､ and said unto him— Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?

content: 2 And David said unto Ahimelech the priest— The king hath charged me with a matter, and hath said unto me— Let no man know aught of the business on which I am sending thee､ and with which I have charged thee,— But unto the young men have I appointed such and such a place.
content_old: 2 And David said unto Ahimelech the priest— The king hath charged me with a matter, and hath said unto me— Let no man know aught of the business on which I am sending thee､ and with which I have charged thee,— But unto the young men have I appointed such and such a place.

content: 3 Now therefore､ what is there under thy hand? Five loaves give thou into my hand,—or whatever can be found.
content_old: 3 Now therefore､ what is there under thy hand? Five loaves give thou into my hand,—or whatever can be found.

content: 4 And the priest answered David､ and said, There is no common bread under my hand,—but hallowed bread there is, if the young men have kept themselves at least from women.
content_old: 4 And the priest answered David､ and said, There is no common bread under my hand,—but hallowed bread there is, if the young men have kept themselves at least from women.

content: 5 And David answered the priest and said to him— Of a truth women have been withheld from us､ of late､ through my coming out, and the wallets of the young men have become hallowed,—while the bread itself is in a manner common, and the more so since to-day there are other loaves to be hallowed､ in the vessel.
content_old: 5 And David answered the priest and said to him— Of a truth women have been withheld from us､ of late､ through my coming out, and the wallets of the young men have become hallowed,—while the bread itself is in a manner common, and the more so since to-day there are other loaves to be hallowed､ in the vessel.

content: 6 So the priest gave him hallowed bread,—because there was there no bread､ save the Presence-Bread､ which had to be removed from before Yahweh, to put hot bread, on the day when it should be taken away.
content_old: 6 So the priest gave him hallowed bread,—because there was there no bread､ save the Presence-Bread､ which had to be removed from before Yahweh, to put hot bread, on the day when it should be taken away.

content: 7 Now in that very place was a man of the servants of Saul､ on that day､ detained before Yahweh, whose name was Doeg the Edomite,—chief of the shepherds that belonged unto Saul.
content_old: 7 Now in that very place was a man of the servants of Saul､ on that day､ detained before Yahweh, whose name was Doeg the Edomite,—chief of the shepherds that belonged unto Saul.

content: 8 Then said David to Ahimelech, See whether there is here under thy hand a spear or a sword? for neither my sword､ nor my other weapons did I take in my hand, for the king’s business was urgent.
content_old: 8 Then said David to Ahimelech, See whether there is here under thy hand a spear or a sword? for neither my sword､ nor my other weapons did I take in my hand, for the king’s business was urgent.

content: 9 And the priest said: The sword of Goliath the Philistine､ whom thou didst smite in the vale of EIah lo! that is wrapped up in a cloth､ behind the ephod, if that thou wilt take to thee take it, for there is no other､ save that､ here. And David said— There is none like it､ give it me.
content_old: 9 And the priest said: The sword of Goliath the Philistine､ whom thou didst smite in the vale of EIah lo! that is wrapped up in a cloth､ behind the ephod, if that thou wilt take to thee take it, for there is no other､ save that､ here. And David said— There is none like it､ give it me.

content: 10 Then arose David, and fled､ that day､ from the face of Saul,—and came in unto Achish､ king of Gath.
content_old: 10 Then arose David, and fled､ that day､ from the face of Saul,—and came in unto Achish､ king of Gath.

content: 11 And the servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David､ king of the land? Was it not of this man that they kept responding in the dances､ saying, Saul hath smitten his thousands But David his tens of thousands?
content_old: 11 And the servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David､ king of the land? Was it not of this man that they kept responding in the dances､ saying, Saul hath smitten his thousands But David his tens of thousands?

content: 12 And David laid up these words in his heart,—and feared greatly, because of Achish king of Gath.
content_old: 12 And David laid up these words in his heart,—and feared greatly, because of Achish king of Gath.

content: 13 So he feigned himself mad､ in their sight, and raged in their hand,—and struck against the doors of the gate, and let his spittle run down upon his beard.
content_old: 13 So he feigned himself mad､ in their sight, and raged in their hand,—and struck against the doors of the gate, and let his spittle run down upon his beard.

content: 14 Then said Achish unto his servants,— Lo! ye can see､ a madman playing his pranks, wherefore should ye bring him in unto me?
content_old: 14 Then said Achish unto his servants,— Lo! ye can see､ a madman playing his pranks, wherefore should ye bring him in unto me?

content: 1 David therefore departed thence, and escaped､ into the cave of Adullam,—and when his brethren and all the household of his father heard it they went down unto him､ thither.
content_old: 1 David therefore departed thence, and escaped､ into the cave of Adullam,—and when his brethren and all the household of his father heard it they went down unto him､ thither.

content: 2 And there gathered themselves unto him—every one that was in distress､ and every one that had a creditor､ and every one embittered in soul, and he came to be over them as a prince,—and there were with him､ about four hundred men.
content_old: 2 And there gathered themselves unto him—every one that was in distress､ and every one that had a creditor､ and every one embittered in soul, and he came to be over them as a prince,—and there were with him､ about four hundred men.

content: 3 And David departed thence､ to Mizpah of Moab,—and said unto the king of Moab, I pray thee､ let my father and my mother dwell with you, until that I know what God will do for me.
content_old: 3 And David departed thence､ to Mizpah of Moab,—and said unto the king of Moab, I pray thee､ let my father and my mother dwell with you, until that I know what God will do for me.

content: 4 So he set them before the king of Moab,—and they dwelt with him, all the days that David was in the fortress.
content_old: 4 So he set them before the king of Moab,—and they dwelt with him, all the days that David was in the fortress.

content: 5 Then said Gad the prophet unto David— Thou must not abide in the fortress, go and get thee into the land of Judah. So David departed, and entered the forest of Hereth.
content_old: 5 Then said Gad the prophet unto David— Thou must not abide in the fortress, go and get thee into the land of Judah. So David departed, and entered the forest of Hereth.

content: 6 And when Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him—Saul being seated in Gibeah under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah､ with his spear in his hand, and all his servants stationed by him—
content_old: 6 And when Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him—Saul being seated in Gibeah under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah､ with his spear in his hand, and all his servants stationed by him—

content: 7 then said Saul unto his servants who were stationed by him— Hear､ I pray you､ ye Benjamites! What! even to all of you will the son of Jesse give fields and vineyards? All of you will he appoint to be princes of thousands､ and princes of hundreds?
content_old: 7 then said Saul unto his servants who were stationed by him— Hear､ I pray you､ ye Benjamites! What! even to all of you will the son of Jesse give fields and vineyards? All of you will he appoint to be princes of thousands､ and princes of hundreds?

content: 8 That ye have conspired､ all of you､ against me, And there is none to uncover mine ear as to the covenanting of my son with the son of Jesse? And none from among you that taketh pity upon me､ and that uncovereth mine ear to this,— That mine own son hath stirred up my servants against me､ to lie in wait､ as at this day?
content_old: 8 That ye have conspired､ all of you､ against me, And there is none to uncover mine ear as to the covenanting of my son with the son of Jesse? And none from among you that taketh pity upon me､ and that uncovereth mine ear to this,— That mine own son hath stirred up my servants against me､ to lie in wait､ as at this day?

content: 9 Then answered Doeg the Edomite—he being stationed near the servants of Saul—and said,— I saw the son of Jesse coming into Nôb, unto Ahimelech son of Ahitub;
content_old: 9 Then answered Doeg the Edomite—he being stationed near the servants of Saul—and said,— I saw the son of Jesse coming into Nôb, unto Ahimelech son of Ahitub;

content: 10 Then enquired he for him of Yahweh, Provisions also gave he unto him,— And the sword of Goliath the Philistine gave he unto him.
content_old: 10 Then enquired he for him of Yahweh, Provisions also gave he unto him,— And the sword of Goliath the Philistine gave he unto him.

content: 11 Then the king sent to call Ahimelech, son of Ahitub､ the priest､ and all the house of his father—the priests､ who were in Nôb,—and they came､ all of them､ unto the king.
content_old: 11 Then the king sent to call Ahimelech, son of Ahitub､ the priest､ and all the house of his father—the priests､ who were in Nôb,—and they came､ all of them､ unto the king.

content: 12 And Saul said, Hear､ I pray thee､ thou son of Ahitub! And he said— Behold me! my lord.
content_old: 12 And Saul said, Hear､ I pray thee､ thou son of Ahitub! And he said— Behold me! my lord.

content: 13 And Saul said unto him, Wherefore have ye conspired against me, thou､ and the son of Jesse,—in that thou gavest him bread and a sword､ and didst enquire for him of God, that he might rise up against me､ that he might lie in wait､ as at this day?
content_old: 13 And Saul said unto him, Wherefore have ye conspired against me, thou､ and the son of Jesse,—in that thou gavest him bread and a sword､ and didst enquire for him of God, that he might rise up against me､ that he might lie in wait､ as at this day?

content: 14 Then Ahimelech answered the king､ and said,— But who､ among all thy servants､ like David is faithful, being son-in-law to the king､ and cometh near to have audience with thee, and is honoured in thy household?
content_old: 14 Then Ahimelech answered the king､ and said,— But who､ among all thy servants､ like David is faithful, being son-in-law to the king､ and cometh near to have audience with thee, and is honoured in thy household?

content: 15 Did I that day begin to enquire for him of God? Far from me! Let not the king impute to his servant such a thing､ nor to any of the household of my father, for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.
content_old: 15 Did I that day begin to enquire for him of God? Far from me! Let not the king impute to his servant such a thing､ nor to any of the household of my father, for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.

content: 16 And the king said: Thou shalt die､ Ahimelech,—thou and all the household of thy father.
content_old: 16 And the king said: Thou shalt die､ Ahimelech,—thou and all the household of thy father.

content: 17 And the king said unto the runners that were stationed by him— Turn ye round and put to death the priests of Yahweh､ because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he was in flight, and unveiled not mine ear. But the servants of the king were not willing to thrust forth their hand, to fall upon the priests of Yahweh.
content_old: 17 And the king said unto the runners that were stationed by him— Turn ye round and put to death the priests of Yahweh､ because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he was in flight, and unveiled not mine ear. But the servants of the king were not willing to thrust forth their hand, to fall upon the priests of Yahweh.

content: 18 Then said the king to Doeg, Turn thou, and fall upon the priests. So Doeg the Edomite turned､ and himself fell upon the priests, and put to death､ that day､ four score and five men bearing an ephod of linen;
content_old: 18 Then said the king to Doeg, Turn thou, and fall upon the priests. So Doeg the Edomite turned､ and himself fell upon the priests, and put to death､ that day､ four score and five men bearing an ephod of linen;

content: 19 Nôb also､ the city of the priests smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings,—and oxen and asses and sheep､ with the edge of the sword.
content_old: 19 Nôb also､ the city of the priests smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings,—and oxen and asses and sheep､ with the edge of the sword.

content: 20 But there escaped one son of Ahimelech､ son of Ahitub, whose name was Abiathar,—and he fled after David.
content_old: 20 But there escaped one son of Ahimelech､ son of Ahitub, whose name was Abiathar,—and he fled after David.

content: 21 So Abiathar told David,—that Saul had slain the priests of Yahweh.
content_old: 21 So Abiathar told David,—that Saul had slain the priests of Yahweh.

content: 22 Then said David to Abiathar— I knew､ that day､ when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I am chargeable with all the lives of the house of thy father.
content_old: 22 Then said David to Abiathar— I knew､ that day､ when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I am chargeable with all the lives of the house of thy father.

content: 1 Then told they David､ saying,— Lo! the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are plundering the threshing-floors.
content_old: 1 Then told they David､ saying,— Lo! the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are plundering the threshing-floors.

content: 2 So David enquired of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And Yahweh said unto David— Go､ and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.
content_old: 2 So David enquired of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And Yahweh said unto David— Go､ and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.

content: 3 But the men of David said unto him, Lo! we､ here､ in Judah are afraid,—how much more､ then､ if we go to Keilah, against the ranks of the Philistines?
content_old: 3 But the men of David said unto him, Lo! we､ here､ in Judah are afraid,—how much more､ then､ if we go to Keilah, against the ranks of the Philistines?

content: 4 So David yet again enquired of Yahweh, and Yahweh answered him,—and said— Arise､ go down to Keilah, for I am about to deliver the Philistines into thy hand.
content_old: 4 So David yet again enquired of Yahweh, and Yahweh answered him,—and said— Arise､ go down to Keilah, for I am about to deliver the Philistines into thy hand.

content: 5 David therefore went､ with his men､ to Keilah､ and fought with the Philistines､ and drave forth their cattle, and smote them､ with a great smiting,—so David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
content_old: 5 David therefore went､ with his men､ to Keilah､ and fought with the Philistines､ and drave forth their cattle, and smote them､ with a great smiting,—so David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

content: 6 Now it came to pass when Abiathar､ son of Ahimelech､ fled unto David to Keilah that he came down with an ephod in his hand.
content_old: 6 Now it came to pass when Abiathar､ son of Ahimelech､ fled unto David to Keilah that he came down with an ephod in his hand.

content: 7 And when it was told Saul that David had entered Keilah Saul said— God hath given him over into my hand, for he hath shut himself in by entering into a city with folding doors and bar.
content_old: 7 And when it was told Saul that David had entered Keilah Saul said— God hath given him over into my hand, for he hath shut himself in by entering into a city with folding doors and bar.

content: 8 So Saul summoned all the people to war,—to go down to Keilah, to besiege David､ and his men.
content_old: 8 So Saul summoned all the people to war,—to go down to Keilah, to besiege David､ and his men.

content: 9 And David ascertained that against him Saul was contriving mischief,—so he said unto Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.
content_old: 9 And David ascertained that against him Saul was contriving mischief,—so he said unto Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.

content: 10 Then said David: O Yahweh､ God of Israel, thy servant hath heard that Saul is seeking to come unto Keilah,—to destroy the city for my sake:
content_old: 10 Then said David: O Yahweh､ God of Israel, thy servant hath heard that Saul is seeking to come unto Keilah,—to destroy the city for my sake:

content: 11 Will the owners of Keilah surrender me into his hand? Will Saul come down､ as thy servant hath heard? O Yahweh､ God of Israel, I pray thee､ tell thy servant. And Yahweh said— He will come down.
content_old: 11 Will the owners of Keilah surrender me into his hand? Will Saul come down､ as thy servant hath heard? O Yahweh､ God of Israel, I pray thee､ tell thy servant. And Yahweh said— He will come down.

content: 12 Then said David, Will the owners of Keilah surrender me and my men､ into the hand of Saul? And Yahweh said— They will surrender.
content_old: 12 Then said David, Will the owners of Keilah surrender me and my men､ into the hand of Saul? And Yahweh said— They will surrender.

content: 13 Then arose David and his men､ about six hundred､ and went forth out of Keilah, and went to and fro､ whithersoever they could,—and unto Saul it was told that David had escaped out of Keilah, so he forbare to go forth.
content_old: 13 Then arose David and his men､ about six hundred､ and went forth out of Keilah, and went to and fro､ whithersoever they could,—and unto Saul it was told that David had escaped out of Keilah, so he forbare to go forth.

content: 14 Then David abode in the wilderness, in the fortresses, and he abode in the hill country､ in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him continually, but God delivered him not into his hand.
content_old: 14 Then David abode in the wilderness, in the fortresses, and he abode in the hill country､ in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him continually, but God delivered him not into his hand.

content: 15 Then David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life David being in the wilderness of Ziph､ in the thicket.
content_old: 15 Then David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life David being in the wilderness of Ziph､ in the thicket.

content: 16 So Jonathan､ Saul’s son､ arose and went unto David in the thicket,—and strengthened his hand in God;
content_old: 16 So Jonathan､ Saul’s son､ arose and went unto David in the thicket,—and strengthened his hand in God;

content: 17 and said unto him,— Do not fear､ for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee, but thou shalt become king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee,—yea and Saul my father knoweth this.
content_old: 17 and said unto him,— Do not fear､ for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee, but thou shalt become king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee,—yea and Saul my father knoweth this.

content: 18 And they two solemnised a covenant before Yahweh,—and David remained in the thicket, but Jonathan departed to his own house.
content_old: 18 And they two solemnised a covenant before Yahweh,—and David remained in the thicket, but Jonathan departed to his own house.

content: 19 Then came up the Ziphites unto Saul in Gibeah､ saying,— Is not David hiding himself with us､ in the strongholds in the thicket, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the right of Jeshimon?
content_old: 19 Then came up the Ziphites unto Saul in Gibeah､ saying,— Is not David hiding himself with us､ in the strongholds in the thicket, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the right of Jeshimon?

content: 20 Now therefore､ according to all the desire of thy soul､ O king､ to come down come! and ours will it be to surrender him into the hand of the king.
content_old: 20 Now therefore､ according to all the desire of thy soul､ O king､ to come down come! and ours will it be to surrender him into the hand of the king.

content: 21 Then said Saul, Blessed be ye､ of Yahweh,—because ye have taken pity upon me.
content_old: 21 Then said Saul, Blessed be ye､ of Yahweh,—because ye have taken pity upon me.

content: 22 Go､ I pray you､ make ready yet further､ and get to know and see his place､ where may be his track, who hath seen him there,—for it hath been said unto me, Cunning indeed is he!
content_old: 22 Go､ I pray you､ make ready yet further､ and get to know and see his place､ where may be his track, who hath seen him there,—for it hath been said unto me, Cunning indeed is he!

content: 23 See, then, and get to know—of all the hiding places､ where he hideth himself, and return unto me､ for certainty, then will I go with you,—and it shall be if he is in the land that I will search him out through all the thousands of Judah.
content_old: 23 See, then, and get to know—of all the hiding places､ where he hideth himself, and return unto me､ for certainty, then will I go with you,—and it shall be if he is in the land that I will search him out through all the thousands of Judah.

content: 24 So they arose and departed to Ziph､ before Saul,—but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon､ in the Arabah, to the right of Jeshimon.
content_old: 24 So they arose and departed to Ziph､ before Saul,—but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon､ in the Arabah, to the right of Jeshimon.

content: 25 Then Saul and his men departed､ to seek him; but it had been told David､ and he had gone down the cliff, and taken up his abode in the wilderness of Maon,—and when Saul had heard it he pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.
content_old: 25 Then Saul and his men departed､ to seek him; but it had been told David､ and he had gone down the cliff, and taken up his abode in the wilderness of Maon,—and when Saul had heard it he pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.

content: 26 And Saul went on this side of the mountain､ and David and his men on that side of the mountain,—wherefore David became hurried､ to get away from the presence of Saul, but Saul and his men were surrounding David and his men to capture them:
content_old: 26 And Saul went on this side of the mountain､ and David and his men on that side of the mountain,—wherefore David became hurried､ to get away from the presence of Saul, but Saul and his men were surrounding David and his men to capture them:

content: 27 when a messenger came unto Saul､ saying,— Haste thee and come! for the Philistines have spread over the land.
content_old: 27 when a messenger came unto Saul､ saying,— Haste thee and come! for the Philistines have spread over the land.

content: 28 Then returned Saul from pursuing David, and departed to meet the Philistines,—for which cause they called that place Sela-hammahle-kôth “the Cliff of Separation”
content_old: 28 Then returned Saul from pursuing David, and departed to meet the Philistines,—for which cause they called that place Sela-hammahle-kôth “the Cliff of Separation”

content: 1 And it came to pass when Saul had returned from following the Philistines that it was told him､ saying: Lo! David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when Saul had returned from following the Philistines that it was told him､ saying: Lo! David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.

content: 2 Then Saul took three thousand chosen men､ out of all Israel,—and went to seek David and his men, over the face of the rocks of the mountain-goats.
content_old: 2 Then Saul took three thousand chosen men､ out of all Israel,—and went to seek David and his men, over the face of the rocks of the mountain-goats.

content: 3 And he came into the sheep-folds by the way､ there being a cave, which Saul entered､ to cover his feet,— David and his men､ in the hinder part of the cave､ having taken up their abode.
content_old: 3 And he came into the sheep-folds by the way､ there being a cave, which Saul entered､ to cover his feet,— David and his men､ in the hinder part of the cave､ having taken up their abode.

content: 4 So David’s men said unto him— Lo! the day of which Yahweh said unto thee— Lo! I am about to deliver up thine enemy､ into thy hand: therefore shalt thou do unto him, as shall be good in thine eyes. And David arose､ and cut off the corner of the robe which belonged to Saul､ by stealth.
content_old: 4 So David’s men said unto him— Lo! the day of which Yahweh said unto thee— Lo! I am about to deliver up thine enemy､ into thy hand: therefore shalt thou do unto him, as shall be good in thine eyes. And David arose､ and cut off the corner of the robe which belonged to Saul､ by stealth.

content: 5 And it came to pass afterwards that David’s heart smote him,—because he had cut off the corner of the robe which belonged to Saul.
content_old: 5 And it came to pass afterwards that David’s heart smote him,—because he had cut off the corner of the robe which belonged to Saul.

content: 6 And he said unto his men— Far be it from me､ of Yahweh､ that I should do this thing unto my lord､ unto the Anointed of Yahweh, to thrust forth my hand against him,—for the Anointed of Yahweh is he!
content_old: 6 And he said unto his men— Far be it from me､ of Yahweh､ that I should do this thing unto my lord､ unto the Anointed of Yahweh, to thrust forth my hand against him,—for the Anointed of Yahweh is he!

content: 7 So David did chide his men with the words, and did not suffer them to rise up against Saul. And Saul rose up out of the cave､ and went on his way.
content_old: 7 So David did chide his men with the words, and did not suffer them to rise up against Saul. And Saul rose up out of the cave､ and went on his way.

content: 8 Then David rose up afterwards､ and went forth out of the cave, and cried out after Saul､ saying— My lord､ O king! And when Saul looked about behind him David inclined his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down.
content_old: 8 Then David rose up afterwards､ and went forth out of the cave, and cried out after Saul､ saying— My lord､ O king! And when Saul looked about behind him David inclined his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down.

content: 9 Then said David to Saul, Wherefore shouldst thou hearken unto the words of the sons of earth､ saying,— Lo! David is seeking thy hurt?
content_old: 9 Then said David to Saul, Wherefore shouldst thou hearken unto the words of the sons of earth､ saying,— Lo! David is seeking thy hurt?

content: 10 Lo! this day have thine own eyes seen､ how Yahweh had delivered thee up､ to-day､ into my hand in the cave, and when one bade me slay thee I looked with compassion upon thee,—and I said— I will not thrust forth my hand against my lord, for the Anointed of Yahweh is he!
content_old: 10 Lo! this day have thine own eyes seen､ how Yahweh had delivered thee up､ to-day､ into my hand in the cave, and when one bade me slay thee I looked with compassion upon thee,—and I said— I will not thrust forth my hand against my lord, for the Anointed of Yahweh is he!

content: 11 But､ my father､ see, yea､ see the corner of thy robe in my hand,—for in that I cut off the corner of thy robe､ and yet did not slay thee know thou､ and see､ that there is not in my hand either wrong or transgression､ neither have I sinned against thee, yet art thou hunting my life､ to take it.
content_old: 11 But､ my father､ see, yea､ see the corner of thy robe in my hand,—for in that I cut off the corner of thy robe､ and yet did not slay thee know thou､ and see､ that there is not in my hand either wrong or transgression､ neither have I sinned against thee, yet art thou hunting my life､ to take it.

content: 12 Let Yahweh do justice betwixt me and thee, and let Yahweh avenge me of thee,—but mine own hand shall not be upon thee.
content_old: 12 Let Yahweh do justice betwixt me and thee, and let Yahweh avenge me of thee,—but mine own hand shall not be upon thee.

content: 13 As saith the proverb of the ancients, From the lawless proceedeth lawlessness,— mine own hand therefore shall not be upon thee.
content_old: 13 As saith the proverb of the ancients, From the lawless proceedeth lawlessness,— mine own hand therefore shall not be upon thee.

content: 14 After whom hath the king of Israel come forth? After whom art thou in pursuit? After a dead dog! after a single flea!
content_old: 14 After whom hath the king of Israel come forth? After whom art thou in pursuit? After a dead dog! after a single flea!

content: 15 Therefore shall Yahweh become judge, and do justice betwixt me and thee,—that he may see､ and plead my cause, and justly deliver me out of thy hand.
content_old: 15 Therefore shall Yahweh become judge, and do justice betwixt me and thee,—that he may see､ and plead my cause, and justly deliver me out of thy hand.

content: 16 And it came to pass when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul that Saul said, Thy voice is this､ my son David? And Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul that Saul said, Thy voice is this､ my son David? And Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.

content: 17 And he said unto David, More righteous art thou than I, for thou hast requited me good, but I have requited thee evil.
content_old: 17 And he said unto David, More righteous art thou than I, for thou hast requited me good, but I have requited thee evil.

content: 18 Thou then､ hast told to-day, how thou hast dealt with me for good,—how when Yahweh had surrendered me into thy hand thou didst not slay me.
content_old: 18 Thou then､ hast told to-day, how thou hast dealt with me for good,—how when Yahweh had surrendered me into thy hand thou didst not slay me.

content: 19 Yet when a man findeth his enemy will he let him get easily away? Yahweh then､ give thee good reward for what this day thou hast done unto me.
content_old: 19 Yet when a man findeth his enemy will he let him get easily away? Yahweh then､ give thee good reward for what this day thou hast done unto me.

content: 20 Now therefore､ lo! I know that thou shalt indeed become king,—and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in thy hand.
content_old: 20 Now therefore､ lo! I know that thou shalt indeed become king,—and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in thy hand.

content: 21 Now therefore､ swear unto me by Yahweh､ that thou wilt not cut off my seed､ after me,—and wilt not destroy my name out of the house of my father.
content_old: 21 Now therefore､ swear unto me by Yahweh､ that thou wilt not cut off my seed､ after me,—and wilt not destroy my name out of the house of my father.

content: 1 And Samuel died, and all Israel were gathered together, and made lamentation for him, and buried him within his own house､ in Ramah,—and David arose and went down into the wilderness of Maon.
content_old: 1 And Samuel died, and all Israel were gathered together, and made lamentation for him, and buried him within his own house､ in Ramah,—and David arose and went down into the wilderness of Maon.

content: 2 Now there was a man in Maon､ whose cattle were in Carmel､ and the man was exceeding great, and he had three thousand sheep､ and a thousand goats,—and so it was､ that he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
content_old: 2 Now there was a man in Maon､ whose cattle were in Carmel､ and the man was exceeding great, and he had three thousand sheep､ and a thousand goats,—and so it was､ that he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

content: 3 Now the name of the man was Nabal, and the name of his wife Abigail,—and the woman was of good understanding､ and of beautiful figure,—but the man was unfeeling and of evil practices､ and he was a Calebite.
content_old: 3 Now the name of the man was Nabal, and the name of his wife Abigail,—and the woman was of good understanding､ and of beautiful figure,—but the man was unfeeling and of evil practices､ and he was a Calebite.

content: 4 So then David heard in the wilderness,—that Nabal was shearing his sheep.
content_old: 4 So then David heard in the wilderness,—that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

content: 5 David､ therefore､ sent ten young men,—and David said unto the young men,— Go up to Carmel､ and enter in unto Nabal､ and ye shall ask him､ in my name､ of his welfare;
content_old: 5 David､ therefore､ sent ten young men,—and David said unto the young men,— Go up to Carmel､ and enter in unto Nabal､ and ye shall ask him､ in my name､ of his welfare;

content: 6 and say thus— Long life to thee! Mayest thou prosper､ And thy household prosper, And all that thou hast prosper!
content_old: 6 and say thus— Long life to thee! Mayest thou prosper､ And thy household prosper, And all that thou hast prosper!

content: 7 Now therefore､ have I heard that thou hast shearers,— Well, the shepherds that thou hast have been with us, We reproached them not, Neither missed they anything, All the days they were in Carmel.
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ have I heard that thou hast shearers,— Well, the shepherds that thou hast have been with us, We reproached them not, Neither missed they anything, All the days they were in Carmel.

content: 8 Ask thy young men､ that they may tell thee､ That so my young men may find favour in thine eyes, For on a good day have we come! Give､ I pray thee､ what thy hand findeth､ to thy servants, and to thy son､ to David!
content_old: 8 Ask thy young men､ that they may tell thee､ That so my young men may find favour in thine eyes, For on a good day have we come! Give､ I pray thee､ what thy hand findeth､ to thy servants, and to thy son､ to David!

content: 9 So David’s young men came, and spake unto Nabal､ according to all these words､ in the name of David,—and waited.
content_old: 9 So David’s young men came, and spake unto Nabal､ according to all these words､ in the name of David,—and waited.

content: 10 Then Nabal answered the servants of David､ and said, Who is David? And who is the son of Jesse? Nowadays many are the servants that have broken away, every one from the presence of his lord:
content_old: 10 Then Nabal answered the servants of David､ and said, Who is David? And who is the son of Jesse? Nowadays many are the servants that have broken away, every one from the presence of his lord:

content: 11 Shall I､ then､ take my bread､ and my wine, and my slain beasts, that I have slaughtered for my shearers,—and give unto men of whom I know not whence they are?
content_old: 11 Shall I､ then､ take my bread､ and my wine, and my slain beasts, that I have slaughtered for my shearers,—and give unto men of whom I know not whence they are?

content: 12 So the young men of David turned away for their journey,—and came back､ and drew near､ and told him, according to all these words.
content_old: 12 So the young men of David turned away for their journey,—and came back､ and drew near､ and told him, according to all these words.

content: 13 Then said David unto his men— Gird on you every man his sword. And they girded on them､ every man his sword, and David also girded on his sword,—and there went up after David—about four hundred men, and two hundred abode by the stores.
content_old: 13 Then said David unto his men— Gird on you every man his sword. And they girded on them､ every man his sword, and David also girded on his sword,—and there went up after David—about four hundred men, and two hundred abode by the stores.

content: 14 But a certain one of her young men told Abigail､ Nabal’s wife､ saying,— Lo! David sent messengers out of the wilderness to bless our lord､ and he treated them with contempt.
content_old: 14 But a certain one of her young men told Abigail､ Nabal’s wife､ saying,— Lo! David sent messengers out of the wilderness to bless our lord､ and he treated them with contempt.

content: 15 But the men were exceeding good to us,—and we were not harmed､ neither missed we anything, all the days we went to and fro with them, while we were in the fields:
content_old: 15 But the men were exceeding good to us,—and we were not harmed､ neither missed we anything, all the days we went to and fro with them, while we were in the fields:

content: 16 A wall became they unto us, both by night and by day, all the days we were with them､ tending the flock.
content_old: 16 A wall became they unto us, both by night and by day, all the days we were with them､ tending the flock.

content: 17 Now､ therefore､ know thou､ and see､ what thou canst do, for mischief is determined against our lord､ and against all his household,—but he is such an abandoned man､ that one cannot speak unto him.
content_old: 17 Now､ therefore､ know thou､ and see､ what thou canst do, for mischief is determined against our lord､ and against all his household,—but he is such an abandoned man､ that one cannot speak unto him.

content: 18 Then Abigail hastened—and took two hundred loaves､ and two skins of wine､ and five sheep made ready､ and five measures of parched corn, and a hundred cakes of raisins､ and two hundred cakes of figs,—and put them on the asses.
content_old: 18 Then Abigail hastened—and took two hundred loaves､ and two skins of wine､ and five sheep made ready､ and five measures of parched corn, and a hundred cakes of raisins､ and two hundred cakes of figs,—and put them on the asses.

content: 19 And she said to her young men､— Pass on before me, behold me coming after you; but to her husband､ Nabal told she nothing.
content_old: 19 And she said to her young men､— Pass on before me, behold me coming after you; but to her husband､ Nabal told she nothing.

content: 20 And so it was as she was riding on her ass､ and descending within the covert of the hill lo! David and his men descending over against her,—so she met them.
content_old: 20 And so it was as she was riding on her ass､ and descending within the covert of the hill lo! David and his men descending over against her,—so she met them.

content: 21 Now David had said— Surely in vain did I guard all that pertained to this man in the wilderness, so that there was nothing missed of all that he had,—seeing he hath returned to me evil for good.
content_old: 21 Now David had said— Surely in vain did I guard all that pertained to this man in the wilderness, so that there was nothing missed of all that he had,—seeing he hath returned to me evil for good.

content: 22 So may God do to David and so may he add if I leave remaining､ of all that he hath､ until the morning,—so much as a little boy.
content_old: 22 So may God do to David and so may he add if I leave remaining､ of all that he hath､ until the morning,—so much as a little boy.

content: 23 And when Abigail saw David she hastened､ and alighted from off her ass,—and fell down before David upon her face, and prostrated herself on the ground;
content_old: 23 And when Abigail saw David she hastened､ and alighted from off her ass,—and fell down before David upon her face, and prostrated herself on the ground;

content: 24 yea she fell at his feet, and said— On me､ even me my lord､ be the transgression,— But､ I pray thee､ let thy handmaid speak in thine ears, And hear thou the words of thy handmaid.
content_old: 24 yea she fell at his feet, and said— On me､ even me my lord､ be the transgression,— But､ I pray thee､ let thy handmaid speak in thine ears, And hear thou the words of thy handmaid.

content: 25 Let it not be､ I pray thee､ that my lord regard this abandoned man—Nabal; For as his name is so is he, Nabal is his name, and baseness is with him,— But I､ thy handmaid saw not the young men of my lord､ whom thou didst send.
content_old: 25 Let it not be､ I pray thee､ that my lord regard this abandoned man—Nabal; For as his name is so is he, Nabal is his name, and baseness is with him,— But I､ thy handmaid saw not the young men of my lord､ whom thou didst send.

content: 26 Now､ therefore､ my lord— By the life of Yahweh､ and By the life of thine own soul,— Seeing Yahweh hath withholden thee from coming in with bloodshed, and from saving thyself with thine own hand､ Now､ therefore､ like Nabal be thine enemies､ and they who are making search for my lord wrongfully.
content_old: 26 Now､ therefore､ my lord— By the life of Yahweh､ and By the life of thine own soul,— Seeing Yahweh hath withholden thee from coming in with bloodshed, and from saving thyself with thine own hand､ Now､ therefore､ like Nabal be thine enemies､ and they who are making search for my lord wrongfully.

content: 27 Now､ therefore､ this blessing which thy maid-servant hath brought to my lord let it oven be given unto the young men who are going to and fro at the feet of my lord.
content_old: 27 Now､ therefore､ this blessing which thy maid-servant hath brought to my lord let it oven be given unto the young men who are going to and fro at the feet of my lord.

content: 28 Forgive､ I pray thee､ the trespass of thy handmaid,—for Yahweh will certainly make for my lord an assured house､ for the battles of Yahweh is my lord fighting, and wrong shall not be found in thee､ all thy days;
content_old: 28 Forgive､ I pray thee､ the trespass of thy handmaid,—for Yahweh will certainly make for my lord an assured house､ for the battles of Yahweh is my lord fighting, and wrong shall not be found in thee､ all thy days;

content: 29 yea though there hath arisen a son of earth to pursue thee, and to seek thy life yet shall the life of my lord be bound up in the bundle of the living､ with Yahweh thy God, but as for the life of thine enemies he shall sling it out with the middle of the hollow of the sling.
content_old: 29 yea though there hath arisen a son of earth to pursue thee, and to seek thy life yet shall the life of my lord be bound up in the bundle of the living､ with Yahweh thy God, but as for the life of thine enemies he shall sling it out with the middle of the hollow of the sling.

content: 30 And it shall be when Yahweh shall do for my lord, according to all the good that he hath spoken concerning thee,—and shall put thee in charge as leader over Israel
content_old: 30 And it shall be when Yahweh shall do for my lord, according to all the good that he hath spoken concerning thee,—and shall put thee in charge as leader over Israel

content: 31 then shall this not become to thee a staggering and stumbling of heart､ unto my lord—that thou didst either shed blood without need, or that the hand of my lord saved himself. And when Yahweh hath dealt well with my lord then remember thou thy handmaid.
content_old: 31 then shall this not become to thee a staggering and stumbling of heart､ unto my lord—that thou didst either shed blood without need, or that the hand of my lord saved himself. And when Yahweh hath dealt well with my lord then remember thou thy handmaid.

content: 32 Then said David unto Abigail,— Blessed be Yahweh､ the God of Israel, who hath sent thee this day､ to meet me;
content_old: 32 Then said David unto Abigail,— Blessed be Yahweh､ the God of Israel, who hath sent thee this day､ to meet me;

content: 33 and blessed be thy discreet judgment､ and blessed be thou thyself,—who hast kept me､ this day､ from coming in with bloodshed, and from saving myself with mine own hand.
content_old: 33 and blessed be thy discreet judgment､ and blessed be thou thyself,—who hast kept me､ this day､ from coming in with bloodshed, and from saving myself with mine own hand.

content: 34 Nevertheless by the life of Yahweh､ God of Israel, who hath restrained me from harming thee surely except thou hadst hastened and come to meet me there had not been left unto Nabal､ by the light of the morning､ so much as a little boy.
content_old: 34 Nevertheless by the life of Yahweh､ God of Israel, who hath restrained me from harming thee surely except thou hadst hastened and come to meet me there had not been left unto Nabal､ by the light of the morning､ so much as a little boy.

content: 35 So David received at her hand, that which she had brought him,—and unto herself he said— Go up､ in peace､ unto thy house, see! I have hearkened unto thy voice, and accepted thy person.
content_old: 35 So David received at her hand, that which she had brought him,—and unto herself he said— Go up､ in peace､ unto thy house, see! I have hearkened unto thy voice, and accepted thy person.

content: 36 And when Abigail came unto Nabal lo! he had a banquet in his house､ like the banquet of a king､ and the heart of Nabal was glad accordingly, he having drunk deeply,—so she told him nothing—less or more､ until the light of the morning.
content_old: 36 And when Abigail came unto Nabal lo! he had a banquet in his house､ like the banquet of a king､ and the heart of Nabal was glad accordingly, he having drunk deeply,—so she told him nothing—less or more､ until the light of the morning.

content: 37 And it came to pass､ in the morning when the wine had gone out of Nabal, and his wife told him these things that his heart died within him, and he became like a stone.
content_old: 37 And it came to pass､ in the morning when the wine had gone out of Nabal, and his wife told him these things that his heart died within him, and he became like a stone.

content: 38 And it came to pass in about ten days that Yahweh smote Nabal､ that he died.
content_old: 38 And it came to pass in about ten days that Yahweh smote Nabal､ that he died.

content: 39 And when David heard that Nabal was dead he said— Blessed be Yahweh､ who hath maintained the plea of my reproach､ at the hand of Nabal､ and hath restrained his servant from wrong, yea the wrong of Nabal hath Yahweh turned back on his own head. Then sent David､ and spake with Abigail, to take her to himself to wife.
content_old: 39 And when David heard that Nabal was dead he said— Blessed be Yahweh､ who hath maintained the plea of my reproach､ at the hand of Nabal､ and hath restrained his servant from wrong, yea the wrong of Nabal hath Yahweh turned back on his own head. Then sent David､ and spake with Abigail, to take her to himself to wife.

content: 40 And the servants of David came unto Abigail the Carmelitess,—and spake unto her､ saying, David hath sent us unto thee, to take thee to himself to wife.
content_old: 40 And the servants of David came unto Abigail the Carmelitess,—and spake unto her､ saying, David hath sent us unto thee, to take thee to himself to wife.

content: 41 And she arose､ and bowed herself down with her face to the earth,—and said— Lo! thy handmaid､ as serving-woman to bathe the feet of the servants of my lord.
content_old: 41 And she arose､ and bowed herself down with her face to the earth,—and said— Lo! thy handmaid､ as serving-woman to bathe the feet of the servants of my lord.

content: 42 And Abigail hastened､ and mounted､ and rode upon her ass, with her five damsels that used to journey at her feet,—and she went her way after the messengers of David, and became his wife.
content_old: 42 And Abigail hastened､ and mounted､ and rode upon her ass, with her five damsels that used to journey at her feet,—and she went her way after the messengers of David, and became his wife.

content: 43 David took Ahinoam also out of Jezreel,—and they two became his wives.
