content_old: 43 David took Ahinoam also out of Jezreel,—and they two became his wives.

content: 1 And the Ziphites came unto Saul in Gibeah､ saying,— Is not David hiding himself in the hill of Hachilah, overlooking Jeshimon?
content_old: 1 And the Ziphites came unto Saul in Gibeah､ saying,— Is not David hiding himself in the hill of Hachilah, overlooking Jeshimon?

content: 2 Then Saul arose､ and went down into the wilderness of Ziph, and with him three thousand chosen men of Israel,—to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
content_old: 2 Then Saul arose､ and went down into the wilderness of Ziph, and with him three thousand chosen men of Israel,—to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.

content: 3 And Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah､ which overlooketh Jeshimon､ by the way,—but David was staying in the wilderness, so he saw that Saul was coming after him into the wilderness.
content_old: 3 And Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah､ which overlooketh Jeshimon､ by the way,—but David was staying in the wilderness, so he saw that Saul was coming after him into the wilderness.

content: 4 David therefore sent runners,—and took knowledge that Saul had come､ for a certainty.
content_old: 4 David therefore sent runners,—and took knowledge that Saul had come､ for a certainty.

content: 5 So then David arose､ and came to the place where Saul had encamped, and David saw the place where Saul was lying, with Abner､ son of Ner､ prince of his host,—and Saul was lying within the circular trench, with the people encamped round about him.
content_old: 5 So then David arose､ and came to the place where Saul had encamped, and David saw the place where Saul was lying, with Abner､ son of Ner､ prince of his host,—and Saul was lying within the circular trench, with the people encamped round about him.

content: 6 And David responded､ and said unto Ahimelech the Hittite､ and unto Abishai son of Zeruiah､ brother of Joab､ saying, Who will go down with me unto Saul､ within the camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee.
content_old: 6 And David responded､ and said unto Ahimelech the Hittite､ and unto Abishai son of Zeruiah､ brother of Joab､ saying, Who will go down with me unto Saul､ within the camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee.

content: 7 So David came､ with Abishai､ unto the people by night, and lo! Saul lying asleep､ within the trench, and his spear stuck in the ground､ at his head,—and Abner and the people lying round about him.
content_old: 7 So David came､ with Abishai､ unto the people by night, and lo! Saul lying asleep､ within the trench, and his spear stuck in the ground､ at his head,—and Abner and the people lying round about him.

content: 8 Then said Abishai unto David, God hath surrendered､ to-day､ thine enemy､ into thy hand: Now therefore､ let me smite him､ I pray thee､ with the spear to the earth､ at one stroke, I will not do it twice.
content_old: 8 Then said Abishai unto David, God hath surrendered､ to-day､ thine enemy､ into thy hand: Now therefore､ let me smite him､ I pray thee､ with the spear to the earth､ at one stroke, I will not do it twice.

content: 9 But David said unto Abishai､ Do not destroy him,—for who that hath thrust forth his hand against the Anointed of Yahweh､ shall be guiltless?
content_old: 9 But David said unto Abishai､ Do not destroy him,—for who that hath thrust forth his hand against the Anointed of Yahweh､ shall be guiltless?

content: 10 And David said— By the life of Yahweh surely Yahweh himself must smite him,—or his day must come that he die, or into battle must he go down､ and be swept away.
content_old: 10 And David said— By the life of Yahweh surely Yahweh himself must smite him,—or his day must come that he die, or into battle must he go down､ and be swept away.

content: 11 Far be it from me､ of Yahweh､ that I should thrust forth my hand against the Anointed of Yahweh! Now therefore､ take�� I pray thee､ the spear that is at his head､ and the cruse of water､ and let us go our way.
content_old: 11 Far be it from me､ of Yahweh､ that I should thrust forth my hand against the Anointed of Yahweh! Now therefore､ take�� I pray thee､ the spear that is at his head､ and the cruse of water､ and let us go our way.

content: 12 So David took the spear､ and the cruse of water､ from near the head of Saul, and they went their way,—and no man saw､ and no man knew､ and no man awoke, for all of them were sleeping, for a deep sleep from Yahweh had fallen upon them.
content_old: 12 So David took the spear､ and the cruse of water､ from near the head of Saul, and they went their way,—and no man saw､ and no man knew､ and no man awoke, for all of them were sleeping, for a deep sleep from Yahweh had fallen upon them.

content: 13 Then David crossed over to the other side, and took his stand on the top of the mountain､ afar off,—a great space being between them.
content_old: 13 Then David crossed over to the other side, and took his stand on the top of the mountain､ afar off,—a great space being between them.

content: 14 And David cried aloud unto the people､ and unto Abner son of Ner､ saying, Wilt thou not answer､ Abner? Then answered Abner､ and said, Who art thou, that hast cried aloud unto the king?
content_old: 14 And David cried aloud unto the people､ and unto Abner son of Ner､ saying, Wilt thou not answer､ Abner? Then answered Abner､ and said, Who art thou, that hast cried aloud unto the king?

content: 15 And David said unto Abner— Art not thou a man? Who indeed is like thee､ in Israel? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou not kept watch over thy lord､ the king? For one of the people hath entered､ to destroy the king—thy lord.
content_old: 15 And David said unto Abner— Art not thou a man? Who indeed is like thee､ in Israel? Wherefore､ then､ hast thou not kept watch over thy lord､ the king? For one of the people hath entered､ to destroy the king—thy lord.

content: 16 Not good is this thing which thou hast done, by the life of Yahweh verily worthy of death ye are, in that ye have not kept watch over your lord､ over the Anointed of Yahweh. Now therefore､ see where the spear of the king is､ and the cruse of water､ that was at his head?
content_old: 16 Not good is this thing which thou hast done, by the life of Yahweh verily worthy of death ye are, in that ye have not kept watch over your lord､ over the Anointed of Yahweh. Now therefore､ see where the spear of the king is､ and the cruse of water､ that was at his head?

content: 17 And Saul knew the voice of David, and said— Thy voice is this､ my son David? And David said, My voice､ my lord O king!
content_old: 17 And Saul knew the voice of David, and said— Thy voice is this､ my son David? And David said, My voice､ my lord O king!

content: 18 And he said, Wherefore is it､ that my lord is in pursuit of his servant? For what have I done? or what is in my hand that is wrong?
content_old: 18 And he said, Wherefore is it､ that my lord is in pursuit of his servant? For what have I done? or what is in my hand that is wrong?

content: 19 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ let my lord the king hear the words of his servant,— If Yahweh have goaded thee on against me let him accept the sweet smell of a gift, but if the sons of men accursed they are before Yahweh, for they have driven me out､ to-day､ from joining myself with the inheritance of Yahweh､ saying— Go, serve other gods!
content_old: 19 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ let my lord the king hear the words of his servant,— If Yahweh have goaded thee on against me let him accept the sweet smell of a gift, but if the sons of men accursed they are before Yahweh, for they have driven me out､ to-day､ from joining myself with the inheritance of Yahweh､ saying— Go, serve other gods!

content: 20 Now therefore､ let not my blood fall to the earth, away from the presence of Yahweh,—for the king of Israel hath come out to hunt for a single flea, as when one pursueth a partridge among the mountains.
content_old: 20 Now therefore､ let not my blood fall to the earth, away from the presence of Yahweh,—for the king of Israel hath come out to hunt for a single flea, as when one pursueth a partridge among the mountains.

content: 21 Then said Saul— I have sinned､ Return､ my son David, for I will harm thee no more, because my life was precious in thine eyes､ this day,—lo! I have acted foolishly and greatly erred.
content_old: 21 Then said Saul— I have sinned､ Return､ my son David, for I will harm thee no more, because my life was precious in thine eyes､ this day,—lo! I have acted foolishly and greatly erred.

content: 22 And David responded､ and said, Lo! the spear of the king! Let､ therefore､ one of the young men come over､ and fetch it.
content_old: 22 And David responded､ and said, Lo! the spear of the king! Let､ therefore､ one of the young men come over､ and fetch it.

content: 23 And let Yahweh give back to each man, his righteousness､ and his faithfulness,—in that Yahweh delivered thee､ to-day､ into my hand, but I would not thrust forth my hand against the Anointed of Yahweh.
content_old: 23 And let Yahweh give back to each man, his righteousness､ and his faithfulness,—in that Yahweh delivered thee､ to-day､ into my hand, but I would not thrust forth my hand against the Anointed of Yahweh.

content: 24 Lo! then as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes so let my life be much set by in the eyes of Yahweh, and let him rescue me out of all tribulation.
content_old: 24 Lo! then as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes so let my life be much set by in the eyes of Yahweh, and let him rescue me out of all tribulation.

content: 1 And David said､ unto his own heart, Now shall I be swept off､ in a single day､ by the hand of Saul,—there is nothing for me better than that I escape into the land of the Philistines､ so shall Saul give up seeking for me any more､ in any of the bounds of Israel, so shall I escape out of his hand.
content_old: 1 And David said､ unto his own heart, Now shall I be swept off､ in a single day､ by the hand of Saul,—there is nothing for me better than that I escape into the land of the Philistines､ so shall Saul give up seeking for me any more､ in any of the bounds of Israel, so shall I escape out of his hand.

content: 2 And David arose, and he and the six hundred men that were with him passed over､ unto Achish son of Maoch､ king of Gath.
content_old: 2 And David arose, and he and the six hundred men that were with him passed over､ unto Achish son of Maoch､ king of Gath.

content: 3 And David abode with Achish in Gath､ he and his men､ each man with his household,—David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail wife of Nabal､ the Carmelite.
content_old: 3 And David abode with Achish in Gath､ he and his men､ each man with his household,—David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail wife of Nabal､ the Carmelite.

content: 4 And when it was told Saul､ that David had fled to Gath he added no more､ to seek him.
content_old: 4 And when it was told Saul､ that David had fled to Gath he added no more､ to seek him.

content: 5 Then said David unto Achish— If､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes let them give me a place in one of the cities in the country､ that I may dwell there,—for why should thy servant dwell in the royal city with thee?
content_old: 5 Then said David unto Achish— If､ I pray thee､ I have found favour in thine eyes let them give me a place in one of the cities in the country､ that I may dwell there,—for why should thy servant dwell in the royal city with thee?

content: 6 So Achish gave him､ on that day､ Ziklag,—wherefore Ziklag hath pertained unto the kings of Judah, unto this day.
content_old: 6 So Achish gave him､ on that day､ Ziklag,—wherefore Ziklag hath pertained unto the kings of Judah, unto this day.

content: 7 And the number of the days that David dwelt in the country of the Philistines became a year and four months.
content_old: 7 And the number of the days that David dwelt in the country of the Philistines became a year and four months.

content: 8 And David and his men went up, and made a raid against the Geshurites and the Gizrites and the Amalekites,—for they were the inhabitants of the land who had been from age-past times, as thou enterest Shur､ even as far as the land of Egypt.
content_old: 8 And David and his men went up, and made a raid against the Geshurites and the Gizrites and the Amalekites,—for they were the inhabitants of the land who had been from age-past times, as thou enterest Shur､ even as far as the land of Egypt.

content: 9 Now when David would smite a land he used to save alive neither man nor woman,—but took sheep and oxen､ and asses and camels､ and apparel, and returned､ and came in unto Achish.
content_old: 9 Now when David would smite a land he used to save alive neither man nor woman,—but took sheep and oxen､ and asses and camels､ and apparel, and returned､ and came in unto Achish.

content: 10 Then said Achish, Whither have ye made a raid､ to-day? And David said— Against the South of Judah､ or against the South of the Jerahmeelites, or as far as the South of the Kenites.
content_old: 10 Then said Achish, Whither have ye made a raid､ to-day? And David said— Against the South of Judah､ or against the South of the Jerahmeelites, or as far as the South of the Kenites.

content: 11 But neither man nor woman used David to save alive､ to bring into Gath､ for he said, Lest they tell of us､ saying,— So hath David done､ and such his manner, all the days that he hath dwelt in the country of the Philistines.
content_old: 11 But neither man nor woman used David to save alive､ to bring into Gath､ for he said, Lest they tell of us､ saying,— So hath David done､ and such his manner, all the days that he hath dwelt in the country of the Philistines.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ in those days､ when the Philistines gathered together their hosts for war, to fight with Israel that Achish said unto David, Thou must know that with me shalt thou go forth in the host, thou and thy men.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ in those days､ when the Philistines gathered together their hosts for war, to fight with Israel that Achish said unto David, Thou must know that with me shalt thou go forth in the host, thou and thy men.

content: 2 And David said unto Achish, Therefore now shalt thou know what thy servant can do. And Achish said unto David, Therefore keeper of my head will I appoint thee､ all the days.
content_old: 2 And David said unto Achish, Therefore now shalt thou know what thy servant can do. And Achish said unto David, Therefore keeper of my head will I appoint thee､ all the days.

content: 3 Now Samuel was dead､ and all Israel had lamented him, and buried him in Ramah､ even in his own city,—Saul moreover had put away them who had familiar spirits and them who were oracles､ out of the land.
content_old: 3 Now Samuel was dead､ and all Israel had lamented him, and buried him in Ramah､ even in his own city,—Saul moreover had put away them who had familiar spirits and them who were oracles､ out of the land.

content: 4 So then the Philistines gathered themselves together, and came in､ and encamped in Shunem,—and Saul gathered together all Israel, and they encamped in Gilboa.
content_old: 4 So then the Philistines gathered themselves together, and came in､ and encamped in Shunem,—and Saul gathered together all Israel, and they encamped in Gilboa.

content: 5 And when Saul saw the host of the Philistines he was afraid､ and his heart trembled exceedingly.
content_old: 5 And when Saul saw the host of the Philistines he was afraid､ and his heart trembled exceedingly.

content: 6 Then Saul enquired of Yahweh, but Yahweh answered him not,—neither by Dreams､ nor by the Lights､ nor by prophets.
content_old: 6 Then Saul enquired of Yahweh, but Yahweh answered him not,—neither by Dreams､ nor by the Lights､ nor by prophets.

content: 7 Then said Saul unto his servants— Seek me out a woman that owneth a familiar spirit, that I may even go unto her､ and enquire of her. And his servants said unto him, Lo! there is a woman that owneth a familiar spirit in En-dor.
content_old: 7 Then said Saul unto his servants— Seek me out a woman that owneth a familiar spirit, that I may even go unto her､ and enquire of her. And his servants said unto him, Lo! there is a woman that owneth a familiar spirit in En-dor.

content: 8 Saul therefore disguised himself､ and put on other raiment, and departed—he and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night,—and he said— Divine for me､ I pray thee､ by the familiar spirit, and bring up for me—whomsoever I shall name unto thee.
content_old: 8 Saul therefore disguised himself､ and put on other raiment, and departed—he and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night,—and he said— Divine for me､ I pray thee､ by the familiar spirit, and bring up for me—whomsoever I shall name unto thee.

content: 9 And the woman said unto him— Lo! thou knowest what Saul hath done, how he hath cut off them who have familiar spirits and him who is an oracle､ out of the land,—wherefore､ then､ art thou striking at my life､ to put me to death?
content_old: 9 And the woman said unto him— Lo! thou knowest what Saul hath done, how he hath cut off them who have familiar spirits and him who is an oracle､ out of the land,—wherefore､ then､ art thou striking at my life､ to put me to death?

content: 10 So then Saul sware unto her by Yahweh､ saying,— By the life of Yahweh there shall no punishment befall thee for this thing.
content_old: 10 So then Saul sware unto her by Yahweh､ saying,— By the life of Yahweh there shall no punishment befall thee for this thing.

content: 11 Then said the woman, Whom shall I bring up for thee? And he said, Samuel bring thou up for me.
content_old: 11 Then said the woman, Whom shall I bring up for thee? And he said, Samuel bring thou up for me.

content: 12 And when the woman saw Samuel she made outcry with a loud voice,—and the woman spake unto Saul､ saying— Wherefore hast thou deceived me､ thou thyself being Saul?
content_old: 12 And when the woman saw Samuel she made outcry with a loud voice,—and the woman spake unto Saul､ saying— Wherefore hast thou deceived me､ thou thyself being Saul?

content: 13 And the king said unto her— Be not afraid､ but what sawest thou? And the woman said unto Saul, A god saw I､ coming up out of the earth.
content_old: 13 And the king said unto her— Be not afraid､ but what sawest thou? And the woman said unto Saul, A god saw I､ coming up out of the earth.

content: 14 And he said to her— What was his form? And she said— An old man､ coming up, he being wrapped about with a robe. Then Saul knew､ that it was Samuel, so he inclined his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down.
content_old: 14 And he said to her— What was his form? And she said— An old man､ coming up, he being wrapped about with a robe. Then Saul knew､ that it was Samuel, so he inclined his face to the earth､ and bowed himself down.

content: 15 And Samuel said unto Saul, Wherefore hast thou disquieted me､ by bringing me up? And Saul said— I am in sore distress､ for the Philistines are making war against me､ and God hath turned away from me､ and answereth me no more—either by means of the prophets､ or by dreams, therefore have I even called for thee, to let me know､ what I am to do.
content_old: 15 And Samuel said unto Saul, Wherefore hast thou disquieted me､ by bringing me up? And Saul said— I am in sore distress､ for the Philistines are making war against me､ and God hath turned away from me､ and answereth me no more—either by means of the prophets､ or by dreams, therefore have I even called for thee, to let me know､ what I am to do.

content: 16 Then said Samuel, Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou ask me,—when Yahweh hath turned away from thee､ and hath come to be with thy neighbour?
content_old: 16 Then said Samuel, Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou ask me,—when Yahweh hath turned away from thee､ and hath come to be with thy neighbour?

content: 17 Therefore hath Yahweh done for him, as he spake by me,—yea Yahweh hath rent the kingdom out of thy hand, and given it to a neighbour of thine—to David.
content_old: 17 Therefore hath Yahweh done for him, as he spake by me,—yea Yahweh hath rent the kingdom out of thy hand, and given it to a neighbour of thine—to David.

content: 18 As thou didst not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh, neither didst execute the glow of his anger upon Amalek therefore this thing hath Yahweh done unto thee this day;
content_old: 18 As thou didst not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh, neither didst execute the glow of his anger upon Amalek therefore this thing hath Yahweh done unto thee this day;

content: 19 that Yahweh may deliver lsrael also､ with thee into the hand of the Philistines, and to-morrow thou and thy sons with thee are about to fall,—the host of Israel also will Yahweh deliver､ into the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 19 that Yahweh may deliver lsrael also､ with thee into the hand of the Philistines, and to-morrow thou and thy sons with thee are about to fall,—the host of Israel also will Yahweh deliver､ into the hand of the Philistines.

content: 20 Then Saul hastened､ and fell prostrate—the whole length of him—to the earth, and was sore afraid､ at the words of Samuel,—and indeed､ no strength was left in him, for he had not eaten food all the day and all the night.
content_old: 20 Then Saul hastened､ and fell prostrate—the whole length of him—to the earth, and was sore afraid､ at the words of Samuel,—and indeed､ no strength was left in him, for he had not eaten food all the day and all the night.

content: 21 And the woman came unto Saul, and when she saw that he was greatly terrified she said unto him— Lo! thy handmaid hearkened unto thy voice, and I put my life into my hand, and heard thy words which thou didst speak unto me.
content_old: 21 And the woman came unto Saul, and when she saw that he was greatly terrified she said unto him— Lo! thy handmaid hearkened unto thy voice, and I put my life into my hand, and heard thy words which thou didst speak unto me.

content: 22 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ hearken thou also unto the voice of thy handmaid, and let me set before thee a morsel of food､ and eat thou,—that there may be in thee strength, when thou goest on thy journey.
content_old: 22 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ hearken thou also unto the voice of thy handmaid, and let me set before thee a morsel of food､ and eat thou,—that there may be in thee strength, when thou goest on thy journey.

content: 23 But he refused､ and said— I will not eat. But when his servants､ and the woman also､ strongly urged him then hearkened he unto their voice,—and rose up from the earth, and sat on the bed.
content_old: 23 But he refused､ and said— I will not eat. But when his servants､ and the woman also､ strongly urged him then hearkened he unto their voice,—and rose up from the earth, and sat on the bed.

content: 24 Now the woman had a calf fattening､ in the shed. So she hastened､ and sacrificed it,—and took meal､ and kneaded, and baked thereof､ unleavened cakes;
content_old: 24 Now the woman had a calf fattening､ in the shed. So she hastened､ and sacrificed it,—and took meal､ and kneaded, and baked thereof､ unleavened cakes;

content: 1 Now the Philistines gathered together all their hosts､ towards Aphek,—and the Israelites were encamping by the fountain､ that is in Jezreel.
content_old: 1 Now the Philistines gathered together all their hosts､ towards Aphek,—and the Israelites were encamping by the fountain､ that is in Jezreel.

content: 2 And the lords of the Philistines were passing on by hundreds､ and by thousands,—but David and his men were passing on in the rear､ with Achish.
content_old: 2 And the lords of the Philistines were passing on by hundreds､ and by thousands,—but David and his men were passing on in the rear､ with Achish.

content: 3 Then said the princes of the Philistines, What are these Hebrews doing? And Achish said unto the princes of the Philistines— Is not this David､ servant of Saul､ king of Israel､ who hath been with me this year､ or two, and I have found in him nothing, from the day of his coming over unto me unto this day?
content_old: 3 Then said the princes of the Philistines, What are these Hebrews doing? And Achish said unto the princes of the Philistines— Is not this David､ servant of Saul､ king of Israel､ who hath been with me this year､ or two, and I have found in him nothing, from the day of his coming over unto me unto this day?

content: 4 But the princes of the Philistines raged against him､ and the princes of the Philistines said unto him— Let the man go back､ that he may return unto the place which thou didst appoint him, and let him not go down with us､ into battle, so shall he not become to us a traitor､ in the battle,—for wherewith should this fellow gain favour with his lord? Would it not be with the heads of those men?
content_old: 4 But the princes of the Philistines raged against him､ and the princes of the Philistines said unto him— Let the man go back､ that he may return unto the place which thou didst appoint him, and let him not go down with us､ into battle, so shall he not become to us a traitor､ in the battle,—for wherewith should this fellow gain favour with his lord? Would it not be with the heads of those men?

content: 5 Is not this David, of whom they made responses in the dances､ saying,— Saul hath smitten his thousands, But David his tens of thousands?
content_old: 5 Is not this David, of whom they made responses in the dances､ saying,— Saul hath smitten his thousands, But David his tens of thousands?

content: 6 So Achish called for David､ and said unto him— By the life of Yahweh surely upright thou art､ and pleasing in mine eyes have been thy going out and thy coming in with me､ in the host, for I have found in thee no wrong, from the day of thy coming in unto me､ until this day,—but in the eyes of the lords displeasing thou art.
content_old: 6 So Achish called for David､ and said unto him— By the life of Yahweh surely upright thou art､ and pleasing in mine eyes have been thy going out and thy coming in with me､ in the host, for I have found in thee no wrong, from the day of thy coming in unto me､ until this day,—but in the eyes of the lords displeasing thou art.

content: 7 Now therefore､ return, and go in peace,—so shalt thou not do wrong in the eyes of the lords of the Philistines.
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ return, and go in peace,—so shalt thou not do wrong in the eyes of the lords of the Philistines.

content: 8 Then said David unto Achish— But what have I done? and what hast thou found in thy servant, from the day that I came before thee, unto this day,—that I may not go in and fight, with the enemies of my lord the king?
content_old: 8 Then said David unto Achish— But what have I done? and what hast thou found in thy servant, from the day that I came before thee, unto this day,—that I may not go in and fight, with the enemies of my lord the king?

content: 9 Then answered Achish､ and said unto David, I acknowledge that pleasing thou art in mine eyes､ as a messenger of God,—notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, He shall not go up with us､ into the battle.
content_old: 9 Then answered Achish､ and said unto David, I acknowledge that pleasing thou art in mine eyes､ as a messenger of God,—notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, He shall not go up with us､ into the battle.

content: 10 Now therefore､ rise up early in the morning, thou and the servants of thy lord who have come with thee,—yea as soon as ye have risen early in the morning, and have light then depart.
content_old: 10 Now therefore､ rise up early in the morning, thou and the servants of thy lord who have come with thee,—yea as soon as ye have risen early in the morning, and have light then depart.

content: 1 And it came to pass when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day that the Amalekites had made a raid into the South､ and into Ziklag, and had smitten Ziklag, and burned it with fire;
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day that the Amalekites had made a raid into the South､ and into Ziklag, and had smitten Ziklag, and burned it with fire;

content: 2 and had taken captive the women and all who were therein､ from small even unto great, they had not put one to death,—but had driven them forth､ and gone their way.
content_old: 2 and had taken captive the women and all who were therein､ from small even unto great, they had not put one to death,—but had driven them forth､ and gone their way.

content: 3 So when David and his men came to the city lo! it was burnt with fire,—and their wives､ and their sons､ and their daughters had been taken captive.
content_old: 3 So when David and his men came to the city lo! it was burnt with fire,—and their wives､ and their sons､ and their daughters had been taken captive.

content: 4 Then David and the people that were with him lifted up their voice､ and wept,—until they had no more strength to weep.
content_old: 4 Then David and the people that were with him lifted up their voice､ and wept,—until they had no more strength to weep.

content: 5 And the two wives of David had been taken captive,—Ahinoam､ the Jezreelitess, and Abigail､ wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
content_old: 5 And the two wives of David had been taken captive,—Ahinoam､ the Jezreelitess, and Abigail､ wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

content: 6 And David was in sore distress, for the people had spoken of stoning him, because the souls of all the people were embittered, every man for his own sons and for his own daughters,—but David emboldened himself in Yahweh his God.
content_old: 6 And David was in sore distress, for the people had spoken of stoning him, because the souls of all the people were embittered, every man for his own sons and for his own daughters,—but David emboldened himself in Yahweh his God.

content: 7 Then said David to Abiathar the priest､ son of Ahimelech, Do bring near me､ I pray thee､the ephod. So Abiathar brought near the ephod､ unto David.
content_old: 7 Then said David to Abiathar the priest､ son of Ahimelech, Do bring near me､ I pray thee､the ephod. So Abiathar brought near the ephod､ unto David.

content: 8 And David enquired of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I pursue this troop? shall I overtake it? And he said unto him: Pursue, for thou shalt overtake､ and thou shalt rescue.
content_old: 8 And David enquired of Yahweh､ saying, Shall I pursue this troop? shall I overtake it? And he said unto him: Pursue, for thou shalt overtake､ and thou shalt rescue.

content: 9 So David went､ he､ and the six hundred men､ who were with him, and they came in as far as the ravine of Besor,—where they who had to be left behind stayed.
content_old: 9 So David went､ he､ and the six hundred men､ who were with him, and they came in as far as the ravine of Besor,—where they who had to be left behind stayed.

content: 10 But David pursued, he､ and four hundred men,—but the two hundred men stayed, because they were too wearied to cross over the ravine of Besor.
content_old: 10 But David pursued, he､ and four hundred men,—but the two hundred men stayed, because they were too wearied to cross over the ravine of Besor.

content: 11 And they found an Egyptian in the field, and took him unto David,—and gave him food､ and he did eat, and they gave him water to drink;
content_old: 11 And they found an Egyptian in the field, and took him unto David,—and gave him food､ and he did eat, and they gave him water to drink;

content: 12 and they gave him a piece of a cake of figs､ and two cakes of raisins､ and when he had eaten his spirit came back unto him,��for he had neither eaten food､ nor drunk water, three days and three nights.
content_old: 12 and they gave him a piece of a cake of figs､ and two cakes of raisins､ and when he had eaten his spirit came back unto him,��for he had neither eaten food､ nor drunk water, three days and three nights.

content: 13 Then David said to him— Whose art thou? and whence art thou? And he said, A young man of Egypt am I, servant to an Amalekite, and my lord left me behind､ because I fell sick､ three days ago.
content_old: 13 Then David said to him— Whose art thou? and whence art thou? And he said, A young man of Egypt am I, servant to an Amalekite, and my lord left me behind､ because I fell sick､ three days ago.

content: 14 As for us we invaded the South of the Cherithites､ and against that which pertaineth unto Judah､ and against the South of Caleb,—and Ziklag burned we with fire.
content_old: 14 As for us we invaded the South of the Cherithites､ and against that which pertaineth unto Judah､ and against the South of Caleb,—and Ziklag burned we with fire.

content: 15 And David said unto him, Wilt thou bring me down unto this troop? And he said— Swear unto me by God､ that thou wilt not put me to death､ neither wilt thou surrender me into the hand of my lord, and I will bring thee down unto this troop.
content_old: 15 And David said unto him, Wilt thou bring me down unto this troop? And he said— Swear unto me by God､ that thou wilt not put me to death､ neither wilt thou surrender me into the hand of my lord, and I will bring thee down unto this troop.

content: 16 So he brought him down, and lo! they were left to themselves over the face of all the land,—eating､ and drinking､ and dancing around, for all the great spoil which they had taken out of the land of the Philistines､ and out of the land of Judah.
content_old: 16 So he brought him down, and lo! they were left to themselves over the face of all the land,—eating､ and drinking､ and dancing around, for all the great spoil which they had taken out of the land of the Philistines､ and out of the land of Judah.

content: 17 And David smote them､ from the closing twilight even unto the evening of the next day,—and there escaped not of them a man, save four hundred young men who rode upon camels､ and fled.
content_old: 17 And David smote them､ from the closing twilight even unto the evening of the next day,—and there escaped not of them a man, save four hundred young men who rode upon camels､ and fled.

content: 18 And David rescued all whom the Amalekites had taken,—his two wives also did David rescue;
content_old: 18 And David rescued all whom the Amalekites had taken,—his two wives also did David rescue;

content: 19 and there was nothing missing to them—whether small or great, whether spoil､ or sons or daughters, or any thing which they had taken unto themselves,—the whole did David recover.
content_old: 19 and there was nothing missing to them—whether small or great, whether spoil､ or sons or daughters, or any thing which they had taken unto themselves,—the whole did David recover.

content: 20 And David took all the flocks and the herds,—they drave them before those other cattle, and they said, This is David’s spoil.
content_old: 20 And David took all the flocks and the herds,—they drave them before those other cattle, and they said, This is David’s spoil.

content: 21 And David came unto the two hundred men､ who had been too wearied to follow David､ and whom they had suffered to remain at the ravine of Besor,—and they came forth to meet David, and to meet the people who were with him, and when David came near unto the people, they enquired of his success.
content_old: 21 And David came unto the two hundred men､ who had been too wearied to follow David､ and whom they had suffered to remain at the ravine of Besor,—and they came forth to meet David, and to meet the people who were with him, and when David came near unto the people, they enquired of his success.

content: 22 Then responded every man who was bad and abandoned､ from among the men who had been with David, and said— Because they went not with me there shall not be given them of the spoil that we have rescued,—save to every man his wife and his children, let them put them forth､ then､ and go.
content_old: 22 Then responded every man who was bad and abandoned､ from among the men who had been with David, and said— Because they went not with me there shall not be given them of the spoil that we have rescued,—save to every man his wife and his children, let them put them forth､ then､ and go.

content: 23 Then said David, Ye shall not do so､ my brethren,—with that which Yahweh hath given to us､ who hath preserved us, and delivered the troop that came against us into our hand.
content_old: 23 Then said David, Ye shall not do so､ my brethren,—with that which Yahweh hath given to us､ who hath preserved us, and delivered the troop that came against us into our hand.

content: 24 Who indeed､ could hearken unto you, in this matter? Surely like the share of him that went down into the battle even so shall be the share of him that remained by the stores—alike shall they share.
content_old: 24 Who indeed､ could hearken unto you, in this matter? Surely like the share of him that went down into the battle even so shall be the share of him that remained by the stores—alike shall they share.

content: 25 And so it came to pass from that day forward that he appointed it､ for a statute and for a custom unto Israel, until this day.
content_old: 25 And so it came to pass from that day forward that he appointed it､ for a statute and for a custom unto Israel, until this day.

content: 26 And when David came to Ziklag he sent of the spoil､ unto the elders of Judah､ unto his friends､ saying,— Lo! for you a blessing, out of the spoil of the enemies of Yahweh:
content_old: 26 And when David came to Ziklag he sent of the spoil､ unto the elders of Judah､ unto his friends､ saying,— Lo! for you a blessing, out of the spoil of the enemies of Yahweh:

content: 27 to them who were in Bethel､ and to them who were in Ramoth of the South､ and to them who were in Jattir,
content_old: 27 to them who were in Bethel､ and to them who were in Ramoth of the South､ and to them who were in Jattir,

content: 28 and to them who were in Aroer､ and to them who were in Siphmoth､ and to them who were in Eshtemoa,
content_old: 28 and to them who were in Aroer､ and to them who were in Siphmoth､ and to them who were in Eshtemoa,

content: 29 and to them who were in Racal､ and to them who were in the cities of the Jerameelites､ and to them who were in the cities of the Kenites,
content_old: 29 and to them who were in Racal､ and to them who were in the cities of the Jerameelites､ and to them who were in the cities of the Kenites,

content: 30 and to them who were in Hormah､ and to them who were in Cor-ashan､ and to them who were in Athach,
content_old: 30 and to them who were in Hormah､ and to them who were in Cor-ashan､ and to them who were in Athach,

content: 1 Now as the Philistines were fighting against Israel the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell slain､ in Mount Gilboa.
content_old: 1 Now as the Philistines were fighting against Israel the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell slain､ in Mount Gilboa.

content: 2 And the Philistines followed hard after Saul､ and after his sons,—and the Philistines smote Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchishua､ sons of Saul.
content_old: 2 And the Philistines followed hard after Saul､ and after his sons,—and the Philistines smote Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchishua､ sons of Saul.

content: 3 And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers discovered him,—and he was terrified at the archers.
content_old: 3 And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers discovered him,—and he was terrified at the archers.

content: 4 Then said Saul to his armourbearer— Draw thy sword and pierce me through therewith､ lest these uncircumcised come､ and pierce me through､ and abuse me. But his armourbearer was not willing, for he was sore afraid. So Saul took his sword and fell thereon.
content_old: 4 Then said Saul to his armourbearer— Draw thy sword and pierce me through therewith､ lest these uncircumcised come､ and pierce me through､ and abuse me. But his armourbearer was not willing, for he was sore afraid. So Saul took his sword and fell thereon.

content: 5 And when his armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead he also fell upon his sword､ and died with him.
content_old: 5 And when his armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead he also fell upon his sword､ and died with him.

content: 6 Thus died Saul､ and his three sons､ and his armour-bearer､ yea all his men､ on that day､ together.
content_old: 6 Thus died Saul､ and his three sons､ and his armour-bearer､ yea all his men､ on that day､ together.

content: 7 And when the men of Israel who were across the vale､ and who were across the Jordan､ saw that the men of Israel had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead they forsook the cities､ and fled, and the Philistines entered､ and took up their abode therein.
content_old: 7 And when the men of Israel who were across the vale､ and who were across the Jordan､ saw that the men of Israel had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead they forsook the cities､ and fled, and the Philistines entered､ and took up their abode therein.

content: 8 And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain that they found Saul､ and his three sons, lying prostrate in Mount Gilboa.
content_old: 8 And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain that they found Saul､ and his three sons, lying prostrate in Mount Gilboa.

content: 9 So they cut off his head, and stripped off his armour,—and sent throughout the land of the Philistines round about､ to publish it in the house of their idols､ and unto the people.
content_old: 9 So they cut off his head, and stripped off his armour,—and sent throughout the land of the Philistines round about､ to publish it in the house of their idols､ and unto the people.

content: 10 And they put his armour in a house of Ashtoreths,—and his dead body fastened they on the wall of Beth-shan.
content_old: 10 And they put his armour in a house of Ashtoreths,—and his dead body fastened they on the wall of Beth-shan.

content: 11 And when the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead heard concerning him what the Philistines had done unto Saul
content_old: 11 And when the inhabitants of Jabeshgilead heard concerning him what the Philistines had done unto Saul

content: 12 then arose all the men of valour､ and journeyed all the night, and took the body of Saul､ and the bodies of his sons, from the wall of Beth-shan,—and came to Jabesh, and burned them there;
content_old: 12 then arose all the men of valour､ and journeyed all the night, and took the body of Saul､ and the bodies of his sons, from the wall of Beth-shan,—and came to Jabesh, and burned them there;
